2,934 produits enregistrés
0
8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
72.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 septembre 2019
I'm having a hard time understanding why people hate on this game so much.

I picked it up a few days ago and got instantly hooked. I've almost 30 hours on record by now and have not encountered a singe bug (minor or otherwise). There are indeed some minor optimization issues when looting certain containers, but honestly, I'm so caught up in the game's atmosphere and environment that I hardly even notice.

I'll go through my thoughts on this game, starting with the pros.

The pros:
- Fun and rewarding exploration system. I love being reminded of that old school RPG feeling of finding a hidden path. You just know there's gonna be something good at the end of it. And this game delivers on that aspect over and over again.

- Not open world. Crazy, right? I've nothing against open world games, as long as it's well executed. And there's plenty of games out there that offer you an open, yet empty and static world. So static that you'd think it's dead. Not this one though. Paths are blocked in the traditional "way stronger enemy than you can possibly face at this point" method, which, and maybe that's the nostalgia talking, but I honestly love. You just know that at some point you'll have a shot at kicking that things' ass, and every levelup is a step closer towards that goal. This world feels alive and your actions have impact. It's a very good example of quality over quantity.

- Builds can get diverse. There's some versatility to your classes and you can plan out your party composition ahead of time. It doesn't go to crazy depths, which means that it also doesn't overwhelm the player. Also, you don't *have* to min-max.

- Great combat. I've seen people say that it gets repetitive after a while, and I can understand why. Personally though, I play with permadeath enabled and on the hardest difficulty, and I think that's how the game is meant to be played. Every decision you made, whether it's during combat, during gear shopping, during exploration even, takes on a whole new form and opens an entirely new dimension. And I think that's the difference. You will not autopilot through the game if you play it with an understanding that dead is, in fact, *dead*. And it's been so incredibly fun so far. I've just beat my first major boss battle as of writing this review, and I was at the edge of my seat because I had no idea what it was capable of. It really does make you feel like an adventurer wondering into the unknown.

- The crafting system. I find that crafting in games is usually either immediately overpowered, or underwhelming and generally useless. However, in this case it's actually enjoyable. *Crafting* food to replenish health, alcohol for your bards to get drunk on during combat for various benefits, or even adventuring tools like lockpicks and grappling hooks. I've found myself using it a lot and it's been a lot of fun.

- Puzzles. I'm not a puzzle fan. Every time I come across puzzles in a game I'm like *here we go again with this crap*. And The Bards Tale has a *lot* of them. *A lot*. But! for once, they're quite enjoyable. They didn't go crazy on the difficulty, they don't get overly cryptic, and there's usually clues very close at hand. There's also an option to disable and bypass them completely when starting the game if that's your thing, and I was tempted to take it before even knowing exactly what kind of puzzles these were. I'm glad I didn't.

- Fantastic sound track and environmental effects.

- Good, lighthearted humor.

The ♥♥♥♥:
- Character customization. Very underwhelming. I love the voices, and I immediately recognized the iconic voice of the Red Prince from Divinity: Original Sin 2. I didn't even bother checking the rest until later on in the game. However, there's very little in terms of character aesthetics. Somewhere down the line you get the option to hire a new companion and get to customize them. I tried to model it after my girlfriend and I had a really big *wtf* moment when I realized that there is no preset for a brunette female human. I mean you have redhead, blonde, even a white haired one, but not a brunette. How is that a thing?

That's pretty much it to be honest. My only complaint regarding this title.

Don't be fooled by the reviews. This IS a good game. It's not from a AAA company, it's not The Witcher 3. But *it is* a damn good game that puts other, big developers to shame. Looking at you, BioWare.
 
RC
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
80.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2020
Bard's Tale IV is honestly one of the best RPGs I've played in a thousand years. Its story is rich and beautifully told; the levelling system is complex and powerful; the combat system is -- well, I'm not expert on combat; the puzzles -- that's what this game is at its heart, a puzzle game with environments and levelling. And it does not disappoint. Combat is done strategically, which makes it a puzzle with advancement. There are tile rotation puzzles; circuitry puzzles; pressure plate puzzles; clockwork puzzles. The maps are varied, and come off as mazes. And the environments are rich with colour and ambience.

Bard's Tale IV is essentially a reboot of a trilogy of games for the Apple Lisa, with a port to the Commodore 64. I've played a little bit of a remaster of the first game, and it's so mind-boggling the difference in what was thought to be a game then, and what is now. Not just in technology, but in the very idea of what a game is.

This game tells the tale of a band of heroes saving the world -- standard fare. It's not a nuanced story, but it is a lovingly told one. The developers of this game really had a care for this world they were working in.

And the music! The music, friends! I have seldom loved videogame music this much. Live singers singing Gaelic songs of old. What a mood!

Well, that's all well and good, but now for the downsides.

The controls are wonky, especially in combat. You'll get used to them, but it's pretty annoying, especially when you mess up.

The 3D models are lacking in liveliness, approaching the uncanny valley close-up. Just don't look, and you'll be fine.

The game froze a number of times for unknown reasons.

And most importantly, there is a game-breaking bug in one dungeon that allows you to use a key on an a door that takes you upstairs. But you need that key to get further in, and it doesn't respawn. Beware.

Still, I would recommend this game to anyone interested in a exploring a beautifully crafted world with gorgeous music and friendly NPCs. I poured 80 easy hours into this game.
 
zorrina
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
52.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2020
Franchement ce jeu est terrible ! Ca faisait longtemps que je n'avais pas été autant captivé par un RPG, le dernier c'était Divinity Original Sin 2. Et pour la comparaison, ce qui me plaît dans Bard's Tale c'est que contrairement à d'autres titres du genre, la narration n'est pas trop invasive, le gameplay est rythmé par de nombreux combats, des casses têtes etc. Je trouve l'équilibre parfait. En plus de cela l'ambiance pittoresque passant par une bande son très prenante vous plonge dans l'univers, additionné à la vu à la première personne, immersion garantie !

Le jeu à quelques défauts certes, effectivement mal optimisé, maintenant faut pas exagérer, mon PC à 6 ans, et je tourne le jeu en ultra, donc vraiment les personnes qui se plaignent achetez-vous un ordi, il est temps !
Parfois quelques bugs oui (par exemple le passage aux compétences tiers 2 qui est bugué !) , c'est pas le plus beau jeu qu'on ait vu c'est sûr, notamment la modélisation des persos. Maintenant je préfère un jeu comme ça qui vous prend, vous embarque dans son aventure, avec un gameplay intéressant et diversifié qu'un jeu au design et à la technique parfaite dont on se lasserai dès la première heure, et j'en ai vu des jeux comme ça !
Ca manque aussi un peu de personnalisation au niveau des personnages. Ils ont pris les mêmes archétypes de perso pour les trois races humaines, c 'est un peu se tourner les pouces les gars !

Un petit mot sur l'évaluation négative de Neskouik, car elle me fait vraiment rire, il parle des PNJ qui vendent des objets à 430po et ensuite racheté à 12po, en fait dans TOUS les jeux vidéos c'est comme ça lol RPG, hacknslash MMO, les vendeurs sont des gros arnaqueurs, bienvenue dans le monde du jeu vidéo jeune padawan ! Il parle ensuite du loot en disant que le risque n'est pas récompensé. C'est un tour par tour, qui récompense un combat intelligent et méthodique, si vous battez un groupe de mob avec le moins de tour possible, sans perdre un héro, vous aurez un gros loot, si vous mettez 40 tours à tuer un pauvre mob, vous n'aurez rien, car vous avez mal joué. Bientôt il faudra des primes de risque dans le jeu vidéo XD C'est un jeu stratégique, si votre équipe est mal construite et ne vous permet pas d'optimiser vos coups, vous allez avoir des difficultés.

Pour conclure, Bard's Tale IV est un jeu avec beaucoup de charme, un très gros potentiel, avec de nombreux builds et compositions d'équipe possible, un jeu très riche qui me promet encore de longues heures d'amusement. Des qualités qui font largement oublier ses quelques défauts techniques. Un jeu qui peu être exigeant et tactique, mais pas injuste comme on peut l'entendre. J'espère sincèrement qu'on aura droit à un 5ème opus, je ne connaissais pas la licence, c'est un gros coup de coeur. Si vous aimez les RPG et les tour par tour, que vous avez un PC décent et que vous n'êtes pas dans l'attente d'un Divinity 2 graphiquement, si vous êtes à la recherche d'un jeu qui a une vraie âme, allez-y !
 
Guren

Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2022
Einfaches super geniales ADND mit rundenbasiertem Kampf.

Ich liebe die Vielfältigkeit an Kampfausprägungen der Helden.
Ob mit Barde oder ohne, wie klassisch mit Kämpfern, Dieben und Zauberern, dass Spiel ist vielseitig machbar und bietet immer Möglichkeiten durch Rücksetzen der Fertigkeiten.

Lies meine Guide für mehr Gold, um neue Token zum Rücksetzen zu bekommen(Schrein der Zwerge > 1000 Gold ofpern).

Hoffe, im nächsten Teil kommen wieder neue Klassen und Ausprägungen dazu.

Hf Credo

79.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2020
(Пройдена на Windows 7 не смотря на отсутствие её в списке поддерживаемых.)

7.3/10 стоит того, чтобы поиграть, если нравится жанр.
Игра состоит на 40% из пошаговых боев (со своими особенностями), на 40% из головоломок (но их можно "пропускать", если вы пришли не за ними) и на 20% из исследования (лабиринтов коридоров и комнат). Визуально игра не ААА, но локации чем дальше по сюжету, тем симпатичнее, и уже не пугают своим видом так, как начальная. :)

p.s. Это не РПГ, это партийный Dungeon crawler. Здесь вы не найдете возможности повлиять на диалог, да и диалоги это лишь небольшой список вопросов для получения информации. Вариативности нет и не обещалось. :) Поэтому если от РПГ вам нужны прокачка, собирание шмота и бои - то их вы получите. А если наличие выборы и отыгрывание характера - то нет. ;)

Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2022
之前因为走格子的动画会晕3d就一直拖着没打，最近在对某出圈cprg的dlc大失所望后回来捡起TBT玩，啊，这才是我想玩的解谜…………新冰城可以不用走格子，比老三部的上手难度低了很多，但其实还是有一定难度的。剧本玩到现在感觉是中规中矩，毕竟crpg里剧本牛的太多了。音乐很好听，哼小调解谜这个设定太喜欢了！

不过我觉得适宜人群仅限于巫术之类的Dungeon Crawler爱好者，和老博德、PST、老辐射之类的俯角crpg还是有许多差别的。买豪华版，inXile难得良心的extra有送老三部的重制，还有歌词本诶

0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2023
Game still needs these dlc:
1) More background music (and music in general) for variance in song when wandering around (some of the
repetitive ones give me a headache)

2) The elven city (needs more merchants in general as well, this is where it'd be easiest to add them).

3) The shipwreck full of treasure that the Razer seller talks about in the Weyr (a Dungeon).

4) overhauled and/or a better restocking means on merchants


Pros:
Absolutely incredible graphics
Great music

♥♥♥♥:
Just about everything else after you've gotten some twenty hours in...


I'll start with the interface. In short, an attempt to finesse a simple and limited layout so as not to detract from the awesome graphics on screen led to a completely inefficient interface that was way too limiting for this game imo. More than once, due to lack of a border, mistrokes on what I was doing took place and in addition a potential means of using and expanding upon secondary skills was unavailable.


Things the game could use:
Armor overhaul - the sheer reliance on armor rend and the mental damage mechanic was disappointing.
Character secondary/mastery overhaul - too many of the otherwise high-quality unique gear types became crap by overwritingmy limited skill slots.

Return of the monk and hunter - It's not the Bard's Tale without them.

Elven Weapon overhaul - something like you find the puzzle with the power, have to unlock it with seeds and solving, then spend shards to turn it into a typed weapon (longsword, arming sword, short bow, etc. with the additional effects thereof)

A few solo opportunities for each class.

Possible Bard's Tale V: War of the Gods scenario -
Kept items via save - Cordesmania, Cloak of the Obsidian Order, Ulstrigg Bastard Sword, Existential Crisis
Quests given per item possessed: 1 for each of the dwarven rainbow weapons.


Just make it so that the entirety of #4 was a dream (which means the characters you used/made are importable) that the creatures were trying to use to bring life back to their dungeons and thus open a way back into the world.

Personally, Mangar should have been trying to keep the rift sealed given the spells he created were available to the adventurers and that the dwarves/elves were not allies to the players in the first game. I personally find it amusing that the orcs completely disappeared.
 
gallaghan2000

13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
21.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2020
Okay, let's try some other format for a change. I'm too bored with this game to try harder. I went into it hoping to be the Devil's advocate, but ended up being disappointed like many others. Not to the point of raging, mind you. Knowing the series' history, I didn't have high hopes to begin with. The fact that I got it from a bundle also helps.

Pros:
- It plays a lot like Might & Magic 6-8 (these are the ones I played at least) while not being half as epic, however. Exploration in search of better loot is your main occupation, which alone made me play this for many hours, I like that stuff. Not the plot or the dialogues, they're so-so and don't really matter since the game is closer to a dungeon crawler than anything else.
- I know that it was a disaster at launch (like all games from inXile), but I got lucky and the game never bugged out or crashed even once. My friend wasn't so lucky, for him it crashed a couple of times in the same 20 hours, so there's that. Not the worst score either way, but playing using them save stones only is a bad idea.
- I liked the dungeons and the puzzles are fine. Dunno why people hated them since they're the best part of the game. Not too difficult, not completely dumb - a cute distraction. Maybe they become frustrating later in the game though.
- It can look really good when it tries, even though the looks are inconsistent.
- In moderation, the combat is entertaining and generally well-done. Being a connoisseur of everything turn-based, I rather enjoyed it while the aforementioned moderation lasted.
- The skill system is alright. Not that diverse, but fun to use.
- The attempts at seeming oldschool are more endearing than frustrating.

♥♥♥♥:
- On Hard, the fights take too long, there were more and more of them as the game progressed, up to the point where it became exhausting. Soon enough, they started to repeat themselves all too often, it felt like I was fighting the same fight over and over again without having to change my tactics even for the bosses. Switching to Normal made things too easy and easy fights automatically devalue the loot you find. Hard and exhausting or easy and meaningless? What an awful dilemma!
- I already told you that exploration with the purpose of looting stuff to help you in combat is the main occupation here. Now imagine that you don't even need most of the stuff you find because of the reasons listed above and will never use it. The numerous consumables, the crafting system itself, all these neat secret stashes - they just don't matter. Experience the existential crisis that this game incited in me.
- Back to the inconsistent looks. I wish the game would start you off in such a beautiful location as the Inshriach Forest instead of these ugly ass sewer-caves or the badly optimized town of unsightly crates and barrels. But it doesn't, you will have to play for 10 hours or so just to see something beautiful for the first time. And on stills everything looks much better than in motion.
- I like a good dad joke but in this game 99% of them fell flat for me. It would be tolerable if not for all the over-acting, which, in turn, made me wanna scream "SHUT UP!" when any of the game's characters opened their stupid, loud mouths.
- You're not allowed to place your own markers on the map for some reason. You can pick an option to draw the map yourself, but why would you. Circling through every location again after getting a new song is tedious and only inevitably made me notice more jank each time.
- I also absolutely detested every song that played, tried not to stay for long in places that had them on loop. I guess I'm not a fan of Scottish/Celtic folk, dunno. Or just these particular songs, which is more plausible. Very subjective, I know.

Unlike a previous attempt at reviving Bard's Tale, this one is not beyond redemption, but it's definitely not for me. I still love you, inXile!

My curator
 
Maggerama
1,225 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1,036.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2021
Анализ и препарирование тела бедного малыша
Делать детальный разбор самих механик игры, играбельности и продукта как такового в этом обзоре я не намерена.
Перечислю лишь слабые и сильные стороны проекта и мой взгляд на них:
1 Отличная визуальная составляющая, подразумевающая скорее любование средой, нежели прошивку восприятия игрока неким включением в игровой мир (отсутствие "оружия" в "руках", неких объектов якобы тела которые могли бы проникать в кадр, отношений тела и пространства и тд. Акцент на вуайеристкой позиции изучения взглядом). С одной стороны это отличная условно гомогенная картинка позволяющая отдохнуть от динамики боя (который как раз наполнен достаточными массивами информации), с другой стороны игрок привыкший к бесконечным цифрам и доп данным просто заскучает.
2 Звук и музыкальное сопровождение все так же на высоте, в некоторых местах буквально мурашки бегут по коже от наслаждения включенностью в процесс игры и огромная доля этого удовольствия приходится именно на звук.
3 Система "персонажа". Достаточно шаблонная система прокачки персонажей, крайне ригидная и разбавленная скучными статами (для придания иллюзии разнообразия и вариативности, якобыбалансировка). Да, у игрока есть выбор, но он призрачен и недолговечен. В системах прокачки персонажа мне всегда вспоминается второй аддон Ночей Невервинтера котому уже более 17 лет. За это время можно было бы уже предложить интересные ходы, а не пользоваться шаблонными академическими цепочками.
4 Сюжет и его подача хоть и прописаны с известной долей явно читаемого пафоса и идеалистичности, не блещет уникальностью и высоким уровнем проработки, но он остается интересным и местами даже вполне себе сносным.
Второй пятой ахиллеса идут его невариативность и рамочность. Но это уже проблемы самого выбранного стиля и средств. Тем не менее аддоны (даже в данном исполнении) могли бы заново освежить старые локации, включить новые пространства и вознести игру на действительно достойный уровень интересности. Благо данный продукт обладает всеми задатками для таких движений.
5 Классическая проблема игр данной студии- сырые на старте и вполне милые в "директорской обрезке" - по данному поводу я могу развести лишь руками. Наиграв по два полных прохождения в обе версии игры могу заявить с уверенностью, что режиссерская версия (конечно же невероятно отличная от обычной по всем показателям) действительно заслуживает внимания игрока и может дать ему приятное времяпрепровождение, изи гейм. Это не фрустрирующая гонка за достижениями или соревнование с другим игроком ради фикции социального признания, а прямой путь наслаждения доброфентезийной цифровой едой.

Почему данная игра не попала в широкий тираж? На мой взгляд именно из-за описанных выше топическим моментов. И не в последнюю очередь по причине того, что игра отсылает нас к позитивистской сказке, нежели к современной капиталистической парадигме постБалабановского мира. То есть: в игре нет мазохизма в частности и контента общества тотального невроза (наслаждения и повторения) в общем, что уже понижает интерес к игре среднестатистическим взрослым-ребенком (делаю акцент именно на инфантильного взрослого так как именно он покупает игры и именно он не желает играть в уровень ребенка-ребенка, а желает видеть уровень настоящего взрослого-взрослого). Такому человеку интересны страдания, убийства и мучения 21+ (в том числе психического формата), а данная игра дает лишь крайне кастрированный заменитель тройной цензуры.
Почему хороший проект мертворожден? (где аддоны и тд?) По описанной выше причине, все это нацелено на детей которые уже стали взрослыми и хотят вспомнить события 30и летней давности, и на детей которые верят в зубную фею. Открепленность от реальности (внимание-только в символическом купированном регистре) уже не делает чести игре. Тут нет описанных выше прелестей и значит и не будет выхлопа. Если бы Фарго решил выпустить аддон кардинально меняющий саму суть игры, переписать сюжет, персонажей и откорректировать все в стилистике уровня описанной выше жестокости (как минимум не визуального исполнения, а имплицитного) то это и вдохнуло бы новую жизнь игре и дало свою аудиторию.
 
Lollifox

Évaluation publiée le 25 janvier 2020
Зачем было убирать поддержку Windows 7 ? Вопрос не риторический и имеет чёткий ответ - microsoft скупает не удавшиеся проекты , а -ля EGS , чтобы продвигать 10 - ую операционную систему. То есть , никаких технических оснований к запрету - нет , и всё обусловлено лишь страхом перед банкротством самих inXile Entertainment .
Теперь, многие люди просто не смогут купить/поиграть из-за операционной системы , в то же время те , кто уже купил , также остались в дураках, ибо обновление не даёт им запустить игру . Что является просто наплевательским отношением к людям , благодаря которым игра вообще вышла в свет , так как собирали на неё с добровольных пожертвований на kickstarter .

Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2019
I bought this game on launch and put quite a few hours in, I love InXile and I love their vision so I was happy to hear they'd be optimizing and implementing features(like controller support) for a directors cut, so I held off on playing until it was released. I finally have time to play it again and nothing works, the controller isn't implemented properly and/or doesn't work at all, I cant even use a mouse on the options menu in game, I have to windows out to shut it down. I had such high hopes for this game and I love what this company is trying to do but I can't recommend Bard's Tale 4 to anyone in this state. I hope they can work all these kinks out

Recommandé
65.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2020
Not bad, but get it on sale.

The combat system is interesting, but the difficulty with foes is uneven. Most fights are easy, and you need to crank up the difficulty for a challenge. Except the boss fights, which you'll need to set the difficulty down.

Also, doesn't really feel like a Bard's Tale. It's got references left and right, but the character generation, fight system, and dungeons are completely different. You can't just roll character after character. Also, the elves and dwarves look odd, and what the heck is a trow? The character classes and races have been greatly reduced. The fight system change isn't really bad, but it's different from BT 1 - 3. Most notably, the magic system, which is completely different. And the dungeons are more of an amusement park ride (on rails).

The puzzles are nice, but get repetitive and even annoying late game. I found myself rushing through the last couple of quests, just to get the game over. It was still worth the time, but get it on sale.
 
LordSkippy

Recommandé
76.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2019
6/10...
Directors Cut HUGE improvement over launch day.
both in content, polish, and performance.
enjoyed the story, combat, and over all adventure.
but not without flaws...

Pros:
a unique adventure
some new ways of doing old things
good voice acting (some great banter while traveling)
combat that is different, challenging, and easy to learn
lots of puzzles to mix things up
all quest meaningful and story driven.. no fetch quest
some good skill trees and class skills.
most enemies and monsters very well done
enjoyed the music and atmosphere.

♥♥♥♥:
did not feel like a true Bard Tale successor
earlier versions LOTS of humor and sarcasm. that WAS their core and staple...
this one MUCH more serious with minimal humor.
L O T S of puzzles to test your patience (more than all my previous 25 gaming years combined)
most intuitive, many are not to an extreme... NO idea how anyone was to rationally solve some.
puzzles W A Y over done... FAR toooooo many for my taste (literally EVERYTHING had puzzles, ugh)
combat buggy.. animations don't play, sound out of sync with actions, characters that 'die' but remain in combat taunting you
however they cannot be targeted and cannot do damage, mental attacks sometimes do physical damage.. or no damage,
a few times when combat started enemies not on playing grid.. could not be targeted, a few times when combat ended i was placed in positions where i could not move. a few times combat just ended... i won, but no exit screen showing kills and xp.
targeting enemy or ally often difficult.. you WILL make mistakes targeting!
walking buggy.. got stuck a few times requiring reload of earlier save... not while exploring, just walking on main path.
talking buggy.. a couple conversations that did NOT go as planned.. or as scripted.. game froze. reload save.
graphics and character animations dated... most textures barely 1080p... some appear very sub par.
at times felt like i was walking through QUAKE or DOOM from 1980.
definitely NOT 4K friendly lol

Overall, a hard one to recommend.
despite the flaws, bugs, and neverending-puzzles-from-hell-around-every-corner...
still enjoyed most of it!

 
sKorpion

63.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 février 2021
Прошел сие творение. Если кратко: 7,5/10 баллов.
Интересный мир и лор, хотя вариативности никакой нет, так и должно быть в данном жанре, но создается ощущение, что мир живой. Словно ты лишь часть огромного мира, где все идет своим чередом без тебя (до поры, до времени). Похожее ощущение вызывал Ведьмак 3.
Играть увлекательно, красивые виды, хоть и со фризами (об этом позже), хватает загадок-головоломок, решать которые несложно. Уровень сложности "пятиклассник на школьной олимпиаде". Чувствуешь себя крутым. Если что, почти все загадки можно отключить, но необходимость в этом нет.
Неплохая прокачка персонажей, несколько классов. Боевка интересная, словно решаешь очередную головоломку, создавая комбинации для уничтожения, как пример, всех скелетов за ход, чтобы они не могли воскрешать друг-друга.
Приз зрительских симпатий: эльфийское оружие. Его можно прокачивать, внимательно рассматривая, находя головоломки, решая их и, в конечном итоге, вставляя волшебные камешки, получать новые способности. Это круто.
То были плюсы, теперь по минусам пройдемся.
Оптимизацию завезла тетя Срака, хоть и версия "ножницы директора", игра постоянно фризит, автонастройки помечаются как завышенные, что-то не сходится...
Под конец я устал играть, сюжетка продолжается, а крутых уникальных вещей не очень то и много, да и герои уже все вкачены так, что ничего нового и не нужно, так чисто статы подтягивать.
Ну и сюжетка... всю игру побеждаем зло в чистом виде, и ты думаешь, вот он главгад, потом оказывается, что не он, а следующий главгад, а потом опять не он, а следующий. Хоть бы разнообразие было какое, видимо для этого и завезли загадки и секреты.
Крч, игра хорошая, в таком жанре особо носом вертеть нечего. Я купил ключ за 200 руб и в целом крайне доволен полученным игровым опытом.
П.С. Еще там красиво поют народно-фентезийные песни местные жители.
 
powerjah
838 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
17.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2019
I'm sad to give this one a thumb's down. I really like it--even things that other reviewers don't. It's just a shame that the game won't let me finish it.

The battles are unique--feeling like little, bite-sized chess matches. Balancing a limited choice of abilities to best combine with my teammates, combined with positioning on the grid-based battle system, felt rewarding. New equipment and levels came regularly, and each felt like it expanded my choices meaningfully. The sound and voices are wonderful, and even the dated visuals have their charm. Dungeons are full of puzzles--divisive for some, but I loved them.

Though I have nothing but praise for the game, a mountain of technical flaws has compelled me to uninstall the game. I consider myself to have a reasonably high tolerance for glitches, but the kind I encounter here force me to repeatedly reload the whole game. I've gotten stuck in the environment, faced battles that never end, and crashed again and again. I've probably lost 3 hours from reloading and redoing the same content. After my most recent crash, I've given up. Life's too short.
 
Zednaught

Non recommandé
70.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2019
Grę zakupiłem zaraz po premierze, masa błędow itp... odstawiłem po czasie, wychodziły duże aktualizacje...
Spodziewałem się że directors cut naprawi większość, poprawi UI, tłumaczenia i tak dalej.

Zawiodłem się BARDZO.
Dla uczciwości - nie widziałem już problemów z brakiem tłumaczenia gdzieniegdzie. Ale gra jak łapała zwiechy tak łapie mimo obniżenia grafiki żeby konsolowcy nie płakali. Gra potrafi łapać zadyszke przy otwieraniu okienka ekwipunku itp.
Dodatkowo mase razy musiałem poddawać walkę wczytywać grę bo albo nie da się wybrać postaci albo nagle nie ma ona żadnej umiejętności, albo ma ale cudze... albo ma cudze ale nie da sie zmienić bo nie można otworzyć jej ekwipunku BO NIE i tyle... KOSZMAR po prostu.

Oczywiście sortowania ekwipunku nadal nie ma, bo po co, gracze proszą o to tylko na każdy forum po każdym patchu do gry. Nie, musimy sobie ręcznie przestawiać przedmioty miedzy stronami ekwipunku albo żyć z dziurami i pustymi stronami w ekwipunku.

Oczywiście komunikaty, napisy na ekranie, animacje i efekty w czasie walki są skopane po całości napisy na siebie nachodzą, efekty odpalają sie w byle jakim momencie. Coś wybucha, nic, kilka sekund później postacie obok chwieja sie od wybuchu... wow.

Tyle hejtu na bugi po premierze a twórcy nadal uważają że testerzy to niepotrzebne zło i lepiej wydać hajs na marketing.
 
3mortis
438 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
80.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2020
虽然恼人的缺陷有很多 但如果喜欢欧美奇幻RPG那它绝对是个非常不错的选择 如果像我一样喜欢写实向游戏的话还是不推荐的 但如果想在回合制策略RPG荒的空闲里找个音画动态表现还不错内容充分的最佳首选有野心大作就非它莫属别无选择了 之前玩的旭丽玛就不如这个满足度高^^
首先讲一讲故事方面的表现 游戏里配了很多首歌曲有些非常朴实悦耳 剧本总体来看是偏全年龄向 里面还借鉴了传说系列的角色间闲聊表达手法 旅途中听听他们拌嘴有时候还是蛮有趣的 主线对白简单清晰直给不玩悬念傲娇烧脑等烂大街桥段相当利索 反面导致角色略微缺少人性色彩 角色塑造不够成熟部分故事NPC有工具人之嫌 反倒是不起眼的萝卜包菜桑最后给了我个小惊喜 讲的故事也很不错还送组织传承武器剥皮刀一把 :)
然后是迷宫解密 地图还是相当多样的 有一定的探索乐趣基本好评 场景画面也是算是此类的佼佼者 不过那个游戏外十二星座罗盘八成来自桌游吧 这个查阅流程感觉放游戏内会相对放便一些 毕竟主体已经变成Video Game了就不要偷懒全面跟进嘛 解谜上虽然也狠下功夫 有些还算有点意思 但是时间久了就神烦 而且无处不在简直太多了 后期实在腻歪得开了跳解密小调 XD
再说说RPG系统和战斗相关 升级只加天赋技能点 没有属性提升全靠装备堆 每个角色能装备的主动技能最多只有4个槽大大提高了玩家尝试技能的操作成本 而且有些武器带的主动技能还会踢掉装备技能简直是给人累积压力的好设计 这些都严重影响了技能探索的积极性 部分技能招式动画冗长拖沓降低了爽快感 注重风趣的同时也要考虑下玩家实际大量重复观看的疲劳度嘛 战术性上倒是还可以 虽然有随机触发的部分但不影响策略趣味 装备样式相对于流程来讲有点儿少 数值虽然有随机增减 但用途单一而且设计不够平衡导致很多弱势的类型基本变换金废品 不过我最想吐槽的是有一处99连战实在是太墨迹啦 全是超巨弱的敌人 纯属恶意浪费玩家宝贵时间啊 设计这一战的家伙快拖出去暴打一顿 X(
最后说下 毕竟以上体感因人而异仅供参考 希望你们能玩得比我更开心啦~
 
highgamer

Non recommandé
0.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2020
I was very excited at the Kickstarter campaign for BT4. I had lovingly crafted my graph paper maps when playing BT1 back in the 80s, and while I didn't get into BT2/3, I was looking forward to a new dungeon crawling epic to sink my teeth into. I was initially happy with the remixes of the first game, updated to modern systems, which was a nice nostalgia high and I hoped that was going to be good portents to the new game.

When it was initially released, I was saddened because my system didn't work well with the game at all. It was jaggy, full of lag and frustrating UI that wouldn't work well and I attributed this to the incompatibility with my older system. So when I got a new laptop a couple weeks ago, one of the first things I did was install the director's cut edition. I figured this newer system would be able to handle the game and it would be fun to give it a try.

TBH, I was hoping this would be a bit like Wizardry: Tale of the Forsaken Land with better graphics. After all, that game nails the old school vibe with more modern RPG sentiment, and that was kind of the promise with BT4. After it was installed, I noticed my new computer met the requirements, and while it wasn't at the highest standards, it still exceeded the minimum. The music was fantastic as I started, which seemed promising - like so many things about this game. I decided against the old school movement system, figuring the open movement would work fine. I wandered around the starting area, and while it showed several NPCs wandering doing their thing, few were interactive, and the initial part of the game is kind of a railroad to the adventurer's guild. I found a few things in boxes and then met the beginning plot of the game. Standard fare - the adventurer's guild is attacked by zealots, and when I finally got into the basement, the game really begins and I got started.

I immediately noticed that the movement was irritating as an open move. There were places that seemed obvious I should be able to get to, but could not move past. I changed to classic, and it wasn't much better. When I entered combat, it was not intuitive and just kind of turned into a click and hit blah blah blah system. The graphics seemed like they tried to make this blend of animation and hyperrealism and it fails on both counts.

In the end, I uninstalled it and don't plan on going back. The UI was irritating, the graphics were shoddy, the combat was meh, and it didn't live up to my expectations nor my hopes for nostalgia tinged gaming. I guess I'll just go back to my PS2. At least the soundtrack on BT4 seemed pretty great!
 
viobane
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
106.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2020
This game should have been so much better.

I slogged through it to the end but Haernhold, the optional 'challenge' dungeon, pushed me too far. Even after turning the difficulty down to EASY the enemies were wildly overpowered (I played the rest of the game on HARD). However, it was the last fight that went too far. It was ridiculously difficult and -- best of all -- you COULDN'T LEAVE the area until you won it. I get that its supposed to be a challenge for hardcore players... but while playing on EASY? Complete BS.

This would be fine if it was the only (albeit major) flaw, but the game has SO many other problems: it has terrible performance issues (even two years after launch); the camera has a weird fish-eye effect; the story drags on (and on and on... by at least 20 hours too much); there are SO MANY puzzles; character models are really ugly; visuals swing from gorgeous to mud and back; clunky inventory management... you get the idea.

I've read some of the early reviews and after playing, I really can't image what a piece of crap this must have been at launch. So why did I play so long? It has some really great parts: the music is fantastic, the atmosphere is amazing, game-play is solid (most of the time), the puzzles are fun, the characters are nicely done and, of course, the nostalgia factor. Essentially, when it works, it works well.

But it could have been so much better... it just wasn't. An inglorious end to a venerable franchise.

TLDR -- Don't waste your time
 
ERG

9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2019
Once I shut the OC off of my graphics card, selected the " no puzzles " option and increased the sharpness setting ( you -really- have to do this) the game became fun for me. There seem to be some technical issues still out there but I have not yet encountered them. More enjoyable than the original.
If you want an " RPG light" experience, with professional voice acting, a great soundtrack, and great fantasy environment, give it a try.

Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2019
If this is the Director's Cut, then how buggy was the Original version?
Gameplay itself is good and fun, but currently it's in semi-unplayable state because of constant bugs (actual game bugs, not just bugged quest or dialogues) and crashes.
The lags are probably even worse in ruining the experience, the game performs worse on my computer than Witcher 3 on max settings.
It's a complete joke of a release, and a shame that you can't get a refund on Steam if you played more than 2 hours.

Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2020
Я один из немногих счастливых людей кто начал играть около двух недель назад и все то за что игру ругали за последний год избежал.
Игра действительно по своему роскошна и в двойне обидно за людей которые не могли прочувствовать всю прелесть на старте,так как старт получился паршивым,а в тройне наверно обидно за разработчиков просто потому что видно - труд проделан колоссальный,но опять же на старте все труды были перечеркнуты.
Уверен что спустя время эту игру оценят по достоинству и даже по оценкам сейчас это прослеживается.
Лично я бы не отказался от продолжения.

Whoa What an experience it was. I am so happy that I got to buy and play this game. Mesmerising experience. The developers really did their best to make this game feel authentic and entertaining in every possible way. The only complaint that I have with me is they could have optimised certain parts of the game better. Nonetheless an overall epic fantasy experience. After giving it 80+ hours I am still asking for more and I hope in future there is gonna be a sequel or spin-off to this game but hey don't do it cash-in the franchise but develop it only when you have something awesome just like this one.
Hands down an awesome game with sweet and heart touching music.

LOVED IT and I highly recommend it.

Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2019
Игра очень хорошая. В этой версии полностью поправлен перевод, все тексты переведены полностью. Улучшена графика, но при этом сохранились прежние небольшие недочеты в плане задумчивости ИИ в бою, порой думаешь что завис, но проходит несколько секунд и все вроде и нормально. Очень много секретов, локации интересно изучать. Не просто сломя голову пробежал по локации, а обошел каждый закаулочек, собрал каждую травиночку, нашел интересные сундучки с вещами. И все это не просто так, все это очень потом помогает в бою, в крафте очень полезных вещей и эльфийского оружия. Мир очень огромен, игра - реиграбельна. Всем олдскульным игрокам - брать не думая. Ньюфагам - тоже брать и познавать как было)

43.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2019
Ich liebe dieses Spiel. Ich habe die erste Fassung von BT4 bereits gespielt, konnte aber wegen eines Bugs nicht weitermachen. Nun diese verbesserte Version (Director's Cut). Ich habe keinen High-End-PC und für mich hat sich die Grafik um einiges verbessert, außerdem läuft das Spiel flüssiger. Durch die neuen warmen Farben ist das Spiel meiner Meinung nach noch stimmungsvoller. Wer eine wunderschöne Abenteuergeschichte erleben will, taktische Kämpfe in Rundenstrategie und das Optimieren und Leveln seiner Party mag und Spiele nicht wegen der allerneusten Grafik spielt, sollte dem Spiel auf jeden Fall eine Chance geben. Es hat es verdient! Normalerweise schreibe ich keine Reviews, aber hier kann ich nicht anders!

Recommandé
71.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2023
Проект, який на Кікстартері зібрав кошти на свою розробку й таки вийшов у світ дійсно заслуговує трошки уваги, особливо для таких старперів, які коли бігали в Elder Scrolls 2, DOOM 1\2 чи щось подібне. Бо хоч це і фентезі пригода, але вид від першої особи й взаємодія зі світом мене відкидали до такої класики по відчуттям.

Головні плюси:
1) Незвична покрокова бойовка в полі 4х2, де положення героя в першому чи другому ряді визначає, який скіл можна задіяти, а який ні, чи можна на всі 8 клітинок лупити чи тільки по своїй лінії й тд.
2) Гумор та легка атмосфера, які проскакують тут і там.
3) Головоломки, деякі достатньо прості, інші більш витончені й доведеться посидіти з блокнотом, щоб позаписувати куски пазлу чи пісні чи якоїсь легенди з книжку, яку треба купити у Васі в конурі. Але з іншого боку деякі крафти чи там розблокування ельфійської зброї по віршам підзаябує, бо змушують безкінечно перешукувати локації, як в рогаликах.
4) Вороги не оживають, якщо їх вб'єш й левел дизайн достатньо гарно продуманий, бо спершу багато перепон на проходження, а потім з'являються шорткати й певні діагоналі по рівням.
5) Вороги різноманітні, багато ефектів й навичок, видно, що автори дуже старались і хотіли подарувати якісний продукт при обмеженому бюджеті
6) Музика така, як треба в фентезійному епосі про героїв

Головні мінуси:
1) Для комфортного проходження тут багато бектрекінгу. Тобто, якщо ти хочеш гарно давати прикурити сюжетним уркам, то треба гарно нишпорити по відкритим локаціям й пилососити артефакти\рівні.
2) Сюжет непоганий, але я в ньому загубився, бо занадто розтягнутий та скомканий під кінець. На льодяних островах вже забув, з чого взагалі починав
3) Відчуваєш себе халамидником, бігаєш та щось робиш, але немає глобальної мети, як в Dragon Age Origins чи там Diablo й особисто мені ставало нуднувато
4) Навички дублюються для наявних 4ох класів й на початку при неправильній прокачці можна смачно сасірувати, поки не сформуєш команду чи не назбираєш жетони для скидання навичок

7 з 10 елів в місцевій Таверні
 
kolbasodor

0
Recommandé
78.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2019
Trudno jednoznacznie polecić tę grę. Jak na wersję reżyserską, to od strony technicznej nie wygląda najlepiej (ale mój komp również:)
Według mnie zdecydowanie lepsza wersja niż poprzednia edycja. Tamtą grałem przez chwilę, DC ukończyłem, także da się grać, nie ma tragedii, nawet na nienajmocniejszym kompie. Zgrzyty się pojawiają ale gra cały czas jest łatana i moim zdaniem chyba to jest największym problemem, bo przecież jest to DC, czyli już ta "poprawiona" wersja. Co do oprawy wizualnej się nie wypowiem. Z racji słabego kompa grałem na "ustawieniach własnych" (czyli bez wodotrysków) i mi to odpowiadało.
Dobra, nie będę się rozpisywał i tak nikt tego nie przeczyta. Grałem na średnim poziomie trudności, walki jakoś przesadnie trudne nie były, co do zagadek, to na ogół również nie za trudne ale i do "guidebooka" też zerknąłem (przykładowo zagadka z dzwonkami w zadaniu krew królów, koszmar:). Troche też "błądziłem" ale niedużo. Uważam też, że przydałoby się coś typu "szybka walka" bo nie ma skalowania poziomów i miałem kilka walk z przeciwnikiem bardzo słabym (nie wiem czy to przez słabego kompa czy słabą optymalizację ale czasem walki się "dłużyły", bo musiałem czekać aż umiejętność łaskawie "zatrybi").
Wersję DC otrzymałem bez dodatkowych kosztów, jako upgrade zakupionej uprzednio wersji.
Ostatecznie grę polecam (jednak do ideału daleko ale po pierwszej łatce jest lepiej, a z tego co widać cały czas łatają), tym bardziej, że cena nie jest zbyt wygórowana, no i jest polska lokalizacja. Oczywiście polecam również przeceny itp.
 
Kukiełek

91.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2021
I never played I-III, but I enjoyed the XBox spinoff when I was a kid, and expected an action RPG with lots of satire. This isn't that. It is a dungeon-crawling tactical RPG with puzzles. Lots of puzzles. I treated the combat like a puzzle too, trying to finish each fight in a minimum number of turns. The music is fine but songs are repetitive. Scenery/graphics are modern. The story is generic, which makes the overall game drag on once combat becomes too easy. It was still an enjoyable experience.

90.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2021
Интересные механики, куча различных головоломок.. и всё это начинает бесить уже через 10-15 часов игры. Дальше ты понимаешь, что карта тебе ничем не помогает, в инвентаре невозможно ничего найти, а в боях происходит просто непоймичто. Скилы не попадают в клетки, мобы не исчезают после смерти. Похоже разработчики создали одноразовую машину времени, сделали игру в 2006 году и случайно отправили её в релиз в будущее. "Старая школа" - приговаривал мой друг...

Recommandé
85.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2023
The world arround „Skara Brae“
I enjoyed playing Bards Tale in the 90´s and this a worthy successor to that series with today´s technical possibilities!

Positives
- oldscool style rpg
- a lot of good puzzles
- classic fighting system
- sometimes really challenging
- funny sayings / things
- mostly good graphics & sounds / middle ages music

Negatives
- crashes out of nowhere / 7 times in 85hours (ultra settings)
- sometimes i stucked in the world = load savegame
- no „real“ common thread / ...where to go now?
- the inventory was „one page“ to smal in my eyes

Final words
Overall there would have been more into the game, but I think the money ran out! It is not a mainstream game, but i can recommend it to everyone who like oldscool rpg gaming!
Greetings & glhf anytime!

#I´m still waiting for an new „Eye of the Beholder“!

Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2020
This game is the best dungeon crawler in years. If you played, better than Legend of Grimrock, this is updated og dungeon crawling action, with inventive turn based gameplay, buy this game and be amazed how much you have playing a game with puzzles, gun combat, and catchy soundtrack. It reminds me of Legend Of Zelda almost at how it manages to combine all three seamlessly in its gameplay.

Recommandé
84.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 octobre 2022
雰囲気あるグラフィックとサウンドが印象的なダンジョンクロウル。

最近珍しい６人パーティ制とアクションポイントのシェアが面白いターンベース戦闘が特徴。パーティは最終的に6人となるが最初から全員揃っているわけではなく、ストーリーの進行とともに増えていく。その都度パーティスロットが解放されるので、そのタイミングでオリジナルキャラを作成しても良い。クラスは少なめで、バード/ファイター/ローグ/メイジの４種類、クラス内のスキルツリーでさらに個性を持たせられる。(二刀流ローグやシーフスキル特化ローグ、タンク役ファイターや出血/スタンを狙っていくトリッキーなファイターとか)
バードは戦闘中に飲酒することでMPを貯めつつ、味方のサポートや攻撃も行える勇者的キャラクター。移動中も音楽を奏でることで閉ざされた道を開いたりファーストトラベルしたりと、ゲーム進行のキーとなっている。（飲み干したジョッキを敵に投げる等、やや素行が悪そうな勇者であるが。）

戦闘中は敵の動きが賑やかで、お尻をフリフリ挑発してくる骸骨戦士や、おしゃべりなゴブリン、バードが歌うと怒りだす敵兵等々、見ていて楽しい。毒状態になれば苦しそうに咳き込み、炎で炙れば熱がり、とどめの一撃でのけぞり吹っ飛ぶという、ややオーバー気味のアクションが戦闘を盛り上げてくれる。逆にプレイヤー側は２Ｄのポートレートが少し動くだけという、妙に地味な仕様になっている。（キャラメイクの際は３Ｄキャラが激しく動くのに）

戦闘画面はプレイヤー側も敵側も8マスの自陣グリッド内を移動できるようになっており、攻撃の種類によってはグリッド内で攻撃範囲が限定されたり、ファイターの後ろに隠れていれば直接打撃は喰らわなかったり（飛び道具は喰らう）、ノックバック攻撃をすれば相手側の陣形を崩せたりと、戦闘が進むにつれて変化していくキャラクターの位置によって戦術を変えていく必要があり、なかなか面白い。
半面、敵の種類や攻撃パターンが多くなく、同じような敵と似たような戦闘ばかりになる事が多かった。ボスクラスの敵はちゃんと攻略法を考えないと倒せないが、これも同じようなパターンが多くちょっと盛り上がりに欠ける。

パズルや謎解きが結構多い感じがしたが、メインクエストの途上にあるものは難易度は高くなく試行錯誤で何とかなる程度、サブクエストのパズルは結構難しい。個人的には正しい順でベルを鳴らす謎解きが歯ごたえがあって楽しかった。逆にパズルを求めない人にはパスして進む設定も初期設定で可能になっている。

目立つ不満点としては、アイテムインベントリが整理できなかったり、ゲーム後半で商人達のお金が枯渇してしまい余剰アイテムの売却が出来なくなる等、雑なところは非常に雑で手を抜いているところ。また、あまり寄り道できるところもなく全体的に一本道のゲーム進行で、ほんの少しだけサブクエがあるが個人的にはもうちょっと探索要素が欲しく、面白いゲームなのにそこは残念だった。
バグが残されたままになっており、解除されない実績やパズルを解かなくても先に進めてしまう等があったが、ゲームが進行不能になるような深刻なものは無かった。

ラスボス討伐に必要な武器を入手すると、移動先が固定され回収不能なサブクエストが発生する。武器入手前に警告が表示されるので要注意。ラスボスを討伐するとゲームは終了となり、未回収のサブクエストにはアクセスできない。古いセーブデータからやり直そうとしても、セーブデータは20個までで順繰りに上書きされていくので、クリアする頃には昔のセーブデータは全部上書きされてなくなっている。
（ C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\BardsTale4\Saved\SaveGames にあるセーブデータを手動で別場所に保存しておけば大丈夫かもしれない。自分は気づいた時には後の祭りだった。）

ユニークなのは、デジタル版の攻略本(pdf)や謎解き用の星座版?(html)が付属していて、妙に凝っているところ。クリア後に読んでみたら、メインクエスト内のパズルも解き方がすべて解説されていた。

個人的には非常に楽しめたが、どうしても雑な造りが目立つゲーム。音楽や雰囲気には凄いこだわりと開発側の強い思いを感じたので、もっと他の部分にも情熱を注いで欲しかった。ダンジョンクロウル感は控えめなので、ターンベース戦闘とパズルや謎解きが好きで雰囲気重視な人におすすめ。
 
n_ship_n
0

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
99.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
Ну, вообщем, дождались!
Изначально, игра заинтересовала, но дикое количество багов заставило отложить прохождение до лучших времен. Начал проходить на Ютубе, но с анонсом Director's Cut, решил не торопиться, самому проходить в разы интереснее. Пока прошел пролог, но уже могу перечислить, что понравилось, а что нет.

1. Всем, у кого была старая версия, она же Barrows Deep, Director's Cut получают бесплатно! Учитывая, что накануне взял старую версию с хорошей скидкой, получился прям двойной Ван Дамм! А еще пообещали допконтент.
2. Графоний подтянули, картинка стала выглядеть интереснее.
3. Оптимизацию таки завезли! Идет без особых тормозов даже на моем кУркуляторе. Слаанеш и Нургл, обнявшись, радостно пляшут гопака на моей видяхе, которая передумала плавиться.
4. За примерные 2 часа лута всего живого и не живого, заныканного и лежащего открыто, не было ни одного вылета или критичного бага. Надеюсь, что и дальше будет также.
5. Поправили дебильный баг, при котором скидывалось разрешение на минимум при смене локации.
6. Загрузки между локациями почти моментальные.

Есть и немного минусов:
1. Подгрузки текстур, которые заставляют картинку спотыкаться, а персонажей обрастать одеждой, изображая пугал в поле.
2. Не уверен, но кажется столбы сохранений больше нельзя превращать в экспу.
3. Таблички, кнопки и подсказки накладываются друг на друга, создавая дикий хаос.
4. Текст над персонажами иногда дрожит и ерзает.
5. А еще у меня не заработало колесо знаков.(( Придется загадки со Святилищами решать на ютубе.

Вообщем и целом, рекомендую. Весь в предвкушении интересного приключения.

П.С. А еще у них в заставке настоящий карлик! КАРЛИК! С БОРОДОЙ!!! Карлики! Карлики! Карлики! Хэй! Хэй! Хэй! (С) 110см из 10!

Recommandé
48.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2019
For context, I'm coming to this game never having played any of the original Bard's Tales. However, I love RPGs and a good blobber - and this seems to fit the bill really well. Combat in the game is excellent, involving some great tactical options. Lose a fight one time, but you might win it the next with better tactics, gear and character arrangements.

I find the character progression to be great as well with a lot of interesting and compelling skills and paths. Gear seems pretty good too, always having that feeling of wanting just a bit more gold for that next piece of cool kit.

I'm only 12 hours in at this point so harder to comment on the story. What I've seen so far is ok - or, more accurately, good enough for a game like this. The voice acting is really well done and adds a lot of character and atmosphere to the game, which balances out the rather lackluster graphics.

People seem to complain about the bugs but I have not seen a single one.

Lastly, I'm not a huge fan of puzzles but the ones in here are generally pretty good, with an option to bypass many of them if you prefer not to work them out yourself.

All in all, this is an excellent game so far and I'm looking forward to spending a few more dozen hours in it!

Recommandé
0.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 novembre 2023
*Moved review from original non-directors cut*

I have not finished this game yet, but so far I think it has been a pretty great adventure.
I did not know what to expect going in, I just sort of assumed it was a first person CRPG with average visuals and turn based combat, but I wasn't really on the mark there.
The level design and landscapes in this game are beautiful even if the character models are not.
The game is a puzzle game first and foremost, a puzzle game with pretty in-depth RPG elements such as combat, experience, talent/skill trees, classes ect. While playing this I certainly felt more like I was playing a game in the same vein as The Witness instead of say Skyrim.
If it was just that I would say this was a solid average game at best, but what takes this game over the top for me what the audio, easily some of the best I have ever encountered in a game. Every NPC is fully voiced, every line they say. The music is amazing and sets the mood more than anything else.
I would highly recommend this for those who like 1st Person puzzle games.

Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2022
"A summer's day in Skara Brae ..." that ear worm hunts me for a quite some time now and surely will do so for a while in the future ;-)
I finally finished the game and felt pretty good entertained along the trip. Good old fashoned RPG with turn based combat, interesting puzzles and a few really challenging fights along the way. The graphics suffice, the music is great and at the current patch state it is actually a quite bugfree experience.
So to anyone who enjoys classic RPGs with turn based combat, I totally recommend this game.

Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2022
I started playing the Bard's Tale series on an amber screen monitor. I loved seeing the series re-done for modern computers and this latest iteration... Just absolutely fantastic. The audio aspects, in particular (music and such), just blow me away. For being a labor of love the developers really did a fantastic job with this. Yes, it may not be like along the lines of an Elder Scrolls level of world play but it pays homage to the originals and plays well (and entertains) on it's own merit.

Recommandé
55.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juillet 2020
太长不看：
还算不错的中等规模复古RPG。如果喜欢迷宫RPG，又不讨厌解谜的话，可以试试。
适宜人群：复古RPG爱好者
劝退点：第一人称、剧情平淡、大量解谜小游戏

本作是冰城传奇ip的第五部游戏，但却以第四代自居——游戏模式从ARPG回归第一人称回合制，剧情也与老三部曲在同一世界观，可见其本质上就是老三部曲的延续。
战斗和解谜基本占比一半一半，战斗类似旭丽玛诸神，敌我双方在各自半场的八个格子（4×2）中对垒，人物可以移动但仅限于己方半场（不知道这个模式源自于那，和巫术以及魔法门都有些许不同；如果有人知道采用这种模式的最早是哪个游戏还请提示），不同之处在于本作是一队人马公用一条AP值，所以可以让一个角色一回合攻击多次用于输出。角色构筑方面还算可以，每个职业都有两条路可以选择，虽不及许多有TRPG规则作为基础的游戏那般复杂好玩，但也能达到及格水平 比天外世界之流高出不少 。解谜部分与那种整个地下城自身就是个谜题的DRPG不同，是由多种小游戏如推箱子、一笔画组成，颇有趣味性。不过由于后期战斗部分越来越简单，解谜越来越难，因此会有解谜过多的感觉（游戏里提供了跳过解谜的选项，解累了可以用歌曲跳过解谜）。
前面提到本作在剧情方面也延续了老三部曲。大家可能知道，由于种种机能限制以及设计上的落后、亦或者是制作组刻意为之，早期的RPG游戏剧情是很简单的，本作也继承了这一点，所以不要期待剧情上有什么重大转折或神展开，千禧年之后的RPG经常作为卖点存在的choices and consequences自然也是没有的。 剧情简单概括一下就是把老三部曲的最终boss拉出来胖揍一顿 不过关卡以及场景的设计还是蛮不错的，整体玩下来感觉相当顺畅——除了有几个任务会比较绕以及经常关键钥匙经常被随意放置在道路尽头而我眼大漏神导致卡关。
游戏的另一大亮点是ost。贯穿流程的爱尔兰民谣使我对凯尔特音乐产生了浓厚的兴趣，但豪华版送的ost不仅还没有网*云音乐全，而且男声版的主题曲《snow in summer》甚至没有收录到任何一张ost中，可真是神了……不过这并不妨碍它们成为我最爱的游戏ost之一。如果你对这款游戏没啥兴趣却意外地看到了这篇测评，请一定把这款游戏的ost找来听一下。
 
harmony tree

Recommandé
73.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2023
Around 72h on record, but finished the game with about 26h played and doing every sidequest.
Some of that lost time was due to losing fights (I played on Heroic Ballad), but a massive portion was replaying sections of the game after a horrific number of crashes.

The story and the puzzles are entertaining, with a reasonable amount of variety despite only a half dozen or so 'types'. The combat (which becomes a game of stunlocking the enemy) is pretty good, but somewhat repetitive.

On the whole, I'd recommend the game, but if you do play it, do yourself a favour and enable the 'save anywhere' feature.

Recommandé
58.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2021
Отличный представитель dungeon crawler, хоть и не ходим по клеточкам (с учетом местных загадок - это плюс).
Играла в директорскую версию, из багов были замечены только редкие залипания в текстурах, да пару вылетов за все время игры. Вывод: играть можно, причем комфортно.

Плюсы:
- разнообразные и красивые локации
- нескучная боевка
- шикарный саундтрек
- много секретов
- разнообразный лут
- удобоваримый сюжет
- персонажи забавно ругаются между собой
- играть интересно!

Минусы:
- с загадками переборщили (привет энергетическим линиям)
- мало слотов для активных способностей персонажей, что сводит на нет большое дерево прокачки
- эльфийское оружие: пока его качаешь, оно становится хуже стандартного лута уже с середины игры

Вывод: отличная и интересная игра для любителей РПГ!
 
sister_of_night
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 février 2021
The Bard's Tale IV jest współczesną kontynuacją klasycznych dungeon crawlerów The Bard's Tale I-III z lat 80tych. Jak jej poprzednicy też jest klasycznym dungeon crawlerem, choć już we współczesnej oprawie. Wersja reżyserska gry wnosi kilka poprawek (dosyć istotnych) oraz wprowadza nowy loch.
Grafika w grze jest poprawna w porywach do nawet ładnej, trzeba tylko przyzwyczaić się do specyficznego stylu graficznego, który najbardziej rzuca się w oczy w przypadku modeli postaci i naszych wrogów.
Muzyka za to jest istnym arcydziełem. Dosłownie. Tak doskonale dobranej i klimatycznej ścieżki dźwiękowej nie widujemy w grach zbyt często (niestety).
Grywalność jest spora. Gra ma olbrzymie możliwości konfigurowania rozgrywki, do tego stopnia, że możemy nawet pomijać zagadki w grze, chociaż jest to jeden z najistotniejszych elementów tej gry a ich trudność nie jest aż taka wielka.
Rozgrywka jest stosunkowo długa, chociaż liniowa. Można ją, jak to w grach tego typu bywa, wydłużyć myszkując po wszelkich zakamarkach w poszukiwaniu różnych ciekawostek, a myszkować warto, bo w takich właśnie zakamarkach możemy znaleźć całkiem ciekawe rzeczy.
Walka rozgrywa się w systemie turowym i polega głównie na odpowiednim rozstawieniu naszej drużyny i skorzystaniu z odpowiednich umiejętności w zależności od sytuacji i rodzaju przeciwników. W zależności od poziomu trudności gry, potrafi dać się we znaki.
Dla wszystkich fanów gier RPG w ogólności i dungeon crawlerów w szczególności. Fani irlandzkiego folkloru także powinni być z tej gry zadowoleni.
Z czystym sumieniem mogę polecić The Bard's Tale IV: Director's Cut, bo to niezła gra.

===================================
➥ Obserwuj moją stronę kuratora
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6858817-Perrin%2527s-Recomendations/

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Recommandé
768.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 janvier 2021
i definitely scratched the 80s bards tale itch.. really enjoyed those titles when they came out.. this game does a masterful job of recapturing that feel, with modern graphics and mechanics.. puzzles can be hard, but, makes it all that more enjoyable when the light goes on.. and thankfully they installed the option to skip puzzles in directors cut.. makes replay much more fun.. finding the right combination of troops/spells/weapons is definitely a must.. or you will suffer.. luckily have found multiple mixes that work (amazingly practitioner seemed at best a light/spell support troop for instance, maxed str w/ 2 daggers(1 the soul dagger)does more dmg than frontline).. dwarven fighters seemed nice, cant be moved, w/ axes deadly.. altho my favorite is human/einar fighters.. almost impossible to win a couple battles without them.. the bard was hard to like, becomes indispensable later on tho(wine pairing a must).. trow thief is a must(they coulda had a lot more fun with wringneck tho.. left a lot on the table)

the game can be won multiple ways.. this game is a thinkers game, how to best draw the enemies towards me, what to hit and with what, taking out enemies correctly is crucial.. strongest armor is not always the best, weapons matching to skills is critical.. the strategy layers are deep and thought-provoking.. every battle is just a bit different, skeletons can be hell(just wont stay dead).. kill the necro fast

what makes this game is the combat.. it has a good story/not great.. the music and voice acting is nice/ everything goes well with the atmosphere.. the game is very linear, not a bad thing, just not a open world.. that being said i have 300+ hours as of this review.. and will go higher

I played the first version of the game when it came out and I really enjoyed it. And I looked forward to the release of the DC.

- Worse Graphics, it looks way worse than i remember
- Really not a lot of Character customisation

I really did not enjoy the start of this game, so i'm dropping it again until it is in a much better state.

Recommandé
96.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2020
I was not into this at first. Took a couple of battles to really get the hang of it. This game has become one of the most enjoyable gaming experiences I've had. It is definitely in my top 3 favorite games of all time and I'm going to go back and play the others ASAP. I haven't ran into the problem of putting a game down every now and then so that the joy of playing it doesn't end. The graphics are beautiful, music is amazing and overall immersion better than any other game I've played. The characters are diverse, dynamic, and really likable. I would buy a game where you just walk around listening to them talk about stuff. It makes you care about the world and people in it. I've never cheered out loud so much before when my bear lady does a retaliation that ends up wiping out an entire team. Talk about feeling accomplished! To top it off, the celtic/pagany theme is one of the best worlds I've played in. Cannot recommend this more.

107.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2019
It was good to return to this game. I backed on Kickstarter, played through the release game, and then rage quit just an hour or so from the final boss when I got stuck on a platform with no way to leave and no way to reload... I laughed maniacally when I saw the button that would have saved me in the director's cut.

Coming back, a year later, I still enjoyed the experience and was able to complete the game and have closure with the game I had backed four years ago. Some of the more complex puzzles were beyond me, but the addition of the new song was very welcome for my old brain.

In the end, I really enjoyed the combat system and exploration. There are so many unique puzzles and mechanics in this game that are worth experiencing.
 
VasWolf
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé

14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
98.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 octobre 2019
The game is still very buggy. It is playable on Windows, but you will run into issues. Voice acting will randomly not play, including working for only part of an interaction. Combat can lag to perform your last action, even while you can still assign new actions (I have had over a minute wait multiple times), or counter attacks from dead enemies can hit several actions later. There are more, but these are the latest ones bugging me. Linux crashes constantly and isn't playable. Proton is decent until you get to a video before a battle and the screen goes black. I later found that pressing Space will skip the video and restore your display, though at the time had tried things like Esc. (which did bring up the menu fine) and Enter, but ended up having to switch to Windows to keep playing.

The choices to experiment with combat and equipment stats is interesting and might work for some games, though nothing comes to mind, but it really doesn't feel natural here. Combat does feel like a sort of puzzle, which may be the intent, but it does not feel like combat, which should be moving along and not a slow puzzle to analyze and plan out before working through each step. I often had 1 person do everything while the rest of the team just stood there. Later fights allowed use of others, though I still do most damage with 1 person, including fights that are red and say "We're all gonna die". Speaking of their combat difficulty system, I have had enemies with group power of 200 be red, yet had no troubles with fights rated at over 900 difficulty. Likewise, the way classes have skills and the equipment has nothing to do with your abilities (unless the item has its own ability, which usually replaces one of your slots), feel odd. You can fire arrows without a bow, or use sword skill with only a bow. Your armor can provide as much strength/attack boosting as your weapon, and only the heaviest armor has any armor value, while the others boost your ♥♥♥/HP and other stats. Magic can rely on your strength over intelligence. My Mage sometimes has the highest strength of my team.

The puzzles are fun and the story is decent. The soundtrack is great. Yeah, that's about all the positives I have for the game.

I'm trying to play through and finish the game. We backed them on Kickstarter, and at a higher tier than we normally would for some of the extras (which also did not live up to expectations), so I'd like to at least get through once. We mainly backed because they claimed they'd support Linux, but that "support" came long after the initial release and was too buggy to actually be playable. I know that if something comes up and interrupts me I'll never come back to this game, and have no intention of ever replaying it. After their recent games I'll not be backing InXile again and will wait for the Steam sales to pickup anything they have to offer that might be interesting.
 
daban81
892 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Recommandé
33.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juillet 2020
Stary wyga wyskrobał półtorej bańki i pozszywał blobbera z obiektów znalezionych.
Sesja Q&A na żywca z kampanii promującej siebie, jako biokukłę próbującą wydębić numer telefonu, wysokonotowanej egirl z LOL`a.
Pomijając facia z uszkodzonym układem limbicznym, który jest żywym symbolem nieprzerwanego trwania całego medium, temat kolejnej reanimacji gatunku został dowieziony.
Typ produkcji skupia grono które oczekuje money shotów, odfajkowując elementy składowe zgodnie z nawykiem.
Punktem wykraczającym poza rynkowe standardy jest namacalna obecność muzyki.
Nawiązanie do kultury gaelickiej jest lepsze niż "Dziady" w Wieśku3 - całe Skara Brae robi za symulator chodzenia po selekcji utworów Geda Grimesa.
Praczki umilają sobie godziny pracy, dziewczyna przyśpiewuje do niepewnego losu a chorały dobiegają wyraźnie tylko gdy przystawisz ucho do kamienicy na północnym wschodzie - sztuka wysoka.
Odpoczynkiem dla umysłu jest łażenie po szynoprzewodzie bez udawania że mamy możliwość gdzieś pójść - nigdzie nie pójdziesz, jak na spacerze po osiedlach na Targówku.
Projekty labiryntów to schemat na chybił trafił.
Bo i tak: gruzowiska z ektoplazmą za murem, okultystyczne rytuały do których chcesz dołączyć, kościane kaplice z wystrojem małpującym Kudowę Zdrój, Russell Crowe podczas ekranu ładowania - to wszystko jest tutaj, ale brakuje spójników i ducha rozrywki poza udawanym Monthy Pythonem.
Bycie bardem ratującym świat niemożebnie ciągnie w dół wszystkie próby urozmaicenia.
Chciałbym pokręcić się po dublińskich kocich łbach i zrzygać się do zupy.
Awatary są śliczne i mrugają oczkami, ale tylko zapijaczona paplanina barda ma w sobie tą młodość.
To jak historia znajomego o zwiedzaniu destylarni i samotnym piciu bez słów w przyzakładowym pubie.
Czekasz na zwieńczenie w postaci szorstkiego pocałunku zmiękczonej Betty O`Connell czy innej Sary Lightfoot, ale pozostaje tylko niezręczna cisza.
 
Kabotyn
195 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 février 2021
I expected this to be like the original Bard's Tale games, where you create a party of characters for some good old-fashioned first-person dungeon crawling.

This... isn't quite that.

There's the first-person dungeon crawling, but it's more akin to modern RPGs where sure, you create your starter character who is permanently a member of your party, but then you have to team up with pre-generated characters along the way, who leave when their business with you is done. What, you were expecting to create a half-dozen custom characters with the classes YOU want and develop them into a crew of ultimate asskickers as you conquer one dungeon after another? Hahahaha... no.

To be fair, this game isn't horrible at what it does, laboring to be a more story-oriented first-person dungeon crawl than usual. (It needs less trap options, though, like when it lets you buy a weapon in a store, only for you to find a chest with a superior version of that weapon literally two minutes later.)

But it's not a Bard's Tale game as I remember them, and that's what I was in the mood for when I bought it.
 
Vivisector 9999

Évaluation publiée le 17 mars 2021
Do you think to yourself when playing games, man I wish games would be more 'Alive' and give me the same feeling I had when I first played a meaningful game for the first time. Then this might be the game for you as it was for me. The story is very straight forward but while playing this game I did not mind one bit because it was the details in each characters personality that made it special. Not going to spoil and you shouldn't spoil yourself either don't look game-play or anything on youtube because if you do it won't look like much it's only if you play it yourself and 'feel it' for yourself that you will understand.

Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2021
As frustrating as this game is I'll still recommend it. They honestly could have cut out an easy 20 hours of puzzles and made the game a lot more fluid and fun. I did not beat it. Made it really close to the end and decided that the puzzles were not worth my time. I imagine most people reach this conclusion. But getting to that point will probably yield hours of gameplay which is well worth the price tag of the game.

Another thing they could do is character class mastery expansions. It would help make the game worth beating, as you max out your class well before the end of the game.

That said, the story is good and there's lots of exploration to be had.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2021
What you need to know:
- party based action point and tactical positioning combat system
- lots of puzzles (from easy to tough), sometimes too many actually
- some backtracking if you are a completionist
- more than 60h of gameplay

All in all its still quite enjoyable and unique RPG. I think it has not much in common with the original Bards Tale games, but that was not a problem for me.

Recommandé
77.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 octobre 2020
Good turn based combat with a variety of spells and attack modes. If you're prepared to experiment with your combinations you can get extraordinary results. My favourite character was the practitioner with the "Finger of death" spell (great animation). Although the game looks and feels very linear, it isn't. You can compare it to Pillars of Eternity, where the rule is: if the fight is too though, return later. The game also features lots of puzzles, but if it's not your thing you can avoid most of them by playing a magic tune.
Very good soundtrack but the art style was a bit rough for me and could do with more detail and fluent video scenes. Story was good and well worked out. Check it out and put some time in learning the workings of the game and you won't be disappointed.

Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2022
Picked this up because Wasteland 3 was so great. Same company, same quality, same great story telling and gameplay. Fairly deep combat system that looks simple at the start. Kind of like XCom and Diablo had a baby with an Adventure Puzzle game. The complexity can take a while to overcome, you'll have 4 to 6 different party members with an array of classes and skills that all feed off each other. The skill trees are very deep and choices are impactful, My only complaint is there are a limited number of respecs -- it's enough get your builds right as you learn, but it discourages a lot of experimenting.

The graphics are terrible. The models remind me of Chucky dolls at times. The gameplay, however, is amazing.
- The combat is tactical and varied.
- Characters can be spec'd to multiple different flavors that feel unique and interesting.
- The crafting system is useful but not insultingly complicated.
- There are containers to search but in a reasonable amount (no Skyrim syndrome here!)

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
76.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2019
Updated Review (2022):

I went back to Bard's Tale 4 recently as was pleasantly surprised that many of the issues I had with the game previously have been addressed. It was a wonderful title with loads of character and a fantastic soundtrack that had been marred by bugs and even some patches that borked the PC version. I can happily report that the issues with the PC version seem to have been addressed in the "Director's Cut" at last and the game is very solid again.

I have one niggling issue where it takes a little doing to get it to continue to recognize my Xbox controller as the chosen input, but that is easily fixed with a few clicks in the options menu. Besides that I have not encountered any bugs in the game save for getting stuck for a few minutes at one point between the geometry of a wall.

Bard's Tale 4 does perhaps the best job of any game that I've played in the last several years of selling the setting as a unique fantasy setting with a robust history and a decidedly Scottish/Gaelic culture. The voice acting is very good. The writing is decent. The soundtrack is amazing. If you want to just spend some time in a different place that is compelling this game delivers.

Combat is turn based and can be challenging on the hard difficulty level. One of the only issues I have with the game is that the character system can be obtuse and that equipment is more about stat points and abilities than the actual type of equipment. You can select sword abilities for your character for instance, and have them available even if you use an axe or mace. It's just a little weird, but not game breaking. Once you get used to the system it's fine.

There are a lot of puzzles in this game too. Some of them are quite clever and require escape room levels of focus in order to solve. Others are too numerous and too simple. A few are needlessly obtuse and frustrating. All can apparently be skipped in the Director's Cut but be prepared if you try to noodle through them. There are a lot.

I kickstarted this game way back and I'm finally extremely satisfied with what has been delivered. I have changed my recommendation three times now from Purchase (initially), to not recommend (terrible patches), to now recommending again. It's in a great place. Check it out if you enjoy a good CRPG. You won't be disappointed.
 
Shepherd
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
84.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mars 2021
It's a great puzzle-filled game.

I especially fell in love with exploration. Every area you go to is also like a little puzzle. You will not be able to explore it fully until you gain certain abilities, figure out some secrets, notice certain details. There are treasures waiting for you behind mysterious rune gates and all you need to do is figure out how to make them open for you. And the game does not hold your hand here at all - not everything is a quest in your journal or a marker on you map. But the world itself invites you to discover its secrets and be observant.

The various puzzles you meet are mostly not particularly challenging but quite enjoyable to solve nonetheless.

Combat is nice and tactical. And you can always mix it up by changing your party if you get bored with a particular set of skills and related strategies. Wanna try going around with six bards now and see what hell they can raise? You certainly can :). Your party members (even those you create yourself, not only the pre-made ones you meet) all have personalities, things to say. They interact with each other and comment on your travels. Crux is my personal favourite.

Story is quite nice and the many big and small references to the original trilogy are just lovely. I am still laughing at 99 waves of 4 Berserkers each. That said, it is NOT a story of player choice, you will not be shaping it and it will not react to your decisions. Because, well, you make practicaly no decisions in it.

And as we are talking about the 'Bard's Tale', let me comment on the music. It can get repetitive if you are staying in one spot for a very long time but that's my only complaint. Music is very cool, bardish, hummable, fitting to the general mood of each area and sometimes it gets stuck in your head.
 
fabula_rasa

Non recommandé
70.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2019
This game is incredible...conceptually. I loved the puzzles, gameplay and story. Unfortunately the game is nearly unplayable right now. Using the game clock vs the steam clock (give or take an hour for walking away) I spent over 20 hours just fighting bugs. Reloading saves hoping that the next time I'd get lucky enough to make it through the combat encounter or whatever else I was trying to do at the time.

The inventory system is one of the worst i've ever seen in a game. Between the characters losing their move sets randomly, characters bugging/locking out entirely and grid spaces randomly glitching out rendering them unusable in combat, it felt like I was endlessly jumping through flaming hoops every step of the way. I think the price for the game is great, the core of the game was so different, fun and refreshing, but the bugs just ruin every bit of what I think could be a fantastic experience. Truly baffled this game was released in it's current state. This isn't even alpha ready. How the "fixed" version ended up worse than the original i'm really not sure, but this is a complete mess.

It seems like the devs are working on fixing things but there is currently a very, very long to-do list in that regard. Once it's fixed up though, I'd absolutely recommend this game. Minus all the irritations due to things not working, I really loved it.
 
Un développeur ou une développeuse a répondu à cette évaluation

Non recommandé
90.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2021
This is a puzzle game (on steroids) masquerading as an RPG (even the combat feels like solving puzzles). And I hate puzzle games. Yet, for some reason, I can't stop playing it. That must mean there is something pretty awesome about it... If you enjoyed the previous Bard's Tale puzzle dungeon crawls (BT1, 2, and 3), then you will probably love this game (I played them--never finished them--but now I have the Internet to come to my rescue!). If you only ever played The Bard's Tale ARPG (which I really enjoyed), then you might not like this game. The music is awesome. The graphics are nice. The puzzles can be annoying (but you can go look up the solutions now, so...). I find the combat hard (so I decided to play on easy and am enjoying the game now, whereas before...).

EDIT: after 90 hrs, I can't take it anymore. I really do hate puzzle games...
 
ep2u
