5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
94.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2019
This is a great game that is a throwback to the old RPGs of yore. It's been a long time since I got into an RPG and was addicted to the point where I'd play every moment I could, but this game accomplished that. A fantastic story, great music, decent graphics and fun exploration and game play. However, there is one problem in paradise.

Puzzles. You'd better LOVE puzzles if you are going to play this game as it was intended to be played. I mean you must eat and sleep puzzles. Now, puzzles tend to be one part of RPGs I do not particularly enjoy. One every hour or two is fine. But this game...you'll agonize over a puzzle for 20 or 30 minutes, finally solve it and move into the next room to face...an even harder puzzle. Puzzle after puzzle after puzzle after puzzle. I feel like this is 50% a puzzle game and 50% an adventure game. Holy cow they overdid it with puzzles.

Now, there is an option to skip puzzles when you start a game. Unless you are a puzzle fiend, I recommend selecting it. I did not. I did solve maybe half the puzzles on my own, even some of the hardest ones, but after a while you just want to move ahead, so I'd just find a video online of how to do it instead of trying it for an hour just to find an even harder puzzle after it. If this game had 75% fewer puzzles, it probably would have been my favorite game in the past 5 years. As-is, it's still a very good game and I ran into very few bugs or problems when playing it.
 
Saboth

Évaluation publiée le 5 avril 2020
Excuse me but this is the worst Linux port I have ever seen. I was a member of closed Steam for Linux Beta program back in 2012 and I've seen a lot, I've seen bad things, bugs, broken things... but this is another level. A machine capable of running Shadow of Tomb Raider, The Witcher 3 and Divinity OS2 on high settings is struggling and screaming in pain on 16 fps lowest possible settings. This, ladies and gentlemen is a new piece of morbid art. I'm usually able to report bugs and provide feedback but this is so bad it made me speechless. Removing Wasteland 3 from my wishlist. I was happy to see a Microsoft-owned studio making Linux games and was ready to fully support it but this can't be taken seriously. Sorry to say this but it's so bad I can only take it as either a joke or a "go f* yourself" message to the community. Or maybe some dark magic to release it in such a state.

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
84.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 octobre 2020
I'm really wavering between a Yes and a No. It's low on immersion, there's a huge amount of backtracking, game mechanics are rather vague, inventory management is a hassle, and the combat becomes increasingly repetitive. The best example is The Legions of Baron Harkyn where you have to defeat 99 waves. It's very easy, but also a boring time sink. Most boss fights are also rinse and repeat. I killed Yadis before going to the Haernhold so I had to reload an earlier save game in order to do the DLC contents. The mobs were red (even though you can beat them) which generally means "come back later". I skipped the Redcap fight. It has first strike, is immune to crowd control, deals poison damage, has a massive amount of HP, and can regenerate. All the other bosses are just goblins compared to this guy. But who knows, maybe with six Outlanders...
So why a Yes? I enjoyed most of the puzzles, the banter between the NPCs (though this was also repetitive), some of the combat, and all of the music.
 
Doranov
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
55.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2020
顶级的音乐，独树一帜的战斗、冒险系统，新颖、难度恰好合适的谜题是这款游戏三个最大的亮点。音乐为凯尔特传统音乐，有民谣和古典的风格在里面，听着非常舒服，很容易就被洗脑了；另外音乐与任务剧情、战斗系统、谜题融洽地结合在一起，让人惊叹，这种特色除了这款游戏之外应该没有了吧。回合制的战斗系统与其他任何游戏的都不一样，很有，初期上手简单，后期还能够变化多端，这样的具有策略性的战斗方式实属难得。常见的，原创的谜题类型都包含其中，实在解不开的谜题还能用官方作弊器解决。
缺点就是作为众筹游戏，缺钱，画质不够精细，有几处bug，中文翻译小部分有些问题，总之就是各种细节的优化不够好。
但总体来看，瑕不掩瑜，这绝对算得上一款优秀作品。
 
Cigar
12 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juillet 2020
If you like puzzles this game is for you. If not I don't recommend it. Very poor character creation. You get to pick a portrait and that is it to character creation, no changing your body, shoulders, head, hair, skin, or face. And the portrait selection doesn't live up to pair with your physical skin. This portrait is also the only way you can pick your gender.
Combat was actually enjoyable if you don't mind playing chess. However I learned I didn't gain hit points as I leveled instead I had to acquire more health with my gear, or spend a leveling point to get more, which was ok, it just didn't feel rewarding to level and spend my leveling point for health to compensate for poor gear. The monsters i did fight didn't reward enough for me to upgrade my entire party. So I would end up with one or maybe 2 characters up to pair for fighting monsters and my other party members were poorly geared. I begin to struggle where to find monsters to get currency to upgrade my gear. I did find rewards for going into newer puzzle areas, which sometimes offered sellable rewards or a new piece of gear. However these were very time consuming and I was forced to fight monsters I couldn't gear my party for. I did not see monsters respawn to kill either?
The game would crash for me after learning a song from the first elf that joins my party. Which is story related, whom you meet pretty early in the game. It would crash after playing the song in the city. It's an old issues that was suppose to be fixed but is not, atleast for me. So I did my best to avoid casting it and never used it to progress. Not sure if it's required later on in the game? I hope not.
Game environment was fine, I enjoyed exploring and seeing what was around the corner or what I might find. Hopefully not another puzzle? Would like to have seen more objects to loot or pick up. But its not skyrim.
If you your still interested in playing this game, knowing it's a strong puzzle game. I'd recommend waiting for it to go on sale.
 
Revanight253
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2019
Pretty much a downgrade straight across the board from the original version. The same bugs from the first release of Bard Tale 4 are still present, combat hiccups are rampant, the world itself got totally downgraded and the "bright" colour scheme they added to the the game just looks really bad when the world/story is supposed to be dark and gritty. Honestly it makes no sense.

Zero new pictures/avatars were added for this release so every single female main character portrait makes them look like angry men, not a single feminine picture to be found in the game outside of Fiona and The Green Lady, yet they couldn't make their portraits an option for the main character.

Sure they added male elves and female dwarfs but the characters in general are so ugly that they all end up looking like men anyways. Speaking of character portraits they're still awful, wanna be a male mage? either you make your character look like an old man or you're in a head to toe suit of armor.
Wanna be a female bard? Good luck every single female portrait looks like an angry man with an autistic haircut. This issue was spoken about several times in the original game's forums and in reviews but they didn't do a single thing to address why literally every portrait outside of the main party members and Melody look awful.

In regards to the baseline game the same problems are found in this release. I genuinely have no idea what they even did to the game outside of making it look like a Disney movie colour wise and adding the opposite gender variants of elves and dwarfs.

The combat is actually really fun and the music is phenomenal but the puzzles take too long and there are entirely too many spread throughout the entire game. Nearly every single room in a dungeon has some form of annoying puzzle to open a door to get to the next room's puzzle. Half your play time is doing puzzles the other half is combat.
It was half-heartedly addressed in this "director's cut" by adding a hack song that forces your way through, however it only works on the "main storyline" puzzles so if you want to use it to get past a certain one for a chest or secret room or something you'll still need to consult an online guide to get past it.

Honestly this isn't bard's tale it's a mildly fun turn-based tactics game filled to bursting with awful puzzles and some of the worst character design I've ever seen. If the game had literally any other title I don't think people would've been so hard on the game.

Bard's Tale 4 gets a 3/10 rating from me unless the colours are fixed, bugs are actually addressed and they put in at least ONE mildly attractive female portrait that the main character can use (like Fiona).

Until then this game just isn't worth the price even at 75% off.
 
Lust

Good role-playing game!
7/10

+ Good visual style.
+ Good soundtrack.
+ Good voice acting.
+ Good gameplay.
+ Good turn-based combat.
+ Various skill trees and combat tactics.
+ Lots of puzzles.

- Some brain-killing puzzles.
- Several bugs.

Not perfect, but addictive game!

0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
42.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 juillet 2020
Запустилось на win 7. С точки зрения оптимизации не самая лучшая, на максималках дикие просадки (i5-4590, 16 ОЗУ, 1050Ti - 4Gb), но игра в целом не про графику, поэтому чуть улучшенные средние настройки выглядят приятно, можно по идее провести эксперименты и глянуть что же так сильно нагружает видео, но смысла в этом не много, это не тот проект, который должен очаровывать графикой, он про другое.

Когда игра вышла, она стоило дико дорого около 2к, про неё писали, что в ней море багов, что можно утонуть и всё такое. К счастью цена на распродаже вполне себе подъемная, для тех кто не может себе купить win10, если в очередной раз откажет Win7, как было зимой, есть поддержка linux, да и багов особых замечено не было.

На фоне современных игр игра смотрится особняком - тут и бои пошаговые и графика не из ААА проекта (хоть и унреал, но из него явно не всё выжали, что могли). При всём при этом ощущение древнего Шотландского города игра задает. Да сюжет может не нов, но горечь фентезийного-геноцида передается. Если вспомнить, то игра уходит корнями в то время, когда часть происходящего вокруг себя люди брали из своей головы.

Не знаю есть ли смысл играть в неё на хардкоре с одной жизнью или включать режим аля-80е (да игра может вернуть вас в ещё более старомодный режим, если пожелаете, но смысла в этом особого нет).

Нельзя прыгать, зато есть вещи по которым можно спускаться/опускаться, так что высота в игре все же присутствует.

Отдельно стоит отметить боевки, по ощущениям это не Х-ком, но критануть всё же можно, не знаю как будет дальше, но начало довольно приятное не смотря на совсем крохотное поле для битвы.

Классы довольно интересные - этакие серединка-на-половинку, здесь даже бард не гнушается взять сабельку и рубить супостатов. В целом стартовых классов всего 4 - бард, маг, воин и плут(что-то между классическим рейнджером и вором).

Хочется верить, что студия соберет нормальное количество денег, чтобы начать делать что-то действительно достойное и восстанавливать славу Интерпелея. Быть может мы стоим на пороге, когда у них получится привнести что-то новое в жанр.

Некоторое головоломки выглядят странно - и их можно отключить на старте игры в настройках. В остальном "Истории Барда" заигрывают на ностальгических чувствах.

Русификация конечно хромает, но на одну ногу.

При всех минусах игра заслуживает внимания. Посмотрите обзоры, почитайте о ней и может быть она вас зацепит, приглашая в очередной раз (спустя 35 лет после выхода первой части) спасти фантастический город от беды.

Ложки дёгтя. - Встречаются баги.

Ловушка теней (башня Мангара) - в этой локации не всё сразу сработало как надо, даже ловушки бездействовали.

Иногда миникарта ведёт себя так, словно вы только вошли в локацию - лечится перезагрузкой.

И бывают моменты когда у героев не работают заклинания - лечится перезагрузкой... но после пары раз впадаете в паранойю чтобы сохраняться после каждой битвы.

Показалось, что у мага не очень хорошо работает часть заклинаний... но так как он выбыл со временем из пати, то может просто показалось )

Местами загадки и головоломки очень затянуты или нудные.
 
eiroglif
513 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2020
Después del último parche el juego ha dejado de funcionar en Windows 7. Se ha reportado al departamento de soporte pero no ha sido arreglado todavía. No recomiendo su compra hasta que lo hayan solucionado.

After the last update the game has stopped working on windows 7. It has been reported to support but has not yet been fixed. I recommend not buying this game until it is fixed.

Edito:

Dado que ya han solucionado el problema de que dejase de funcionar en Windows 7, recomiendo este juego.
Tiene un sistema de combate por turnos que está bastante bien y es diferente de la mayoría de RPG's.

I edit:

Since they have already solved the problem that it stopped working on Windows 7, I recommend this game.
It has a turn-based combat system that is pretty good and is different from most RPG's.

Recommandé
88.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2021
I love this game so much! It's a piece of art, it really has a soul. Exploration and puzzles provide lots of options and the maps contain a lot of small immersive details, adding flavor to each region. Small secrets scattered around the map are fun to find, and there are cute easter eggs too. Combat system is so fun and satisfying that even after hundreds of battles you don't get bored of them and want more. There's a lot of special abilities and hero builds, item powers, consumables which can be used in a battle, allowing to play differently and find your own way to win. Monsters design is just awesome and music is wonderful, making you want to listen to the soundtrack even outside of the game. The celtic feel of the game world is probably the best part of the immersion, and I also love how faithful the game stays to the old parts of the title, so you can even recognize specific streets of Scara Brae and find a lot of references, I played 80+ hours at the moment of the review, and are close to the end of story, and I know I'll miss this game and one day I will want to replay - even with the same character, it will still be fun. Thank you devs for this beautiful game!
 
Lanjane
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
102.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2020
Juego hecho ♥♥♥ cariño. Lo estoy disfrutando como un enano. Me falta mucho para terminarlo.
El sistema de combate me parece una gozada. Súper táctico e intuitivo. Todas las armas y armaduras aportan algún matiz táctico, son todas diferentes, no se limitan simplemente a aportar daño o defensa y ademas se complementan muy bien ♥♥♥ las habilidades. Si os gusta idear builds vais a disfrutar.
La historia es sencilla pero cumple. Los puzles molan y al menos hasta el momento, encuentro que tienen la dificultad muy ajustada. Y la música, la banda sonora es uno de los mejores apartados. Si os gusta la música gaélica vais a gozar de verdad.
En definitiva, creo que vale mucho la pena. La mayoría de reseñas negativas son por problemas varios de lanzamiento. Están casi todos solucionados.
Si tuviera que poner cosas ''mejorables' que no negativas serian quizás el diseño artístico de los npcs en general y la optimización.

Recommandé
153.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 décembre 2023
<< Addition to the review after tenths of hours of gameplay: Bards Tale 4 includes some very nice exploration elements that are not obvious at the first hours of the game: Many riddles to access loot (i.e. the magic markings scattered around below skara bray can be activated by nearby hidden switches to open the arch door.) Really innovating activation of abilities at the elven weapons: View them closely from your menu, and try to spot the positions on the rotating image of the weapon that activate the puzzle embedded on the weapon decorations. - The game is a hidden gem of old school beloved RPGs. >>

- Beautiful scenery.
- Interesting, classic-RPG story that evolves step-by-step.
- Fantastic music created specifically for the game.
- Developers love and nostalgia for the original old-time-classic game trilogy. (ie hundreds pages of books-novels on the expanded edition).
- Tactical turn-based combat, with plenty of different-than-the-usual-2023-mainstream-gamming skills. Especially if you select the Bard class as your character (definitely recommenced), the abilities/spells are creating a strategy approach that I don't recall having experienced in a game for very-very long. Add combat-grid-movement tactics to the available-actions-management element, and the combat escalates to be interesting, tactical and a fresh idea worthing the game's purchasing.

- For me to enjoy the game, I had to use a cheat to get more Mercenary Tokens : Initially I was concerned and annoyed at the first hours of gamplay by the bit awkward system of characters (NPC or Custom made) progression. I felt anxious and restricted by the fact that I had to find and spend the "rare" mercenary-tokens to reset my characters skills or create new characters, especially since in this fist-run the fresh-new-uncommon skills lead me to learn-by-playing and wanting to reset my main character and to reset the standard Companions or create new ones... That meant a handful of mercenary-tokens were needed, and I was getting frustrated by the thought that I would not have them.
But, as I am explaining in a relevant guide I am posting here on Steam, very close to the beginning of the game (level 5, just when the game becomes open-world-side-quest friendly), if we use a Treiner to get unlimited money for a few moments, we can purchase all the Mercenary Tokens our heart desire.

All in all, considering my game-evaluation criterion: The Bards Tale 4 has kept me not-sleeping for about 5 nights on the row. I now have started falling asleep on the keyboard while playing. ... Thus, it is a definitely YES RECOMENDED ! by me :-)
 
PeliasDeWizzzrd
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
96.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2019
Bards Tale IV Directors Cut
Es ist ein OldSchool RPG aus der Ego Perspektive aller Black Crypt oder Lands of Lore (kleiner Verweis: jahaa ich weiß, dass die Wizardry Reihe und Dungeon Master viel populärer sind, aber ich habe weder das eine noch das andere je gespielt (Notiz an mich: Bildungslücke???)
Dennoch habe ich dieses kleine feine Genre für mich wieder entdeckt und als Experiment eben Bards Tale bei Steam erworben. Die Alternative wäre Operencia: The Stolen Sun gewesen, aber ich hatte bis dato keinen Epic Store Account und dieses Spiel ist eben temporär exklusiv für diesen welchen,

Nun aber zum Spiel:
Die Story vom Bards Tale ist recht schnell erzähl: Ancient Evil is lurking in the Dark... Punkt.
Anfangs weiß man noch nicht genau worum es geht, aber alle fremden Rassen und Andersgläubigen in der Spielwelt werden von der vorherrschenden Klasse der Kirche und ihren fanatischen Paladinen verfolgt und tyrannisiert. Schnell bekommt man aber mit, dass mehr dahinter steckt und loooooos gehts.
Ich will nicht spoilern deswegen... gleich zum Fazit: Nett, nicht mehr aber auch nicht weniger.
Interssanter ist die Spielmechanik:
-Elfenwaffen die, wenn man ihre Rätsel löst, zusätzliche Bonusfähigkeiten freischalten.
-Tolle Anspruchsvolle Rätsel, zum Teil seeeehr anspruchsvoll (ich habe 2 mal in ein Walkthrough gucken müssen und bis heute nicht verstanden warum man von einem Bild mit Krähen auf ein Glockenspiel schließen kann, Notiz an mich: viellicht bin auch einfach zu blöd???)
-Taktische Rundenkämpfe die gerade anfangs recht fordernd sind, nachher aber fast ein bisschen zu einfach, wenn man die richtige Allround Taktik gefunden hat. Ein Wechsel der Skillung ist bei meinem Durchlauf nur ein mal notwendig gewesen (Schwierikgeitsgrad Normal ohne Permadeath),
Die Atmosphäre ist meist recht gelungen. Sehr liebevoll gestaltete Musik. Obwohl ich kein Fan irisch oder schottischer Volklore bin ist es hier, wo es doch im Kern um den Barden an sich geht, sehr passend und gelungen. Vor allem steckt viel arbeit drin, und das merkt man! Die Grafik hat sehr schöne Glanz und Lichteffekte, allerdings sind die Animationen teilweise recht hölzern. Außerdem gibt es auch in der DR Cut Version teilweise in den Kämfen fehlende Animationsphasen und das ist wirklich nicht das was ich von einer DR Cut Version erwarte. Die Sprecher sind ausnahmslos gut (alles Englisch mit häufig starkem schottischem Akzent und deutschem Untertitel (sehr empfehlenswert, wie gesagt schottischer Akzent))

Insgesamt hatte ich viel Spass, wenn auch gleich das Spiel zum Ende hin (die letzten 4 Stunden Spielzeit) teilweise Qualvolle Rätsel beinhaltete. Am Ende war man aber dann doch froh und stolz wenn man sie gelöst hatte.
Kurzum: Ich bin froh dieses Experiment gewagt zu haben und werde irgendwann nächstes Jahr dann auch mal zu einem anderen Rollenspiel dieser Art linsen,,, evlt auch Operencia, es erscheint dann ja auch bei Steam.

Wertung: 7 out of 10

 
Biberattacke
0

Non recommandé
40.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2019
Bought this game as part of the initial kickstarter. I was a big fan of the original Bards Tale 1 (and 2) games growing up. I remember creating my own maps on quadruled paper, jotting down puzzle notes, and building out my party.

This game I would rate as 3 out of 5 stars. It brings back some of the nostalgia, but I feel like the are just too many clunky parts.

What works:
* The music and dialogue is engaging. I enjoy some of the gaelic(?) background music as I am just walking around.
* Skill trees are okay. I would like something a little more expansive, or at least more descriptive to know the outcome. For example, if I am going to pick +2 strength for my warrior, how does this affect my damage?
* the graphics are also okay. I understand that this is not a AAA title. So I am okay with what we see.

What does not work:
* Lots of stuff unfortunately. They are all little nuances that just seem to add up.
* The mapping is horrendous. How come I can't browse other maps? Without giving away spoilers, I am in one floor of the map, how come I can scroll to see upper floors? How come I can't set my own waypoint? Why does the fog of war effect cover up stuff that I have uncovered? How come the waypoint that is done for quests only sometimes shows you the way to go? How come when I look at a quest, it doesn't give me more information on where I need to go? (Doesn't need a waypoint, just be more descriptive.)
* The navigation is also quite bad. There are times where I have no idea where I need to go (see previous comment). So I just wander. But sometimes I can't wander because the game will just prevent me from walking further. At least put up a door or a mountain or something like that so I know I can't keep walking in that direction.

I think at this point I am going to give the game a break. Not sure if I will come back honestly to finish. I have about 40 hours in, but it has not really been that enjoyable.
 
gojira93

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 février 2020
This is not a good game. I enjoyed the previous Bard's Tales (and highly enjoyed Wasteland 2) and looked forward to this one, but this game seems like it was designed in 2006 and released in 2019.

Graphics - Bad. Looks about the same as Morrowind, which came out almost 2 decades earlier.

Performance - Bad. And I really don't understand why (see graphics above). Why does the game lag when I enter each room? Why does it sometimes take 5s for my actions to register? Crashed 3 times in 10hrs (~ every 3hrs)

UI - Bad. Very clunky. Sometimes it will take multiple clicks for to select the correct item. Definitely feels like it was designed 20 years ago. Inventory management is a pain. Selecting items is a pain. The map doesn't even zoom out all the way.

Game play - Bad. It's just not fun. The balance and tuning is downright perplexing. Sometimes the best option for a fight is for one of your characters to sit there and do nothing? Why doesn't each character get a turn? Why is the AI so bad? Playing on higher difficulties it mostly just becomes a RNG of whether the AI will focus fire or not.

Story - Bad. I've been playing for 10hrs and I'm still not quite sure what the plot is. But at least they put in a lot of corny joke banter.

Music - Good. Each region has an excellent soundtrack.

Overall - I think I would have enjoyed this more if I'd just bought the soundtrack. This game feels like it was made 15 years ago, scrapped as not good enough, and then brought back to life and sold at full price with no changes.
 
PewPew!

169.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 octobre 2022
This is a proper piece of creative art - the makers should be super proud of themselves.

Proper old-skool game for old farts like myself, with plenty of modern tweaks to appeal to the youngsters too.

I loved it. I loved the humour, I loved the party development and I loved the story.

The puzzles do get annoying at times...but no game is perfect.

I reckon this is very replayable - as with a different party set up, the experience would be quite different. I love the interaction between the party members, already looking forward to doing with again with a different party.

If you grew up with the Ultimas, Wizardry, Orginial Bard's tales - you will love this - worth every penny.

It is telling that less than 7% have completed the game...feels good to do it.

I recommend the middle difficulty level - easy is way too easy...

Enjoy!

Recommandé
80.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mai 2022
Bardzo przyjemny i wciągający drużynowy dungeon crawler, w którym nie brakuje walk, ale także dobrze skonstruowanych zagadek logicznych. Z czasem te pierwsze w większości przestają być wyzwaniem, ale system potyczek został stworzony tak, by zbytnio to nie przeszkadzało, bo żonglowanie umiejętnościami postaci i ich miejscami na siatce samo w sobie czasami jest łamigłówką. Co do oprawy audiowizualnej to jest lepiej niż dobrze, zwłaszcza dzięki wspaniałej szkockiej muzyce wokalnej, choć grafika, mimo niedostatków, również ma swój urok.

Czas na wady, a tych jest kilka, przede wszystkim dotyczących opowieści. Nie jest ona jakoś mocno wciągająca, a niezbyt charyzmatyczne postaci napotkane w czasie przygody nie pozostają w pamięci. Irytują trochę marne łupy poukrywane w sekretnych miejscach i mało modeli broni oraz pancerzy. Z pewnym typem broni wiążą się fajne zagadki, ale szkoda że jest to oręż raczej średni i dość szybko staje się bezużyteczny, więc jego zdobywanie przestaje bawić. Dość znaczącą techniczną wadą, jeśli chodzi o bitwy, są zdarzające się w ich trakcie zwieszki, kiedy gra "myśli" i nie nadąża za wykonywanymi akcjami.

Jako całość Bard's Tale IV to kawał solidnej przygody, która wciąga na kilkadziesiąt godzin - mój czas rozgrywki to pełne jej ukończenie (choć być może coś pominąłem). A kiedy nadszedł finał zostało we mnie jeszcze trochę ochoty na więcej. (7.5/10)

A végére értem és úgy érzem nagyon nagy hiba lett volna kihagyni ezt a játékot. Nem találok szavakat...először nagyon nehezen ültem neki, mivel megvettem megjelenéskor és technikai hibából adódóan nem tudtam vele játszani. Aztán annyit szemeztem vele az évek alatt,hogy rászántam magam és nekiültem. Már a főmenü zenéje olyan volt, hogy magával ragadott, a többit pedig nem is említem...volt,hogy combatban maradtam 10 percig,hogy hallgathassam az aláfestést. A grafikája is nagyon szép, bár meg kell hagyni néha (szerencsére nem túl gyakran) vannak rendesen FPS droppok. A combat eleinte monoton, ám később nagyon élvezetes. Kicsit megtévesztő lehet a 4 class a játékban, azonban a különféle specializációk ezt ellensúlyozzák. 35-40 óra úgy kijátszani, hogy mindent kiszedsz. Kell ennél több? Szerintem nem!

Recommandé
60.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2020
Cabbage? Carrots? Potatoes?

The first part of the game is amazing. Mechanics are great, combat is challenging, you have things to buy in the shops and the gold is limited. Sadly the second part of the game is quite the opposite. Merchants don't have gold to buy all the legendary junk you have. Even on legendary difficulty with non-optimal builds, you beat bosses that are marked as impossible without losing a hit point.

Technical implementation is poor. Constant crashes, buggy collisions, opening chests may send you to fly. Performance is also terrible. Even on Ryzen 3950X with RTX 2070 Super I have experienced major lags(fortunately not all the time).

Motion sickness has become another problem for me. Despite being a VR veteran it was really hard to play. Changing the filed of view and few other options helped a lot.

Despite all of that I highly recommend this game. It has a SOUL. Uniq atmosphere and a lot of fun
 
Dr.Schnitzel

Recommandé
102.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 juillet 2020
From somebody who never played Bard's Tale earlier games, but loves adventure games - I highly recommend this one. This game is magical, with a lot of unique elements: art style, music, combat system and just the right mix of combat and puzzles. I want to separately mention gorgeous art style: while graphics aren't AAA as a whole(like people's models and animation is pretty simple), but locations are atmospheric and some of the landscapes are breathtaking! Also I must mention the songs: just wow. All in all this game is a "labor of love" with a lot of attention to details. I want to thank the developers and regret not being one of the backers of this project. Keep up the good work!

P.S. I played only the director's cut, so can't judge how much the game was technically improved from the initial release, but I didn't encounter a lot of issues: some rear crashes and one annoying Steel Key Gate bug.

Non recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2020
I picked up the original version of Bard's Tale on launch day and it was an insane mess. I feel like the gameplay and all would be fun if it wasn't such a technical mishap on PC. Even after months of updates, it never got any better, and then I heard a Director's Cut was coming. It boasted gameplay tweaks and performance tweaks that should make it all a much better experience.

Well, I'm here to say that this is still insanely disappointing. It's a shame, because inXile has done some incredible work in the past, but this game is a monster to get to run without technical issues, and don't even bother if you play games at higher than than 60hz refresh rate. I've got a 9900k and 1080ti and get like 50fps in the very first area when the game starts (with a 144hz monitor, it just looks absolutely horrid). I have the Xbox Game Pass, so I'm thinking I may give it a look on console, since I'm sure it's locked to 30fps and would probably look just fine on a TV. But as a PC game, this is one of the most shockingly disappointing releases I've had the misfortune of buying in the last few years.

Mileage may vary; if you're a die-hard dungeon crawler fan, I say grab it on sale and hope that it works for you. As I said, gameplay seems fun, but it's a graphical and technical mess for me personally. Hard to enjoy the gameplay when the game doesn't play.
 
Jack Meta

Fantastic! I don't find myself writing many reviews but I felt inclined on this one. Thank you developers for the nostalgia I thought was once lost from my rpg video games

Argonauta
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
171.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2020
4.2/5 . RPG . Great first person group RPG with tactical-ish combat. Unreal engine 3D, very rich visual environment. One of my favorite features in any 3D visual game is having long vistas where I can see distant parts of the world that are actually integrated. BardsTale4 has some absolutely amazing artwork built into the 3D world and textures. Some disturbingly Geiger-esque stylings with blood and torture and murder. But, it fits within the context. There are some pretty awful bugs and annoyances. And you have to like or be willing to work through some complex, large-number-of-steps, logic and physical puzzles. Some of it is like doing the same cardboard puzzle for the 17th time. The online walkthroughts available as of May 2020 were not very good and one has to grind through a lot of the puzzles.

The game balance for fights was pretty good until the last fifth of the game, when things become slightly too easy with some key exceptions. The dwarven crypt has some very difficult battles and we decided to bail on the spider monster rather than re-configure our whole team (again) to try to meet its very unique attack & defense style.

There are some very harsh reviews out there. The game video performance is imperfect, you will likely have to run it on low settings. It still looks great. I ran it on low with the distance view on Ultra. There are some very annoying UI issues. The glow from a spell or skill coming off a character can make it nearly impossible to click on the square above the glowing unit.

The voice acting is A plus. Much of the music is really very good. Out of class good, there are few games with music with sung lyrics that come close to this quality. There are some short loops that should have been longer. And the UI for changing repeated songs is stupid.

The end of the game, as with many games, was unsatisfying. If you're playing the game for the sole purpose of getting to the super great end, you will be very disappointed. It's a problem with a lot of movies, tv shows, and computer games. There are definitely several parts of BT4 that seem unfinished or, rather, dropped on the floor as the team fled to other projects. There are polish issues. Crashing is common enough that you really should figure out where the save games are and write a script to automatically back them up every few hours.

Also, the story after about 40 hours of play becomes more sadistic than is my preference. I would like to save people from torture, not just be a witness and listen to their screams.

Overall, some pretty fun puzzles, some great fights, a good skill tree that runs out a little too early. And WHY THE HELL DO THE BARS RUN OUT OF BOOZE? Bars do not run out of water. Taverns do not run out of beer. Every RPG game developer who ever makes a game where one can't empty their backpack because no vendor has any money (and won't take items for free); any game dev who makes a (wet) world where you can't buy water ... well, go to jail. Despite our enjoyment of this game, someone needs to get a public slap on the wrist. Also, what is up with not being able to look at one's worn-items when shopping at a vendor?

Over 40+ years now of DnD type games, with a huge amount of evolution and knowledge and best practices and we're still subjected to having these UIs designed by people who have never had to manage hundreds of items in backpacks and on a team of characters.

Anyway, this is a beautiful game with lots of content and interesting fights, items, visuals, story, many puzzles. Top notch voice acting, singing, audio. Highly recommended, with the strong caveat that there are some bugs and UI annoyances. Also, you have to just hold your nose and survive the first 30 minutes of play where you're being introduced to the world in a somewhat blurry and unpleasant way. Also, there are some inside jokes if you played BT1 & 2, but you don't need to have played the first installment to enjoy this very good RPG.
 
zormzorm
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
96.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2020
Overall, this title is a lot of fun. I want this combat system to be used again in another game. Lots of fun configuring your party to fight just how you like it. Highly recommend this game if you're into scrutinizing combat mechanics and tinkering with character builds. The music and setting are outstanding as well. Some amusing character interactions in there, but nothing super memorable.

The game is a great ride for turn-based tactical fans for about 50% of the content. After the middle of the game, it loses the challenge. I played on Hard, and I did not look up any cheesy tactics or exploits... but yet my party crushes the content at a certain point. You definitely have some rough fights in the first half, but eventually you start outpacing the content easily.

Wish they had fleshed out the loot from mid to end-game better. At a certain point in playing the game, you feel like you spend a lot of time solving puzzles and fighting nasties to get rewards that are just NOT very rewarding. It's like the loot can only get SO good, then you're wondering why you're bothering with some of the content. I particularly remember approaching Langskaal Castle (about 80% of the way into the game) and feeling like there was room after room of wasted opportunities. Like the level designers made this beautiful setting, but the game designers didn't know what to put in it. So you find RNG loot barrels just as likely to give you a cabbage as another useless "epic" bow or something you don't need.

And there are tons bugs. When people complain about bugs in reviews, I instantly get skeptical. Usually has something to do with somebody's virus laden porntop or a 20 year-old Dell their grandparents gifted them. But no... this game has BUGS. For real. Prepare to reload and lose progress. Most frustrating thing about this game. My experience with them is primarily the combat turns wigging out. When you perform an action in the turn-based combat, it sort of queues it and plays things out as quickly as the animations and algorithms allow. However, sometimes things go awry and you're left staring at the enemies for a few seconds not doing anything while it presumably thinks. Worst case, it actually just hangs up and nobody can act in combat. RELOAD TIME! I'm looking at you Harkyn's Castle!

I don't want to NOT recommend this game, because it was worth the ride for me. However, I doubt that most people will want to FINISH this game. It is great for a while, but you'll likely move on to something else before the end.
 
Omnicide
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mai 2020
What I liked - the mechanics felt like an updated version of the original classic. The turn based combat with some characters in front and others behind.

What I didn't like - they used the names of the original bards tunes from the original game, but they didn't play the original tunes. They should have had it so when the bard sings a tune, it becomes the background music until the tune ends or the bard starts another song.

But it's a small thing, I'm having fun with the game and I"m still playing it.
 
The Largecow

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
99.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2020
This review is for the Director's Cut version.

Story - 7/10 there's nothing new here, but as cliched stories go it was good and some of the characters are really well voiced, and the game does a good job unfolding the story

Combat - 7/10 turn based with front and back rows (front row protects back row from melee but not ranged or magic attacks). I prefer turn based combat, if you don't this score will probably be lower for you

Class/Skill System - 8/10 well designed with lots of options (although certain skills are much better than others)

Graphics - 7/10 a bit cartoonish, but good and they fit the game well

Music - 10/10 Some of the best songs I've ever heard in a game. Really good.

Sound - 8/10 Good

Length and Pace - 8/10 Good

Game stability - 9/10 no game killing bugs, no corrupted saves, only experienced a few game crashes with no impact on the game other than needing to restart the few times it happened

Overall Rating - 8/10 Strong recommendation, especially if you like turn based combat and good music. A great update to the Bard's Tale game series

Recommandé
93.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2020
I know this game had a rough launch, but I only recently played it via The Director's Cut and have to say this is a pretty great game! Character builds, quests, puzzles (love me some old school-like RPG puzzles!), music, ambient sounds, all really well done. I got a kick out of when you go to load a saved game, and depending on where you are in the game you have a bard telling a group of people a snippet of a story relating to your main quest line in the game. Could have used a little more variety in the mobs you fight though and definitely needed some kind of central storage place for hoarders like me. Overall though, I enjoyed every minute of the game. Hope there is a Bard's Tale V.

111.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2019
Cara-Faktor: 8
Ein würdiger Nachfolger zur alten Bard's Tale-Reihe! Jede Minute merkt man dem Spiel an, dass es die Entwickler mit Liebe produziert haben. Es fängt den Geist der damaligen Serie sehr gut ein und präsentiert sich in modernem Gewand.
Die Unkenrufer gingen wohl mit anderen Erwartungen an das Spiel heran, meine wurden jedenfalls erfüllt. Ein Wort zur Grafik: Es ist ja keine AAA-Produktion und stellte auch nicht den grafischen Anspruch einer solchen. Aber sie ist durchaus gelungen und auch im Detail liebevoll gemacht.
Die Puzzles waren etwas zu viel. Ich löse gern Rätsel, aber etwas weniger wäre hier mehr gewesen.
Grandios hingegen der Soundtrack, darüber sind sich aber glaub ich alle einig.
Positiv erwähnen möchte ich auch das innovative Kampfsystem, das hat wirklich Spaß gemacht.
In Summe in kleines aber feines Spiel, das ich gern fortgesetzt sehen würde!
 
caratac

Recommandé
65.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2019
Nach dem etwas arg holprigen Start habe ich das Spiel gerade beendet.
Bis auf einen Magier habe ich nur die vorgegebenen NPCs benutzt.
Eine Bewertung ist gar nicht so einfach, das Spiel macht vieles richtig, aber leider auch viel falsch

TL;DR: solider Dungeon Crawler mit einigen Bugs und kleineren Problemen. Wer Kohl mag, kann bedenkenlos zugreifen!

Nicht so schön:
Furchtbare GUI! Das Inventory ist an Lächerlichkeit nicht zu überbieten. Auch der Kampfbildschirm ist alles andere als funktionell.

Bugs, viele Bugs!

Alles ist statisch, niemand bewegt sich. Außer der ein oder andere Gegner auf sehr begrenzter Patrouille.
NPCs sehen merkwürdig aus.

Kämpfe reichen von lächerlich einfach bis hin zu blödsinnig schwer.
Einige Boss-Kämpfe setzen eine bestimmte Skillung/Bewaffnung voraus. Hat man die nicht, sieht man schnell sehr alt aus.
Auch der RNG-Gott hat zu viel mit zu reden. Z.b.: ziemlich Früh bekämpft man einen Kapuzenmann, der Kobolde beschwört. An sich kein Problem. Es sei denn, er beschwört lauter Bomben-Kobolde.
Einige Bosse regenerieren sich wenn ein eigener Char stirbt oder regenerieren bis zu 3x die komplette Rüstung.
Dass der "Röhrling" ganze drei mal Platt gemacht werden musste, fand ich jetzt auch nicht so prickelnd.
Langweilig. Der Kampf wird dadurch nur länger und ggf nerviger, aber auf keinen Fall interessanter.

Einige Bugs.

Sehr, sehr viele Rätsel.
Das ist nicht unbedingt schlecht, besonders schwer sind sie auch nicht.
Oft genug einfach nur Sinnlos und reine Zeitverschwendung. Warum tauchen im Endgame Meister-Schloßknacker Kisten hinter Rätseln mit 49 Gold oder einem Buttermesser auf?

Bugs. Darüber, dass Savegames zerstört waren, konnte ich am wenigsten lachen.

Zuwenig Wasser. Der Barde lebt vom Saufen. Ich hatte zwei dabei. Und die hatten mächtig Durst.
Und Hunger.
Jedenfalls gab es später nirgends mehr eine einzige Flasche Wasser!
Wenn ihr schon Chars von Alkohol abhängig macht, seht doch bitte zu, dass auch genügend da ist!
Nahrung, Gold, sinnlose Waffen und Rüstungen gibt es weit mehr als man je gebrauchen oder gar verkaufen kann.
Aber gerade da wird gespart. Andere Items benötigen auch Wasser.

Der Rest passt soweit.
  • Die Musik ist großartig und passt wunderbar zum Spiel.
  • Der Humor gefällt mir gut. Es gibt einiges an Unterhaltung innerhalb der Gruppe.
  • Die Grafik ist seit dem Patch auch wieder recht ansehnlich - zumindest die Umgebung.
  • Die Rätsel sind allesamt schaffbar. Die meisten, die man zum weiterkommen braucht, lassen sich außerdem einfach per Lied lösen. Ohne wäre mir das auf Dauer auch zu blöd geworden.
  • Wer nicht genug Rätsel haben kann, findet noch zusätzlich jede Menge Rätselwaffen.
  • Wenn man sich ein wenig mit dem Spiel beschäftigt und evtl umgeskillt hat, sind die meisten (Boss)Kämpfe gut schaffbar. Nur Gaerwyn hat mich fast wahnsinnig gemacht.
  • Die Story ist nix neues, wird aber gut präsentiert.
  • Wenn man etwas aufpasst, reicht auch der Alkohol
 
Patient Nr 0
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
40.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2020
TL;DR What could/should have been an epic revival of a long dead genre, falls flat on its face due to bugs, poor graphics and bad gameplay design choices.

I wanted to love this game. So. Bad. The idea of having a modern dungeon crawler with puzzles and turn based combat in an Irish/Scottish Mythology inspired fantasy world sounds awesome. I understand that inXile was likely stuck between a rock and a hard place in developing something that, on one hand didn’t alter the original formula of the game too much to avoid alienating the old school fans, while simultaneously innovating the formula in order to draw in a bigger audience. The end result, as other negative reviews show, somehow upset people on both ends with complaints about too much or not enough innovation.
That’s not to say that The Bards Tale 4 is a horrible game, it is acceptable if you go in without expectations, but its also not great, which is a shame because it clearly has a lot of potential which shows that it could be more than what it is.
You explore a variety of game environments (many of them being dungeons, towers, castles etc) through a first person perspective, solving puzzles by pressing buttons, using items, pushing rocks on switches or playing ‘exploration songs’ which alter your environment. When you encounter enemies, which can be seen wandering around and have their level displayed over their heads, you can decide whether to rush into the battle thereby gaining first strike, or retreat quickly which is advisable when you encounter groups significantly stronger than your own party. Once combat starts, the game projects a 2x4 field for your party members and a 2x4 field for the opponent party over your current field of view, which acts as your battlefield. You have a limited number of opportunity points per round which allow you to position characters, use abilities strategically to eliminate opponents and prepare for whatever they might do during their turn. For me, this is undoubtedly the highlight of the game. Repositioning party members around on the field to avoid anticipated attacks, strategically stripping enemies of armour so you can damage them, charging spells while attempting to interrupt enemy mages…there are just so many fun things you can do. The combat system could be even better, IF it wasn’t for the bizarre design decision to only give each character six ability slots (note that even a standard attack, using an item or fleeing counts as and uses up an ability slot!). I understand that the intention may have been to force players to diversify their party setup so that each character feels unique, but it only ends up being ridiculous when my endgame Archmage can only cast six measly spells or even less if you want him to be able to use any kind of abilities for shielding themselves or regenerating spell points (a casting resource). Instead of empowering, it ends up feeling significantly restrictive, limiting the strategic choices you can make in battle.

The world itself looks ‘acceptable’, there are some nice visual aesthetics in some areas, but plenty enough washed out looking textures too. Same can be said about some of the area designs, some of the puzzles seem to extend just a little bit beyond the enjoyable/challenging to the repetitive/annoying threshold (the wisp puzzles in the Forest of Inshriach come to mind). Unfortunately this also applies to the characters, which is really unfortunate because the overall lore is off to a good start. However all the characters mostly feel like empty shells, with only occasional comments/developments making them vaguely interesting, the lack of drama and pacing in the storytelling is truly unfortunate, towards the last third of the game in particular things feel continuously dragged out.
 
TheKing
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2019
I am having a blast with this game. Great combat system, suitably complex and busy levels which are a joy to explore, Have been having a blast upgrading my characters and trying to work out which weapons and armour work with which skill upgrades.

The sweet graphics and voice acting are not why I play these types of games but are appreciated also.

The puzzles are appreciated as well

I took the day off work to dig into this game today, and I am not disappointed.

Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2019
Nice call backs to the first bard tales and not making Mangar look like a pathetic enemy. I really enjoyed the encounters and the puzzles. Pushing the mind in these games from easiest to the mind stretching is the point of these games. Graphics do need improvement but truly for the content placed into the game and story was done correctly and well. 3d does present challenges for any gaming studio when creating puzzles that try to create challenges like the 2d version. If people can overlook the graphics and really review what the game is about really should be impressed.

64.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2020
A lovely journey of a game. Somewhat niche dungeon crawler with turn-based combat. It has its issues (like bugs and ugly human models), but the environments, the humour and the songs really make up for them. My mind boggles to think how much time the devs spent on the songs. I found them sublime. The game has puzzles; secrets; crafting; drinking; crafting stuff to drink; battles and cheese; cabbage, carrots and potatoes; and, again, so many wonderful songs. I mean, this is the Bard's tale. So I'm off to drink some cold ale, dance a hearty jig, hum a lively tune and carouse with the maidens! Pip-pip!

Recommandé
17.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2019
It took me a while to get into Bard's Tale IV and must admit I struggled with the earlier versions when I had a lower specced machine.

I now have the Director's cut, am about 6 hours in, and have started to enjoy it. I think the balance of puzzles and good strategic combat harkens back to the originals whilst bringing the Bard's Tale into the modern age of gaming.

The combat is rich and unforgiving at times. Figuring out the right combination of skills, character traits, item usage and spells is intriguing and addictive. Progress is well metered and I like that the game doesn't lead you by the nose: It leaves you to figure out a lot for yourself.

As you progress through missions and unlock skills you start to realise that regions of the map previously blocked off begin to open up to you. A nice touch and one that forces you to keep your eyes open whilst trudging through familiar areas.

Character and NPC interaction can get a little tiresome and samey after a while but the diatribe is mercifully short so at least you don't have to wade through too much text.

The voice acting is of a very high standard and the sound and music are exceptional. The 'making of' video brings home how much effort the team has put in to creating such a rich and diverse world.

There are other nice touches such as the Live-action animated segments featuring the characters from the original box art. the Bard tells a story when you start on your adventure which continues to update as you advance through the plot whilst saved games are loading.

A challenging and intriguing experience: I am really glad I backed the game being a massive fan of the originals.
 
trustyferret
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

This is definitely an old-school CRPG romp and I strongly recommend it.

Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2019
So far I am enjoying the game some 20 hours in. Graphics are very good, and I enjoy the thoughtfulness needed to succeed in the turn based combat system.

I'm not that deep into the story yet, so I won't comment on that, other than the fact that there seems to be a good balance between main line and side quests.

The only complaint so far is the inventory system - which seems to have been improved from the original release, but still has some quirks in terms of navigating it. Not a deal breaker, but frustrating nonetheless.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2020
Pro:
- quite unique playstyle
- very atmospheric/immersive overall

Preference:
- amount of puzzles (tons)
- chanting music
- round based combat

Contra:
- some systems are unintuitive
- dialogue options are very static
- combat can get repetative
- "tunnel" world

If you like at least 2 of the subjective points i can recommend this game.

I have a blast playing it.

Recommandé
62.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2019
Produit reçu gratuitement

This is a good game. Even though I have been playing PC rpgs since the early 1980s (starting with Wizardry 1) I am now not really a fan of turn-based games so there is a limit to how much enjoyment I could get from a game like this, and with that this game gets pretty close to that limit as it is a good game with lots of strong points. I disagree that there are too many puzzles, and often I was hoping there would be more puzzles instead of more turn-based combat, but probably the mix is about right.

For me the weakest part of the game is the story. The game begins with a very interesting story of how authorities are trying to crack down on the use of Magic but once that story aspect fades away I mostly lost interest in the story and ultimately was not able to finish the game after 50 hours.

Still, I recommend the game and especially for those who enjoy turn-based battles. Fyi I received the game for free from a web site giveaway.

Recommandé
103.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2023
tahle hra vás překvapí v mnoha směrech. většinou příjemných :)
musím přiznat, že jsem k ní přistupoval s nedůvěrou. partička bardů proti neznámé hrozbě celému světu. toho už tu bylo. navíc čtvrtý díl. co tak může být převratného ve čtvrtém dílu něčeho?
ukázalo se, že všechno :)
Bards Tale 4 je velká a poctivá rpg s propracovaným tahovým soubojem, poměrně originálním stromem dovedností, složitýma hádankama, písničkama v galštině a jak říká sestra, nejlepšími zvuky jezení, které kdy byly ve hře použity :-D
do party můžete postupně nabrat až 6 lidí. tedy, lidí tak úplně ne. příběh se točí kolem toho, že vaše rodné město, které vaše gilda nesčetněkrát zachránila v předchozích dílech i v bohaté historii světa, se najednou otočilo proti vám. do té doby mírumilovný kult se rozštěpil a nový biskup štve lidi proti všemu nelidskému a magickému. tedy klasický "zaklínač" příběh :)
jak už název napovídá, půjde hodně o bardy. doporučuju mít v partě alespoň jednoho. já jsem měl dva.
co je to vlastně bard? inu, v této hře je to týpek (či týpka) který si na začátku boje dá korbel nějakého dobrého alkoholu, hrnek ideálně hodí po nepříteli, a pak bufuje přátele v partě, což velice výrazně pomáhá. musíte ovšem alespoň zpočátku sledovat hladinu alkoholu :) aby nepřesáhla vaši inteligenci. jinak zle dopadnete.
jak už jsem psal, strom dovedností je neobvyklý. něco mají povolání společné, ale každé má i svoje věci, a dobře nakombinovat partu a vybrané schopnosti je dost obtížné. sám jsem musel několikrát postavy přeskilovávat, abych se dostal ke kýžené taktice.
souboje jsou na tahy, ale neobvyklé na nich je, že akční body má celá parta společné. a stejně tak skupina nepřátel. to mě zpočátku trochu mátlo.
protože když máte radost, že jste zabili jednoho nepřítele, tak body využije jiný a intenzita útoku v podstatě nepolevuje až do konce. nevím jestli je to záměr. možná ano. ale je to rozhodně nezvyk.
ve hře je krásná nazpívaná hudba, jak jsem už psal, v galštině. (takže tomu nebudete rozumět) :-D
ale písničky jsou chytlavé a budete si je pobrukovat i sami.
prostředí je rozmanité, ale co do interakce trochu slabší. i když okolí vypadá členitě, propracovaně a všechno se třpytí, většinou není aktivní skoro nic. taky to není open world. takže často když před sebou vidíte pláň kam by se dalo vyrazit, jít tam nejde.
takové výhledy jsou aspoň ozvláštněny nějakými zvířátky v dálce. :) nevím jestli je to lepší nebo horší koncept než open world. ale tady jde primárně o hraní po linii příběhu, takže nějaké velké odbočky by se tu asi nehodily. i když jsou ti i sidequesty.
no uvidíme v dalším díle. první tři byly čtverečkové dungeony. teď tohle. tak pátý by mohl být ještě na další úrovni. :)
no a dostáváme se k tomu nejlepšímu ve hře a to jsou hádanky. jsou všude. doslova všude :) milion tajných i obřích tlačítek, pastí, skrytých dveří, hádanek přes celou místnost s různou mechanikou, záhadných symbolů, slovních hádanek a podobně. čili milovníci hádanek, je to přesně hra pro vás :)
musím říct že jsem se při hraní hodně bavil. (jsem milovník hádanek)
ještě jedno upozornění. ve hře se hodně zpívá. a tím nemyslím, že sem tam někam přijdete a tam někdo zpívá. to sice taky, ale ... prostě se tam zpívá... úplně všude :-O takže bacha, kdo nezpívá s námi, zpívá proti nám :-D
příjemnou zábavu.
9/10
 
kubi2x

Recommandé
69.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 septembre 2022
What I liked: the very clear focus on preserving as much of the spirit of the first three games as possible. I enjoyed the references to the prior games in the mechanics and lore.

What I didn't like: only 4 classes (skill tree then defines the specialty), the combat UI was confusing and occasionally rendered incorrectly making it impossible to target. Puzzles were repetitive and BORING. Once you solve one of a given type that has all of the "parts" included, there's absolutely no reason to do any more of them. They are all variants on the theme and you will solve them, but you will waste a LOT of time doing it. Just skip them and don't feel guilty. When a new type of puzzle comes along, do it.

The story was just okay. I'm kind of sick of the recycling of old villains as a trope. Every BT prior to this had its own, and in this one, you just fight all three. Oooh.

Replayability - VERY little. Once you've done it, there's very little to discover the next time, even trying new builds.

Favorite moment: 396 Berserkers.
 
cmcanfield
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2020
I was hoping for a modern update on original Bard's Tale game but instead found what I played of the game to be pretty linear, with few opportunities to avoid fights and no way to run away from them once engaged. You're limited to 4 active abilities per character which I didn't realize until I'd already wasted points on them, and you're locked in to certain party members instead of being able to create your own custom party. And normally I try to have an open mind nad let game franchises go in new directions, but the rest of the gameplay didn't grab me. The tactical fights were good but that was about it.

18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2021
This is a difficult game to review.

Obviously not mainstream, obviously a labour of love, obviously a bit old-school and obviously one that you will remember.

Sometimes infuriating? Charming? Exquisite Soundtrack with very virulent qualities? Puzzle-Heavy? Minmaxy Combat? Warm fuzzy feelings if you grew up in the 1990s but rage-inducing otherwise?

Most definitely.
So give it a whirl, it will broaden your horizons.

Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2019
Pretty good dungeon crawler with some modernized features that some may find off-putting.

Combat is excellent, and the director's cut addresses some of the shortcomings.

It's not perfect, but it's a well-made RPG that is interesting enough to keep playing until the conclusion.

8/10

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
50.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2020
I felt that BTIV was a decent game with some major problems. The Director's Cut fixes every single issue I had with the game.

The one thing I disliked the most about BT4 is that is is absolutely full of logic puzzles. There are really only five types of puzzles in the game, and the rules for these puzzles don't really change until the final dungeon (which is actually a lot of fun to solve). Luckily, the Director's Cut allows you to skip most if not all of these logic puzzles, making the game much more enjoyable to replay!

I had a lot of performance issues with BTIV. BTIVDC fixes this, and I had a solid 30-60fps throughout the entire game, with most indoor areas a solid 60+fps.

My other major issue with BTIV was that loot and character development stalled about halfway through the game. BTIVDC seems to have rebalanced things, so that you always have something to look forward to. Early on, earning even a single point of strength or an additional point of armor class really makes a difference; toward the middle and end, you begin reaching capstone skills (i.e. advanced class) that give you extremely powerful abilities. Unlike with BTIV, I continued to find loot that was a clear upgrade over what I was carrying throughout the entire game.

The atmosphere in this game is really something special. From the visuals to the music, it's got a heavily Celtic theme with gorgeous outdoor areas including snowy fields and lush forests. It's simply a great (and colorful) looking game!

With every issue I had with the game now resolved, I can now fully recommend that any RPG fan play this game. As a first-person 3D party-based RPG with turn-based combat (i.e. a turn-based "blobber"), it now stands among the best of the best of its genre, namely Wizardry 8, Wizards & Warriors, and Might & Magic 6-8.
 
newtmonkey
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante

после 6 часов прохождения - Блин такую задумку испортили кривой реализацией... играешь, играешь и тут находишь дверь с магическим ключем (которая разблокируется только 3 кочанами красной капусты, их в инвентаре 7 штук, но из за глюков их не показывает)... на рынок сходить нельзя, прохода нет. Шикарный слив разработчики!!! Слов нет.

Вернул бы деньги, да наиграно уже много часов для этого.

Non recommandé
54.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2019
Firstly it's important to state BT4 is a fun game, worth playing, especially if you are an old school D&Der like myself.
This review is not harping on the game in a general sense but specifically how disappointing and frustrating the Director's Cut has been.
This review is for PC.
I am of the belief that a director's cut should be better then the original and not just different or worse.
This is absolutely worse.
In the original I encountered a few bugs and crashes that were frustrating but not bad enough to make me throw up my hands and throw in the towel. It kept me entertained, enthralled and delighted throughout.
The director's cut has more bugs then the original ESPECIALLY during combat. I eventually just set the game difficulty to easy which allowed me to muscle through almost every fight despite the bugs.
The worst bug is the freezing of combat grids. Sometimes it was just one, sometimes it would be an entire row but it occurred consistently and so badly that when fighting main story bosses (even on easy) I could not progress because I essentially lost 2 and sometimes 3 of my party members due to this freezing.
I realize that at some point they will find and fix this bug, but as a game dev myself, this level of release for a game that was already released, patched and refined, is completely unacceptable. If I hadn't already purchased and played the first one, I would be extremely angry. I truly feel for any new players to the game. I can only imagine the level of buggery for console players.
At this stage I am simply HUGELY disappointed in the condition of the Director's Cut and expect better from a studio such as InXile.
 
wcmakra74
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
107.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2023
I was digging through my library for games I hadn't played and came across this one. Don't even remember when I picked it up,. but it looked like just the kind of "maybe of interest" game I buy in batches when sales come up. Expecting nothing, I fired it up, and here we are 100 hours later. I had never played the originals and had only been vaguely aware of them, and didn't even know about the kickstarter, so I had no preconceived notions/expectations.

I had a lot of fun with this game. The map and travel system is clunky with too much backtracking and sometimes unreliable quest target indicators, but manageable, basically a way of delivering you from fight to puzzle to fight and so on. I was surprised at how entertaining the fights are. There are a lot of puzzles and some of them were pretty challenging. The blood puzzles in particular can get tedious and shamefully I had to look up the solution to one of them due to needing some sleep. Story ranges between derivative and incomprehensible, but that describes 90% of all fantasy games and in fact fantasy in general. Graphics are good in a cartoonish way and voice acting is mostly very decent.

Aside from a little too much running around, my main complaint is that I was unable to turn in a couple of quests because I got the tasks done after I had hit the story point of no return - I mean in one case (scorcherer) all I would have had to do is be able to walk 100 yards but they had put in a new fence to block him off for no reason - and moreover, I found out there was a whole DLC (dwarf area) after I was too far in the story to go do it. No NPC told me hey, go check out the DLC. Nothing in the quest log. Just oops, you can't do that, even though there's a standing stone ring teleport point thingy right before the final fight, it doesn't work. Weird, and I'm not loading up a save from 6 levels back or whatever just to do a DLC when I already did the last boss fight. Anyway, I guess I'll never experience the pleasure of the dwarven realm or whatever, but the game was still totally worth playing.

A note on the music - I loved Skyrim, but that Dragonborn song that everyone was so creamy about back in the day? I found it very meh. In BT4, the music is really a cut above and very apropos to the setting and lore. I found the main menu tune annoying at first but then got into it and caught myself singing it at random non-gaming times, like in the car or on the toilet. Of course I also often catch myself singing the "creature report" tune from the Octonauts, but that's another story.

Actually, an Octonauts RPG would rock, especially in which they acknowledge that they're a privately funded paramilitary force with far future tech that has somehow been sent back to the present.
 
Gryphon

82.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mars 2020
Итак, сегодня мое приключение в этом мире закончилось. Финал на мой взгляд, несколько душераздирающий! )
Что же я могу вам рассказать об этой игре:
1) Яркая, сказочная графика. На открытых пространствах может быть и угловата, зато данжи весьма атмосферные!
2) Отсутствуют тонны текста и лора! УРА!! Читать килобайты и килобайты графоманских писулек "для атмосферы" задолбало! Тут я мог больше насладиться самой игрой.
3) Эпичный но не замысловатый сюжет! Самое то, чтобы было интересно, но и не перегружаться лишними деталями.
4) Пошаговая боёвка просто супер!!! Можно сказать эталонная для РПГ жанра! В некоторых локах, бои проходят как в шахматах, приходится выстраивать план действий наперёд! Настраивать билды умений, респекаться в гильдии, и возможно даже менять состав партии под особо эпичных вражин - придётся =)
5) З.У.Б.О.Д.Р.О.Б.И.Т.Е.Л.Ь.Н.Ы.Е. головоломки! И когда я говорю это, я реально имею ввиду - зубодробительные! Голова будет кипеть много и часто!!!! Сам я прошёл игру лишь раз подсмотрев в гайд, всего в одной части одного квеста + посмотрел как работают эльфийские алтари. Без шуток, из-за этого моя самооценка в итоге выросла на 200%!!!

П.С. У меня Windows 10, никаких вылетов, поломок сохранений... Технически всё шло как по маслу!
Хорошая, сказочная история которая заставит ваши мозги работать! Энжой! =)

Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2019
As an old school bards tale fan I played 1-3 back when they first came out on c64 and just recently finished the Krome remasters (all 3) and I feel that BTIV is an excellent addition to the series. It modernises it while keeping in the spirit of the originals.

The puzzles are good and aren't really that much different that the snares in BT2 but less frustrating.

The combat is probably the part that is most different than the originals but it a good attempt at modernising the original phased based combat. You don't fight huge hoards of enemies but I never particulary enjoyed casting MAMA *3 or NUKE *3 every single battle. I think the change is for the better in this instance. Melee characters are useful.

Thanks Inxile, great game.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
55.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 février 2021
Bard's tale 4 is a grid-based (sort of) turn-based dungeon crawler RPG.

PROS: Lots of gameplay (55 hours at the moment, with some quests and DLC unfinished).
Unique combat system with opportunity (total melee and skill actions per turn for a party, though it can be extended in many ways)
Lots of side quests, and while the main quest and opening of new areas is linear, there are several parts where you can do things in the order of your choice
Fair amount of lore, ~30 pages or so of books and notes to pick up (that I found, at least), dozens of NPCS that will tell you their life story, and dozens more ghosts you can bother for their life stories if inclined to do so.
Unique musical score*
Decent skill/build customization within individual classes
Many puzzles but also an ability (has to be enabled in gameplay options) to bypass most of them if they get tedious after a while. Which they do, at least for me, after the 4th or 5th round of fairy bird golf, 15th set of stones to push around in a certain order, and 30th cogwheel doorway.

NEUTRAL:
Hope you like the theme song, because the NPCs will sing it over and over.
Music files sometimes play in odd places...more than once I heard joyous chanting and Christmas caroling in and around a temple full of dead priests and undead.
Enemies do not respawn (though new encounters appear in certain areas as the story progresses), so there is a finite amount of xp/gold/loot to be gained. However, if you fully explore and do everything, it's far more than enough to complete most builds and get all the gold you need.
The overall storyline is average, not great, not horrible. The badd peopl are coming and only four arbitrarily selected people can stop them.
You'll probably have to look online to find where some things are or how to do certain quests. You'll definitely have to look online to find the item offerings for the zodiac codewheel, which explicitly requires the use of an online item codex and website to match the two pictures and the moon.

♥♥♥♥:
Only four classes, and the opportunity system further restricts available builds (can't be melee-heavy). Sub-classes alleviate this somewhat, though they are limited as well, both in number and by the four-skill combat limit (also a major gripe--each character can only ever have four skills (+1 from trinket and movement) loaded for use in combat at one time. It's more of an annoyance than a gameplay challenge. Only a couple bosses or enemy types really require a change in strategy to necessitate switching skills.

Turning off the music is insufficient to stop the singing in a lot of areas.

Relatively few enemy types--mainly Fatherite cultists or skeletons of various class/levels. Several unique boss encounters, though.

While there's an option to switch between grid-based movement and free movement, grid-based is much faster but difficult to control since it's not a simple flat square grid. Changing to grid-based gives an advantage in getting through some traps due to the speed. Standard movement is much slower, and also gets stuck somewhat easily on anything--there's no jumping, falling, or climbing over the smallest of obstacles without specifically a ladder or grappling hook node.

Inventory space is limited and bothersome to maneuver. It's not a problem in the beginning, where you don't get much loot, but for whatever reason, most higher level encounters drop 2-3 weapons or armor per fight, resulting in enough extra crap to fill not only your own inventory but deplete the gold from every merchant in the game.


Overall it's a good game and the pros outweigh the ♥♥♥♥. I got the Director's Cut on sale for $15, which was more than worth it's cost. I'm not sure how much it differs from the standard version, though. It does come with the Haernhold DLC.

*Hope you like yodeling
 
Sekai

Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2019
I bashed this game pretty hard when it first released. I was one of many very disappointed Kickstarter backers lured to the promise of a new Bard's Tale game. The first release was godawful.

But now, a year later, after a re-release and some patches, it's actually a fun game. Runs SO MUCH BETTER on a good machine than it did at launch, and I am not crashing at all anymore. I still don't think it's a proper sequel to the Bard's Tale series, and it really sorta ignores all the lore up to this point. But it is a really damn fun Blobber, and for that, I recommend it to fans of the genre.

oleg-provotorov

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
74.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
So many great things about this game, I'm not sure where to start. A fantastic mash up of grid-based, turn-based combat, puzzles and other RPG elements.

First of all, I am not a fan of turn-based combat and usually avoid games that have them. However, the grid-based format makes it much more interesting as there's a lot of strategy behind how you place the member's of your party and how you move them around during the course of battle. Enemies have the same freedom to utilize their spaces which creates a wide variety of unique combat situations.

This game includes a heavy dose of puzzles which is part of the reason why I love it. Everything from pushing blocks and moving cogs to solving riddles. This may not be for everyone but there is an in-game option to be able to skip puzzles if you get stuck or just want to focus on the combat/exploring. However, I feel that the puzzles are a key part of the experience.

InXile gives you a variety of ways to shape your team as it grows. You will have more members available than what you can take with you on your adventures, so you can decide which mix of classes to have in the party. You can also create new members or reset an existing member's skill trees. I found this to be an important strategy for honing each member of the group into a specific role.

The level design is amazing and sets up a lot of backtracking to re-explore areas again after getting stronger or gaining key items/abilities. The music and voice acting is unreal and important to the overall experience.

To address another review complaining about only having 4 opportunity points (actions) in combat despite your team growing to 6 members later in the game and feeling like you don't have enough opportunities to use all of them. You can gain additional points through passive bonuses found in a couple skill trees. There are also skills and items that can also reduce the opportunity cost of a skill or give you a chance to use a skill for free. Also, it is wise to have 2-3 members that primarily use spell points instead of opportunity points so your team is doing more each turn.
 
kneekap
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
108.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2023
Short version: If I had a time machine, I would use it to go back in time, and replay this game for the first time again.

Long version: this game (and developer InXile) received a lot of criticism, some of it even warranted. You can find fault in the crowdfunding and promised features, some game balance questions or bugs, and how it doesn't look exactly like the original trilogy looked back in the 80s.

But on the other hand the game captures the essence of what the original Bard's Tale was about. The world feels authentic. The mythology builds on the unique blend of gaelic foundation with a strong nordic influence, and snippets of other cultures, to make it feel a fantasy equivalent of medieval Scotland. The gameplay is much more complex than the original games, despite what looks like simplifications in the number of archetypes for example, the variety in the available builds is staggering, and the unique way the combat system uses Opportunity to give the party a certain number of actions without specifying how many each character must use opens up a lot of dynamic options to handle different situations differently. And last but not least the music is simply amazing, there are a lot of original pieces performed by Scottish musicians, and half of the soundtrack is in scots gaelic while the other half is in english.

The combat is very tactical almost like a puzzle, and it can get hard unless the party performs optimally. There are also a handful of exploits/bugs that can help in the hardest fights if someone prefers to use them.
 
Kira
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
168.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2023
I appreciated how they worked elements from the first three games into this one, and the addition of the crafting mechanic. The ability trees seem nicer than the original versions as well since they let you tailor the development of your characters to your play style. At the default skill level the Director's Cut seems a little overpowered, but I didn't try the two higher skill levels in my two play-throughs. I played through the original Bard's Tale back in the day and also the remastered version of the first game twice (separated by a few years), but never made it through the 2nd game. Never opened part 3 of the trilogy. I appreciated this version a lot.
