Recommandé
166.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2023
The Bard's Tale IV is a masterpiece. I love the game so much because of the following:

-The game's world is very beautiful. For example, when you walk into the forest of Inshriach, it feels like walking into a painting.

-The story is compelling. I feel like reading a good story book and wonder what happens next.

-The fighting system is very satisfying. You can control a party of 6 heroes with different talents and backgrounds.

-The music is wonderful. I'm so happy to discover many beautiful songs.

-The game runs smoothly from the beginning to end. There is no technical issue even for an old computer.

Thank you developers for such an amazing game. I hope there are more games like this or expansions in the future.

P/S: It would be great if we can have more avatars to choose from when creating a character. Thank you.

Recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2019
First of all I have not played original trilogy nor BT4 (not DC). I have not followed Kickstarter company too. There were no false expectations on my side.
I wanted to play it since a like games like Grimrock 2, M&M X, Operencia etc, but review score is pretty low so I got GOG version and eventually beat it. I bought the game to support developers.

Pros:
1. World is huge and diverse.
2. Puzzles. They are everywhere.
3. Music.
4. Compat is pretty fun with humorous animations.

♥♥♥♥:
1. It seems lighting was downgraded to improve perfomance.
2. UI is kind of clunky.
3. If a weapon has skill attached and it wielded that skill occupy one mastery slot.
4. Bunch of minor bugs (like party members stuck in places during combat). Workarounds exist.

I paid regional price and think the game is worth it's money.

----------------

Прежде всего я не знаком с оригинальной трилогией и с ванильной BT4. За Кикстартером и рекламной кампанией не следил, поэтому никаких особых ожиданий у меня не было.
Хотел купить, потому что нравится игры типа Grimrock 2, M&M X, Operencia, но ревью у игры так себе, поэтому достал "пробник" и, в итоге, прошел его. В Стиме игру купил, чтобы поддержать разрабов.

Достоинства:
1. Мир большой и разнообразный
2. Пазлы за каждым углом.
3. Музыка
4. Бои довольно неплохи с забавными анимациями у врагов.

Недостатки:
1. Похоже, упростили освещение, чтобы улучшить производительность.
2. UI довольно неудобный.
3. Если у оружия есть своё умение и вы его (оружие) одели, то умение обязательно займет одну из ячеек действий.
4. Куча некритичных багов. Например, партийцы застревают на одном месте во время боя. У всех багов обычно есть обходы, но они временами раздражают.

Считаю, что игра стоит региональной цены.

MadMind2
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
43.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2019
Produit reçu gratuitement

ВАЖНО: Пишу исключительно для тех, кто уже успел поиграть в "стандартную" версию. И, предупреждаю сразу, это не про геймплей (он меня изначально вполне устраивал)
Главной проблемой, на мой (и не только мой) взгляд в "стандартной" версии были ЧУДОВИЩНЫЕ тормоза всегда и по любому поводу (при том, что компьютер у меня вполне мощный и видеокарта GTX 980). Ну, что сказать... Работа над ошибками проделана знатно. На ультра настройках у меня тормоза бывают только при загрузке сохранения (и то это выражается в том, что ждешь две-три секунды подгрузки текстур окружающего мира) и в сражениях при переходе хода от врага к моему отряду (редко и не смертельно).
Из того, что, к сожалению осталось или добавилось (с учетом того, что в "стандартную версию" я долго играть не смог из-за тормозов):
1) Иногда кто-то из персонажей в начале сражения и до его конца "отрубается" - не можешь не переключиться на него не поменять другого персонажа с ним местами. Решается только выходом в меню и загрузкой сохранения, что может быть критично при отсутствии опции свободного сохранения.
2) Отвратительное меню инвентаря никуда не делось. Хочешь освободить место на первой "странице" инвентаря - перетаскивай оттуда "вручную" на другие, более свободные страницы. И делать это придется не один раз, поскольку если первая "страница" полностью заполнена, то скрафтить уже ничего не сможешь - игра, видите ли, может помещать новую вещь только на первую "страницу"...
Но, в целом, если хотели пройти эту игру раньше, но не могли из-за изначальных глобальных проблем - теперь играть, по меньшей мере, реально (и даже, в основном, приятно).
 
layon
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
50.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2019
If you were a fan of the original Bard's Tale series, play this game right now! Trust me, you won't regret it. If you've never heard of the original Bard's Tale games, also play it right now lol. Everything about it is 'spot on' and it is obvious Bryan Fargo and all of the other devs put a ton of time and love into re-imagining the legendary BT series of yore. This is what an Ultima series reboot should have been. Seriously, the combat is very challenging on the hard difficulty levels, but never impossible if you think out your moves. Sometimes the RNG gods have to be smiling on you in some fights, but that's the nature of these kinds of games. The setting (ancient Scotland with magic and goblins or something) is great, very medieval-ey without being too generic, cliche and overdone. Voice acting for the most part is clever, and the accents are very well done, not cheesy at all. Except when they are trying to be cheesy on purpose, the game is charming like that. Also the music! Good Lord, the Welsh/Celtic soundtrack is absolutely enchanting and very immersive too, more so once you fight your way out of the first dungeon into the countryside (and very fitting for a game focused on bards and their music). As someone who played (and won :) all 4 of the original BT games back in the day, I backed this on Kickstarter hoping it wouldn't be a disappointment like lots of other classic game 'reboots' are. So far it has exceeded my expectations in every way! Very hard to stop playing. BT IV will definitely scratch that RPG itch. I hope InXile keeps cranking out more badass games like this, it is a real gem.
 
Ben Dover

Recommandé
61.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2020
I thoroughly enjoyed Bard's tale 4. Fun combat, multiple classes and ways to build a party just for you and plenty of explorable zones and multiple optional dungeons and quests. And that soundtrack? oooh it's full of bangers!

Not a perfect game by all means it had its issues. Sometimes the targeting in combat could be a bit wonky and sometimes if you try to cast too many abilities in a row the game would take a little while to think things through.

But all in all if you enjoy turn-based combat, exploration and some damn fine music, I would recommend the game. Good stuff.

Évaluation publiée le 18 janvier 2021
One of my favorite games ever. The Bard's Tale IV is an old school puzzle/dungeon crawler. The puzzles are varied and fun. They are challenging without being frustrating (generally). The turn-based RPG combat is dynamic and very enjoyable. Easy recommendation.

I must say there are some serious bugs in this game I had to reload old saves several times just because I got stuck in a table or wall.

That is "Director's cut"? Bugs are everywhere after a year of release. Can't say on graphics downgrade, maybe the characters are. But the thing is that some textures are simply missing. Problem of the second top square in party is still where (when you can't move your character to this square).

Non recommandé
20.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2020
I really like BT4. The problem I have with the game is it cannot seem to decide if it wants to be a turn-based RPG or a Mist-level puzzle game.

There are waaaayyyy too many puzzles IMO, and the fights, while exciting at times, grow lackluster the more you play.

The limit of 4 characters early on , I think, is a mistake; there are more than 4 classes and YES you can swap them out at the "guild hall" but why not let players try out all the classes in a party??

And the armor....OMG the armor....is retard-ed. The armor "types" are broken down into so many sub-groups as to be mind-boggling....not to mention a drain on spending points. The armor types needs to be consolidated with Plus / Minus features ( ie...heavy armor you attack less etc etc.

I hate to give this otherwise fine game ( the music and voice acting are top notch) a down vote but yeah.....sorry.


Rivscore - 76 / 100

Non recommandé
22.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2022
So I actually reviewed this already and my review just vanished. I'm not going into the depth that I did with the original review, but I'll give a basic summary. I don't like this game. Even with the so-called Director's Cut, I've encountered bugs of all types from minor audio cut outs and volume inconsistencies, to hard crashes. The combat system is poorly designed, poorly implemented, clunky, and places limitations on the players party that it doesn't put on the enemies. For example, you can't move everyone in your party on each turn, the enemy very much can. The story is gibberish. Big evil guy being evil is joined by some other evil guys because evil's gonna evil. The world has no personality, it's just a mash up of word jumble names of places and people you won't remember five minutes later and that have nothing unique to contribute. The original series didn't do much in the way of story either and although slightly prettier, this continues the tradition. Generally I take pride in finishing a game before reviewing it. I don't have to 100% the game, but I want the complete experience from beginning to end at least once. I'm 22 hours into this game and I'm just done. The main reason is I'm not enjoying any aspect of it and I play games to experience new things, to be entertained, to be surprised, and all the other reasons we all enjoy gaming and this checks none of those boxes. I'm glad fans of the series got this for a little trip down nostalgia lane, but I also think this is a franchise best left in the past. I can't recommend this at any price.

karabuyu
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
197.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2020
Classic dungeon crawler in new design, with modern game solutions.
1/ Original and demanding fighting system with lots of combo-mechanics. Game can be very easy or extremely difficult, depends on party configuration.
2/ Lots of puzzles - yes this is that kind of game, what else you have expected? Puzzles are more and more difficult during game. So if you like puzzles you shouldn't be disappointed
3/ Storyline is as it is should be in crawler - quite simple heroic fantasy tale.
4/ Some side quests enough for good playing
5/ Nice graphic with spirit of good old crawlers
6/ Marvelous folk music over 100 pieces, written and sang by professional folk music writers, singers, and musicians. Ver, very strong point of the game.

IMHO very immersive game for many hours of play.
Game starts slowly introducing player into game mechanics and story, so don't be discouraged – after several hours game shows off.
 
abork75
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
66.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2020
Tytuł niełatwy do oceny. Spokojnie można wystawić zarówno negatywną jak i pozytywną ocenę i będzie to całkiem łatwo uzasadnić podając mnóstwo powodów. Nie jest to gra perfekcyjnie dopracowana, bugów i niedoróbek trochę się w niej znajdzie, czasami irytuje i męczy. Ale pomimo tego jest całkiem wciągająca i posiada sporo fajnych rozwiązań.
Wydaje mi się jednak że fanom klasycznych dungeon crawlerów gra powinna przypaść do gustu - ostrzegam jednak że momentami zęby zgrzytają.

Plusy:
- dobry system walki turowej ograniczający losowość
- muzyka
- wiele zróżnicowanych lokacji do zwiedzenia
- różne sekrety do odkrycia
- różne pomysłowe drobiazgi np. bronie z mocami do odblokowania albo elementy metroidvanii (choć to dziwnie brzmi)
- zagadki logiczne...

Minusy:
- ...których momentami jest zbyt dużo i stają się zwyczajnie męczące (na szczęście można je pominąć)
- raczej średnia fabuła
- kiepska, mało czytelna mapa ze źle działającym wskaźnikiem questów
- same questy też czasami są niezbyt jasne
- liczne bugi

Ogółem: warto zagrać ale trzeba mieć świadomość ograniczeń i wad. Przede wszystkim - to nie jest Skyrim, nie mamy pełnej swobody ruchu.
Na pewno nie polecam w pełnej steamowej cenie, ale w promocji warto się skusić. Całkiem dobra zabawa na jakieś 50 godzin

25.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 septembre 2019
Great game, just right up in my alley. It's mixing good old gameplay with new technology and quality of life functions, which are necessary in 2019 (you can turn many of them off, so can party like it's 1988). The soundtrack is beyond words and the whole thing is full of great production value.

I wanted to like the grid movement, but the free move is better IMO.

I don't care about the price, there are so many lesser games with higher price in this store.



It's a well done release, like it more than Wasteland 2 DC. Trying to play it through!
 
Chubbs
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
23.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2020
The Bards Tale 4 is a throwback to old dos game, where drawing your own maps were necessary, and the smallest detail missed could lead to hours of wasted time.

Luckily, this is not the case with this game! If you want it like that though, there's an option to enable or disable hints, perks, and many other things. Depending on how you want to play the game, the options that are presented at the beginning are numerous. You can make this a casual game, or a hardcore punishing brick wall that you can only bash your head against. But hey, to each their own.

I went the normal route, or how the game described it, "The way it's supposed to be played." While I have not yet beaten it, I have played for a large enough amount of time that I can describe the mechanics and how it feels.

The game is turn based, and each turn you move, attack, buff, etc. You can spend all your action points on one character in your group, or divert them accordingly. At the beginning of the game, it's fairly trivial. Later however, battles can be very fulfilling. Setting up combos, using skills and abilities to coincide with others to get the max benefit out of them is very rewarding. There are no random encounters, you can easily tell where an enemy is on the map as you walk around. However, enemies don't seem to respawn. So no grinding. Thankfully, enemies are paced accordingly and I never felt like I was put in an impossible position.

Puzzles can get a bit cryptic, but nothing that critical thinking can't handle. Occasionally I would have to look up something. (Apparently a farmers morning is represented by the color black. Because you know, the morning isn't the color orange of the rising sun. Duh!) and riddles that don't really make sense by themselves without some sort of context. I probably missed a clue somewhere. But nothing that made me overly frustrated.

The only downside to this game is that the customization for characters is very limited, in how they look and how you can build them. There are only 4 classes, and the skills don't diversify very much. I found myself trying to build different types of rouges, but they all ended up only working efficiently if I made them damage dealers.

Overall, this is a Kickstarter game that got tons of love, and those who helped fund it got their moneys worth.

I got to take some tylenol because Robbie or whatever his name keeps singing the same damn song over and over. Feels like ice in my head.
 
TheeSpongeman
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.6 h en tout

"Snow in the summer, Ice in my Hat... Skara Brae, became a winter night... Brought death from Far Away"

Combat is very cool. Graphics very pretty. Conversations and NPC interesting so far. A new true bards tale reminiscent of Golden Age of Gaming !

Recommandé
79.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2019
Pleasantly surprised
Was on the fence for this one but the sale caught me in a good mood. Combat and character skill trees aren't great but they aren't dealbreakers. Meanwhile the party management/dynamics, loot distribution/focus and the overall dungeon crawl experience are downright excellent. Exploration, visuals and story are also very good for the sub genre. Puzzles are nice and breezy too. They change the pace without dragging you down. Playing on hard difficulty and its a perfectly balanced challenge.

Just finished Killearan's Tower but so far gotta say this is a well above average crawler that keeps surprising me at every turn.

E
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
121.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2020
A brilliant, modern, high-production-value RPG that will please fans of modern games as well as those who played the original Bard's Tale series. Like most Brian Fargo games, it comes with a healthy dose of irreverent humor. But you also get everything you'd expect from a Bard's Tale: an epic plot to destroy the world, legendary weapons to find and wield, side quests, inside jokes for fans of previous games, plus all the joys of leveling up your characters and discovering new powers. On top of that, you can add an interesting but not overly-complicated tactical combat system that's easy to pick up and makes it fun to discover new combos and play styles.

If I have any complaints about this game, it's that there's too damn much material. I clocked over 90 hours of playtime, although I am something of a completist. It's also true that if you are willing to take on the Haernhold (the bonus dungeon only available in the Director's Cut), the weapons and armor upgrades you get there make the rest of the game rather easy. Of course, by the time you're capable of beating the Haernhold, you also feel like the game owes you one.
 
Frater Risus
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
22.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2022
Really fantastic game. I was actually a backer for this game and it's clear they've put passion into this game. It has a great celtic atmosphere with the level design, the music, character design, the monster design and overall mythology, and the story is pretty good. The gameplay is also actually really good, the puzzles are eh.

I can't write a full review for this game, however because I hit a bugged puzzle(Magnar tower bell puzzle, so get ready to save like crazy) and I will die on the hill that the second a bug that requires me load and lose a ton of progress is just not something that should be tolerated and especially one that completely blocks progress in the game and isn't something that should be tolerated. There's several other bugs alongside this one, too.

I was super excited to finally play this game but honestly, the bugs really bring it down. There's also a lot of lag(no, my computer isn't the issue, it's the game) and jank, but that's really just a cherry on the top.

johellin
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
80.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2020
I really want to love BT4:DC more. It certainly pings my nostalgia meter at times. However, each time I draw near the end, I find myself frustrated, tired, and really ready for it to be over.

Here are my pain points:

  1. It's not an open or diverse world. I would love to explore more of it, but there's few places to go and do miscellaneous encounters or discover. On a side note, on the map, you can't see the name of the place you're currently at which is weird.

  2. There are a fixed number of baddies to kill. One game strategy that's missing is to overpower your foes with your levels/skills which is rather impossible do with the limited number of encounters. You can't farm experience which was one of the hallmarks of previous games. No likes a forced grind but I find the lack of this option unfortunate.

  3. Inventory management is a hassle. Diablo inventory was fun in 1997 it's just a pain now. I hoarded items, eventually sell them and then regret it when I needed them for some encounters.

  4. Tribute rewards are misaligned with your progress. By the time I could use some of these I have little use for the rewards.

  5. Crafting is downplayed. I've only used it for drinks, food, and lock picks. The other stuff was trivial at best.

  6. You cannot beat some encounters without specific gear, characters, or build. Don't throw away or sell that gear too soon you might (unwittingly) need it to beat some boss encounters. This might be less an issue if you could grind some experience/levels.

  7. Difficulty modes are near impossible. I started on Hard, switched to Normal and ended up on Easy which is still proving a challenge especially on the DLC and end game.

  8. Starting the End Game locks access to previous areas. Be warned, if you start the "Maiden's Borrow" end-game quest, you'll lose access to other parts of the game. I missed out on a few places because I didn't do them prior to starting and with the limited amount of experience and encounters available, this hurts.

  9. No replay value. Each time I think about starting over, I stop because of the number of things (puzzles mostly) I'd have to redo and the random pain of some of them keep me from restarting.
 
TheBrackRotus
132 produits enregistrés

Shamsham
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
67.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 avril 2020
Плюсы:
- интересная, концептуальная боёвка;
- проскакивает неплохой юмор;
- "бардовский антураж" - отовсюду льются песни и т.п.
- любопытная РПГ состовляющая (классы/скиллы/"профы")
- логические головоломки, разбавляющие боёвку
- довольно интересные интерьерные решения в некоторых локациях, да и в целом визуальная стиллистика приятная (кроме всратых моделей всех персонажей)

Минусы:
- бесит переизбыток головоломок в некоторых кусках игры (которые часто ещё и похожи между собой - эльфийский гольф ОСОБЕННО!!!)
- очень... ООООЧЕНЬ затянутая компания. Так вышло, что игра взяла меня в заложники и я всё ждал "когда уже всёёё?!?!?!" а оно, это "ВСЁ" всё никак не наступало и не наступало... =(
- случаются баги с наложением эффектов и применением скиллов в бою, но не критично
- в игре много доп. квестов и загадок, но ооочень скупое их информационное сопровождение. Без гугла вам точно и половину осилить не удастся.
 
illilus
99 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
52.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2022
I played this game after a few years it came out, so i would fully expected it to be fixed after so much time. Nope, while it was stable and never frozed or crashed there were still plenty of bugs.
What drove it for me, it was the sound, great voice overs and awesome gaelic music.
What ruined it is the sheer amount of puzzles, i do not mind a few puzzles to solve but damn, this game just has way too many at which point you solve one and afterwards you might encounter a battle or just run into the next puzzle.
And regarding battles, who the hell designed the skeleton fights, you gotta bring them all down in one round or else they revive...that aint easy if you have target characters left alive and low on items to revive or deal aoe damage, couldn't they just place a certain number of times they can revive!
Fights otherwise are fairly enjoyable to deal with, just some are buggy or annoying.

Overall i recommend this game for the puzzle masochists out there due to how many there are.
I am not too familiar with the Bard's Tale series but as an RPG this is a decent one, but by this point i would have expected a fixed game and changes after users feedback, but too many puzzles and some annoying fights just do not make it that enjoyable.
 
CupcakeFury
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
146.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2021
I unfortunately missed this on initial release, but what a gem it is.

I played the original Bards Tale & this version clearly is a homage to them but definitely an improvement. The sound & visuals are very good & the combat system is a lot of fun and very strategic, it's also very intuitive to use, as is the very polished UI
The voice acting and music is extremely well done especially as the music is important to the game.
The story and side quests are interesting & fun to explore, not too taxing & keep the flow of the game going nicely.

The puzzle weapons are interesting to figure out, where you have to examine the weapon to visually figure out how to unlock it's true potential

The game does suffer some occasional performance issues, it's more a small annoyance than a game breaker as it's not a twitch shooter, the combat is turn based only & there is sometimes a delay when the AI is working out it's turn in combat. (I'm using an Intel i7 6700K with a Nvidia GTX 1070 & 16 GB of Ram for reference)

Overall, the games humour & music really bring the story to life & make for an enjoyable experience to this modernised retro style RPG.

 
spodge

Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
I find it amazing, that a year after I purchase it, or rather, kickstarted it, they release directors edtion with "thousands of bug fixes", and the game barely works right now.

There are so many bugs, and errors, and missing stuff (3d models?!?) that I cant for the life of me understand what they have spent their time on. It certainly does not seem to be this game.

Its a shame, because the franchise deserves vastly better than this.

I hope they can do a turn around, but for me, unless I hear something has vastly improved, I am done waiting on this becoming the game we wanted through kickstarter.

Artharth
1,253 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2022
Spielhalde der Schande Edition
Dies ist ein neutrales Review !

Schon irgendwie Schade, BT4 ist ein solides, rundenbasierendes RPG. Fordernde Kämpfe, knackige Rätsel, solide erzählte Geschichte... ABBA (rip) der Spieler kann das Spiel vollkommen verpeilen. Was einen Neustart erfordert. Und alles was es brauchte, war ein Hauptquest zu überspringen, eine falsche Entscheidung zu treffen (Multiple Choice Dialog) und sich damit in eine ausweglose Situation zu bringen. Sprich die Gegner sind zu stark und es gibt keine Möglichkeit sich aus der Lage zu befreien,

Toll 8 Stunden Spielzeit lösen sich in Luft auf, Danke des automatischen Save Systems, das händische Spielstände überschreibt. Gerade entdeckt, das Spielstände gegen überschreiben gesichert werden können.
Spiel Design aus der untersten Consolen Schublade.

Fazit:
Solides Dungen Crawler RPG! mit einer bislang guten Geschichte.
Ein paar Bugs (durch neuladen zu beheben) und die Möglichkeit in einer Sackgasse zu landen, aus der es kein Entrinnen gibt, sowie das überschreiben eigner Spielstände durch Bard's Tale 4 schmälern den Spielspass.

Da die rundenbasierenden Kämpfe zum Teil richtig schwer sind.
Mein ADHS beim Gedanken an 8 Stunden Wiederholungen, sich windet.
Überlasse ich meine Heldenparty an dieser Stelle Ihrem Schicksal...

Zurück auf die Spielhalde der Schande mit Dir!
Tip für neue Spieler:
Nach jeder abgeschlossenen Questreihe und vor dem annehmen der Folgequest. sowie vor wichtigen Spielentscheidungen, Manual SPEICHERN in den "Lade das Spiel" Dialog gehen und den Speicherstand vor löschen im Spielinterface sichern.
 
Giri 義理 (GER)
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
66.6 h en tout

Super produkcja , polecam każdemu kto lubi ten gatunek , grubo ponad 45 godzin zabawy

Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2019
ugh this pains me to write this - ill make it brief. I had the non-DC and was enjoying it until I found out that you couldnt transfer any of your saves to the DC (very annoying) so basically had to start over. So is the DC any good?

1. I couldnt really tell any significant graphic updates
2. some puzzles are made easier

So why the thumbs down
1. encountered 4 fatal errors so far
2. pacing is just frusterating even w/ some of the song cheats
3. too much going back and forth (no fast travel)
4. puzzles are just annoying especially all the fairy ones
5. my bard is now basically not needed in the party - the tree lines are pretty lame -
go in with a fighter, 2 wizards, rogue and you're basically set if you set up your abilities spells right
6. feel like things are getting repetitive
7. i will say the game is pretty, songs are lovely, and you feel you're in a different world which is nice
going to take a break from playing but overall I give this a thumbs down - it just needs a bit more polish in pacing, layouts of the outside/inside worlds, removing more lame puzzles (I like puzzles but some of these are just more of a nuisance than enjoyable)
'

The Good:
+ Beautiful bard music
The BAD: This game is buggy AF!
- Buggy terrain hit box just got me stuck so many times!
- Buggy AI mobs: The combat system is turn-based, every time the AI mobs took turn, It take forever to make actions.
- Laggy combat and delay even though this is an offline game.
- Visualize bug when skeleton AI resurrect, it become completely invisible.
- Buggy interaction with lever, "push-pull" indicator doesn't work as intended.
- Too many puzzle in-game that will make the game much longer than it should be.
- Puzzle reward chest is completely trash and useless.
- Stores do not refresh, so you can only buy and sell stuffs for limited amount.

CANNOT RECOMMEND DUE TO BAD GAME PLAY EXPERIENCE

80.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2019
Very good first person turn based rpg despite some questionable decisions (quest markers in Bard's Tale? song to bypass puzzles really?) and some bugs that should have been squashed long ago (none of the really bad ones remain thankfully, and I've had no crashes so far).

Combat is deeper than it looks at first, exploration more detailed than you may expect. Playing without quest markers in hard or above is a more fun neo-classic rpg experience than Might & Magic X, and that was pretty good already.

69.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2019
A very good RPG. The story is quite enjoyable, the NPCs are distinguishable. The fight mechanics are nicely done. The graphics are also nice on ultra settings and a 2k resolution, which I played at. There are, though, too many puzzles for my taste (some of them are tedious and frustrating, sometimes overcomplicated and too unclear). The game is pretty long. It took me 69 hours to finish it, Haernhold dungeon included. Overall, I strongly recommend this game.

0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
189.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2020
I've won this game through Steamgifts website.
Finally a solid turn(hex)-based RPG. The game can also be played within real-time, but it is nice to have the option. After Legend of Grimrock I've lost hope I'll see any title that could have at least some climate like Ultima Underworld, Realms of Arkania or old Might&Magic series. Fortunately this game has it. The content is quite large , with nice story and melodies, interesting combat and quite large spectrum of skills. The graphic is somewhat disputing. On one had the world itself is wonderful, as well as cut-scenes, on the other the models are quite clunky, especially the females. It looked like the creator hasn't met any beautiful human in his life. I'm also having some problems with the lore. Sure every game can think for itself, but this purple hairless thing is a dwarf? And this ugly, greenskin is an elf?
Also be warned that although any true RPG usually has some puzzles, here that becomes extreme. Almost everything here is a puzzle, even combat in some way. Fortunately there is a melody that resolves most of those.
Well it is nice to have the Linux port, but either the port or game itself suffers from problems. The player can get stuck sometimes, some cut-scenes glitch, some quests can not trigger events, and so on. Fortunately that can usually be resolved by coming back to previous save slot.
Anyway the game is unique and worth playing.
 
ebbpp

Évaluation publiée le 28 octobre 2020
Bards Tale 4 is something special. 20 hours in, zero crashes, zero bugs and tons of fun. Interesting puzzles, solid combat system, great voice acting, varied and interesting locations, loads of loot, puzzle weapons, unique items. The list goes on. The writing in this game is fantastically quirky and there is some down right hilarious banter between the companions.

If you're a fan of turn based RPG's with an old school approach to design I think Bards Tale 4 is worth your time and money, it's been a while since I've had this much fun in a video game.

Recommandé
116.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 octobre 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

I've been a gamer for nearly 40 years, and I just have to say that it's about time that a game developer had the courage to use "racism bad" as the central theme of a game. Kudos to you, inXile Entertainment, for stepping out on that ledge and saying what hasn't been said by every single other bit of media in the western world for the past 30 years. Your company is aptly named. You are true renegades.

And really, who picks up a fantasy RPG to become immersed in a compelling world and story? What gamers are looking for are true-to-life lessons and lectures out of California, and direct references to real world events that have all the subtlety of a brick to the face. A 21st century game doesn't need to be good. It just needs to be politically important.

It's only a shame that I didn't pay for this game. I would so love to have helped support inXile Entertainment's bravery in delivering the good word, because this game changed me. I was so full of hate before playing, but now I cannot wait to vote the way I have learned to vote from this masterpiece.

0
Recommandé
58.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mai 2020
I love these types of games. This one keeps me entertained very well. The difficulty is... serviceable. I guess its as hard as you can get for being a turn based game with optional perma death. It also has far too few of classes. You only have 4 classes with the option of getting a limited amount of uses of a single sub class. The subclass is the same no matter what main class you apply it to.

That being said. The game has a pretty interesting story. Lots of exploration and beautiful views. while combat does not have much variety and depth in options, it keeps you entertained by being so approachable and fast. It is worth the full price tag in my opinion.

212 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
70.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 avril 2021
TL;DR: if you like dungeon crawlers, get it now, because it delivers.

Yes, the game was, is and probably still will be a buggy mess. But if you overlook some of it's shortcomings, you will enjoy it greatly. I nearly finished the original BT4 before the more polished and optimised DC came out and I replayed the game till the ending while having great deal of fun. The game has charming atmosphere and very enjoyable combat.

The combat starts somewhat bland but will only get better with new characters, skills, equipment and enemies. There is more than one way how to build your party members and exploit some of their abilities to create powerful combos.

Story was a bit on the weak side, but I never got to play the trilogy before...my loss.

Finally, puzzles. Let's just say that none of them made me ragequit the game and most of them were enjoyable enough, albeit unnecessary difficult. I had to look up for a solution for one or two near the endgame, but other than that, I usually got through them with trial and error.

Compared to other modern titles like Vaporum, Operencia, StarCrawlers, LoGII, M&MX, this game is on par, maybe slightly better value. Go get it.

76.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2022
Amazing RPG with awesome, complex tactical combat! Beautiful visual style, beautiful music and songs. Beautiful environments. Few character classes to choose from but they can be developed in various ways (although towards the end you'll have enough skill point to unlock much more than enough skills for your build). Lots of unique items that can have significant effect on your battle tactics. Various enemies with various skills which will force you to change up your tactics from time to time. Lots of puzzles, which you can skip if you want. Decent customization options for game difficulty.

A delightful sequel/re-imagining of the Bard's Tale games from the 80s. Combines a compelling story, strategic combat, and a fun character advancement system. Sometimes the puzzles could become tedious, but that was fixed with the "Struggler's Lament" song. My only complaint is that is I want more!!!

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
62.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 septembre 2019
The combat is fantastic. The puzzles are well paced. The environments get a lot more interesting and visually pleasing once you leave the starting city (which is pretty unattractive, IMO). I've experienced very few bugs or technical errors.

I honestly don't get why the reviews for this game are mixed. As best I can tell, many of the negative reviews just think it doesn't feel like a "Bard's Tale" game or they've experienced technical errors/bugs that I haven't encountered.

If you enjoy tactical combat and exploration in the style of Legend of Grimrock 2 (albeit more linear overall), this game is very easy to recommend.
 
artofwar
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
31.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2019
I'm glad I gave this another try.

I couldn't get past the first five minutes due to performance issues when I tried it a year ago, but this time I found it much less problematic and ended up having fun. The graphics still look a bit like they're from the 90's at times, but Ievelling is satisfying, skill paths are interesting and I like the puzzles. Combat is okay, but you end up repeating the same strategy of just a few key skills in fight after fight once you find something that works - there's not much need for variety (on normal).

If you go into it with reasonably low graphical expectations and few comparisons with the originals, you'll have a good time. I've encountered several bugs, but none game-breaking, and I believe the devs are trying hard to fix them.
 
t_spacemonkeys

69.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 janvier 2022
I just completed this wonderful Game. It's is very rare for me to review any game on Steam, but Bard's Tale IV is so satisfying that I had to sing it's praise so that more people will know how lovely this game is and give it a try.

Gameplay 8/10 - This game is essentially a Puzzle Game. The Combat / Story / Dungeons are challenging enough to keep you hooked.

Story 7/10 - Nothing out of the ordinary with the story plot. Typical Heroic Adventures and you will encounter Standard NPC Characters you expect from a Fantasy Game. Carrots. Cabbages. Potatoes.

World Design 9/10 - I love the beautiful world magically crafted to have you feel so immersed in the game. The maze and dungeon can get confusing at times and alot of back tracking is required, but it's like taking a stroll in your favorite garden in a brezzy morning.

Music 10/10 - The songs and music in this game is sublime. It goes so well in each stage of the game that you will hum along with them.

I bought it during the Steam Sale, but it's worth the full price in my 70 hours of game play. I will probably play through it a second time to go for all the side quest I missed.
 
Yumeno

Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2020
I really wish i could recommend this game but i just cannot do it. The game has a lot of charm , interesting strategic battles and decent graphics. However the main problem starts after the first few hours of gameplay when the game starts bombarding you with an endless number of repeating , boring and tedious puzzles which would be fun in limited numbers but certainly not in the numbers found in the game. Of course i could probably solve them if i devoted time to it but i feel my time is too valuable to waste on childish puzzles like these and playing the game with the walkthrough open in the background just doesn't appeal to me.

1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2023
This is based on no prior experience with the prequels. My point of reference is Legends of Grimrock.

++ I liked the puzzles
++ and the weird slightly rough charm of the game.
++ there's beautiful music playing all over.
++ the setting is captured very well, it's a bleak, wet, isolated coastal city.
++ I'm also a fan of the devs.

The combat is ok, but it just doesn't work well on the 2x4 grid.
A 3x3 would have been better, or even a 2x3. It just doesn't make sense why do it this way, it's not an RTS where people line up to find a foe. Maybe it's me but it doesn't feel right at all, nor does it work well.

-- Before they re-released it it was a buggy mess, now most bugs are fixed but I still find myself getting stuck and having to reload.
-- the graphics are terrible.
-- Someone thought it was fun to have the player run around back and forth across everything as you find items that can now open things in the starting areas. I don't have a problem with that, but you better have a rich and detailed world, instead there's limited assets and every zone looks very mundane - like a randomly generated dungeon.
-- the NPCs are lifeless.
-- they had a very small budget for what they wanted to make, the result is a game that feels empty, static and monotonous.

It's a shame really, I almost feel bad for leaving a negative review but I cannot in all conscience recommend this at full price. It's a maybe on sale.
 
Multihack

Recommandé
157.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2022
Back in the 1980s I was introduced to a Wizardry style dungeon crawler called Tales of the Unknown: The Bard's Tale. Playing on my Apple IIe I completed the game. I immediately got my hands on Bard's Tale II: The Thief of Fate, but I never completed it back then. I did however play both Bard's Tale I and II on my Apple IIgs revelling in the enhanced graphics and sound. Disappointingly I had to play Bard's Tale III using Apple IIe graphics as Electronic Arts never released a IIgs version. I got all the way to the end of the game, but could not defeat the final boss and finally just got tired of being soundly defeated in every attempt.

Over the years I saw other Bard's Tale type games come and go, but none captured my imagination like the original. I played the updated version of The Bard's Tale and although I appreciated the humor and enjoyed the game overall, it was not really the same game I had played decades earlier.

I had heard rumors of a Bard's Tale IV being worked on, but quite frankly never thought it would come to light. Then it became a reality, but due to circumstances I was not in a place where I wanted to play it at its release.

Then I retired in 2020 and decided to reexamine the game. To my delight it came packaged with the original trilogy which had been redone in graphics and sound and gameplay that blew my old IIgs games out of the water. So rather than work on Bard's Tale IV I decided to relive the first three games in all their glory. It took me several months, but I finally finished all three games. I had the time of my computer gaming life doing so.

So finally I am in the midst of working my way through Bard's Tale IV and I love it. The battle sequence took a bit of getting used to, but I am now able to defeat most of my opponents using various strategies and now appreciate the intricacies of the maneuvers. The sounds and music is incredible. The voice acting is pretty decent and the graphics are impressive. Not a bit fan of the wealth of puzzles you must overcome, but if I get too frustrated I can hit up a walkthrough for a hint of two and be on my way. In short, although I was hoping for a more true to form of the old Bard's Tales, I get that we have moved way beyond that sort of gameplay, so I am incredibly pleased with the game I am playing. Thanks to all the hard work that made this game possible.
 
smccartt

Recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 aout 2021
State
Giving this game a second chance after my initial negative review
Graphics
Decent-ish. Ambient and scenery looks fine. Models are ok-ish, I don't like the weird aspect of the non-human races. They look nothing like common lore:
  • Dwarves have same height as humans, have no hair and their face looks like Thanos's
  • Elves have same physique as humans
  • Trow are...gnomes? Goblins? I don't know, they look ugly and suck

The bob of head and motion blur effects make me nauseated after playing for a short while. So, beware of motion sickness. It is possible to turn them off, as well as to reduce the FOV.

I could not play the game at 4K resolution (had to use 2K or less), otherwise the mouse would not hover over the right menu buttons.
Audio
Good music, ambient sounds and voice overs
Gameplay
Walking simulator with mini puzzles until combat time comes, then it becomes a turn based "click-on-available-skills-targeting-on-grid-system-while-you-have-points" fest. Inventory, crafting and skills UI is simple but gets the job done.
Bugs
Could not use 4K, or mouse would not track
Price
Got it on sale. At the time of this review, 35 euros is too much money to pay for what this game offers.
Score
6.5 / 10. Recommendation only applies if you can get it really cheap
Similar games
I've never played previous games of this saga.
I see resemblances with:
  • Legend of Grimrock I & II (but with less puzzles, thankfully)

13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
195.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 septembre 2019
This game is terrible. Its nothing like the original Bard's Tale. The dev took the lore from the original and dumped it into the game and slapped the title Bard's Tale 4 on it to drive sales.

Items - One of the things I have always loved about RPG is loot. There is nothing more satisfying than being able to improve your gear after a tough fight. In Bards Tale 4, moving forward we will refer to it as P**p 4 to save time on typing, weapons and armor only improve your stats. A dagger is equal to a battleaxe as there is no damage associated to the weapon. Damage is determined by the skill you use with. Now I would think that idea is good as you don't have to always find the best weapon to do decent damage; however, you can only select a limited number of skills at any given time. If you don't understand what I mean, simply put, if you trained your character to be proficient in 10 skills (spells and songs count as a skill) you can only use 5 during combat. You can change them outside of combat for the next battle but how does this make sense? You should be able to use every skill you spent a point on anytime during combat. The current system just feels like a cheap unimaginative way to make the game difficult.

Spells - Don't expect a huge list of spells to select from. You will be extremely disappointed. This game pales in comparison to the original 3 games.

Puzzle Weapons - You will spend some time trying to solve these puzzle weapons. When you finally do, they are not much better than the weapons you have been already finding. Nothing legendary about them. Just a big joke and your time and disappointment is the punch line.

Bugs - Not going to comment on the bugs. All games have them. Devs usually do their best to find them and fix. No point going into it as I'm sure the bugs that litter this game will also be addressed in time.

I would have been a lot less disappointed if they gave the game a different title and stated 'Inspired by Bards Tale' rather than calling it P**p 4. Inxile should refrain from taking great games that people have fawn memories of and turning them into p**p.
 
vashaka
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2023
I wish there was a neither negative nor positive review on steam. Is it bad? No. Is it good? also no. It's like a reverse sh*t sandwich where to get to the good part you need to chew through the awful.

The story is forgettable and not particularly interesting, nor are the side quests. All the characters are boring, the soundtrack is irritating, the puzzles frustrating, the graphics unremarkable. Yet the combat is interesting and tactical despite having limited skills and very shallow stats. Seeing what combat encounters were coming up kept me going.

If you like tactical combat it is worth it on sale if only for how large the world is and if you have the patience to get through literally all other areas of the game to get to those decent parts.
 
qyburn13

Non recommandé
19.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
Much more polished than the original release but there are still problems. The graphics often look muddy and jarring. The grid based movement system is not very good and you can tell it was added on as an after thought rather than being there from the beginning.

Ultimately what you have is a mediocre rpg. It's not a Bard's Tale game and certainly not a worthy successor to the original trilogy.

I'd avoid and just go play the original trilogy now that it has been remastered.

EDIT: After 12 hours of play I have some additional thoughts.

1. Bugs. It has more of them than Starship Troopers.
2. Performance. It's very choppy. Sometimes it seems to drop down into single digit fps for a few seconds.
3. Music. The songs are fantastic, some of the best I have ever heard in a game, that said, without a solid game the music is pretty meaningless.
4. Systems. It's more of a puzzle game than an rpg in all honesty which is not really what the backers were expecting. The puzzle weapons are an interesting mechanic but they do not make up for everything else being so lacklustre.

Essentially if you want to play a turn based rpg then look at games like:




for real time I'd go with:


https://store.steampowered.com/app/251730/Legend_of_Grimrock_2/

While none of them are perfect they are all far superior to this.

Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2020
Pueden leer mis impresiones en este sitio.
https://elspamdemariodan.blogspot.com/2020/05/impresiones-bards-tale-iv.html

En resumidas cuentas, lo que me desmotivo para continuar este titulo y seguirlo jugando fue la frecuencia en que se presentaban picos de dificultad que dañaban el flujo de mi progreso, haciéndome cuestionar de como se juega el título, generando frustración y la sensación de que las victorias a estos momentos díficiles es más gracias a la prueba y error que a los esfuerzos propios.

Sin embargo, el título puede ser recomendable si coincides ♥♥♥ el estilo ♥♥♥ el que el juego quiere que lo juegues, ya que he comprobado que los eventos que fueron difíciles para mi, a otros jugadores se les han presentado como situaciones casuales.

No lo niego, el juego me gusta cuando el flujo no es interrumpido, quiero no odiarlo... pero hay que tener mucha tolerancia porque tampoco esta libre de otros males como crasheos, asi que recomiendo la opción de guardado en cualquier momento para no perder progreso.

10.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2020
The combat is quite a change-up from the first three, though you catch hints of it with the whole front row/back row thing, and the option to use the new movement vs the old movement is nice.

Character progression is a bit more difficult. All the encounters seem to be set, and when you're out of cannon fodder to earn XP against, the frustration level against the remaining available encounters goes up quick. (Sure, I could probably get further by playing on easy, but that's not my skill level with CRPGs.) I haven't found a single random encounter in the game yet like the first three had to cut my teeth on some more.

Update: I did some searches of the discussion forum to get an idea if there was any random counters eventually coming and found to my great disappointment there is not. It just doesn't seem like Skara Brae without something leaping out of the shadows at you every now and then. With all the combat encounters and points of advancement pretty severely limited, I am changing my recommendation to "No".

Non recommandé
3.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2020
This barely even feels like a game.
It's like a group of singers and musicians got together to record an album, and someone with no experience in gaming said "Let's make a video game out of this. We'll publish whatever can do in one week" and this was the result. How could Sierra even let this exist, this does not deserve to have "The Bard's Tale" in the title. This is a test run for a shoddy battle system, the only good part of it being the music in battle which isn't on the OST for some reason.
It's like the whole point of this "game" is that it's the music team's audition to do the music for Elder Scrolls 6. It's well known that one of the least good parts about Skyrim was the low effort put into the bards, who weren't so much singing as blandly talking rhyme. The singers for this game can do better. The best explanation I can think of for "The Bard's Tale IV" existing like this is that the singers want themselves known in the gaming community so they can be hired for a better project. I hope I'm right because that's the one thing worth recommending in this rushed mess. I want everyone involved in the music to be hired to do the music for Elder Scrolls 6 so the music doesn't become the one weak point, like it was with Skyrim. Everyone else involved in this needs to find a new career.

3
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
77.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 janvier 2020
Fantastical (fantasy++) story driven RPG. Environments are glossy and highly rendered manifesting exuberant joy or sinister dread, of well known folklore to stunning mystery showcasing excellent lighting and reflection within atmospheric locales. Reminds me just a touch of Arx Fatalis in regards to the first person exploration as new routes open up with new gameplay devices we are so accustomed to nowadays with a brilliant design utilizing Bard songs to open the way similar to the seminal double jump is in a metroidvania. I really feel this is a game worth celebrating and definitely worth the wait!

The combat is enthralling and a great vehicle for the game's action. Rend an enemy useless with an assortment of procs, dots, pluses,minuses - and watch them discombobulate before your eyes then collapse like an inorganic game of dominoes...awash in a cascade of hues and particle effects so fine- and there is quite alot of it in between puzzles and during exploration. It has a familiar feel to it not unlike Thronebreaker a Witcher tale in essence of planning and setting up your creme de la creme or modus operandi. Teamwork is essential to victory and know that when a mob is dead it is gone for good, much like the foraging, there are no respawns. Experience is capped.

Also a nod goes to the resplendent skills trees chock-full of methods at your disposal of not only fathom deep power, it is in tandem with legacy and circumstances that won't void any skill outdated especially the titular namesake's spell songs becoming unencumbered when higher tier instruments are rewarded, actually dedicated to these early level skills that may have been overlooked. Time to dust off the ole spellbook, Mama's got a new squeezebox. All classes share their time in the spotlight and enemies may have and use from their own skills that are very similar.

The story and the side quests are as cryptic and bizarre a conundrum as the puzzles that dot the trails aplenty. This in effect I feel has to be mentioned together as they are entwined richly into the themes of their respected maps and dialogues. The story is setup and begun in the ruins of the city from the first Bards Tale, the faithfulness gives an almost antiquated nostalgia for its predecessor if one can handle the atrocious history of the place, it is offered up here sincerely instead of tragically in respect to lore, but remains fantasy throughout, then taken further into realism but overshadowed by it's low budget is the uncouth appearance of our heroes, ratty hair, disheveled faces, homelessness that holds little to no appeal, but has no virtue than only to extend to the audience what is in fact the evolution of exactly what the original trilogy would look like today, I gather much grittier than most expected.

Really the main detriment in it's own low budget presently on display as the Inventory and animated Character portraits. Also would like to zoom in closer while inspecting every 3D item in game, not only the very cool but non-essential puzzle weapons, no matter if low res textures, I don't think many would care, I think the opportunity to search for clues on the items by rotate and zoom in the next iteration would add to it's enigmatic nature. Books found offer up this type of gameplay.
I could NOT tell the budget was low by the graphics in the maps and their paced sprawl into such lushness. Elaborately detailed locations appear phenomenal and exploration straddles the line of being a walking simulator, but no there is gameplay in there. Outstanding atmosphere, it really feels like another world too, but be wary as it is not free, people here have problems and monsters lurk around every corner, so to witness the beauty of it takes some work. Great great art, love it, great artwork in the set pieces, areas, not so much in the character portraits but enemies look photo-realistic and sharp!

Best part is the wonderful music, its environmental and all based within the world, not really themes songs here but one can really feel uplifted during special moments as if YES the music IS part of this world and angels are singing, angels from the world of the bard's tale. That lovely songbird singing is actually a poor maiden singing while washing her clothes on the sidewalk, run past the church and a Gregorian chant-esque chorus is heard, fading out as you make distance and this can be discovered time and time again weaving between laying the groundwork and setting the framework for these ever contrasting fables of heroic deeds relegated to us the player. Bard songs in pubs add depth as the insane sound effect catalog can intensify the dungeon experience, high quality. Minor knocks and distant machinery or the whispers yes the whispers, all so cleverly masked by each other and a plethora of other ambient effects had me geeking out. As it seems every of the dungeons and areas have their own soundscape, I do not discredit for this environmental town-like musical ambiance does ween when travelling across the countryside for instance, meaning this is not like a circus of music in every direction all the time, merely nice changes that are reflected from the world around the player is more akin to it.

Puzzles, Puzzles, Puzzles. They start off - illogical, random but I was expecting things to go way off the deep end, therefore looking into it way harder than I had too as there are really only so many types of puzzles the game throws at us, blocks, fairies, numerology etc spread throughout, all pleasantly on the normal to easier side. Considerate and this is why credit is due, for they do not get overly obtuse without letting us know it is not time to do this one, come back later. Also for pure showmanship and pizzazz they get aces. Without hand-holding they would be more difficult but here in a sense hand-holding simply means that some runes are on a wall near a certain puzzle, and instead of us jotting them down on paper or opening into our roughly hewn inventory to dig out that scratch of paper with scribbles on it to find said ruins, here they are presented for us on the wall. I found most riddles felt like they cordially invited us in and deftly deposited us out of the puzzle magically before we even knew we were in it, with a sense of accomplishment to boot.


In finale, it is not too hard to ignore the semi-frequent hiccups in frame rate as it never happens during moments of action, also I haven't had any since i left the beginning areas. A very small amount of textures seems like something didn't convert too well over into Unreal 4 and character models are stiff, no mocap actors but the voice work...is really awesome!
 
playoftheyear

Just avoid this console trash and remember, in the future, that inExile is a joke of a company. I'm almost certain they outsourced the development to some lowest bidder company.

Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

if you like grid/turn based combat, puzzles where you move stuff around, Scottish/Gaelic lore and music, traditional D and D style game (elves, humans, Dwarves etc) and RPGS.. this is your game. I am not a huge fan of the puzzles at times they are fun at times they grate but there is a song you can learn to make them easier. I love the bardic music and bard class though damn the wizard aka Practitioner is deadly class. I got this game from a friend and it would totally be worth spending 20 or 30 bucks. 4 out of 5 stars. the game is pretty unforgiving at first but once you learn the combat.. its pretty dope.

Красивый, с большой любовью сделанный Dungeon Crawler с "шотландским" колоритом, с упором на исследование и головоломки, с оригинальной и очень интересной боевой системой и потрясающим саундтреком. По-моему, лучшее, что мне попадалось в жанре за последние десятилетия. По слухам, сразу после выхода игра была забагована донельзя, но пока я собирался её глянуть вышел Director's Сut и никаких вопросов по качеству у меня не возникло.

P.S. Немалое количество отрицательных отзывов может быть связано с тем, что люди ожидают увидеть "классическую" RPG, а это не так.

Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2019
Zostawiam poprzednią, negatywną recenzję, żeby nakreślić pewien obraz tego co było nie tak z BT:4 przed poprawkami.
Zmieniłem swoją opinię, ponieważ wszystkie poniższe problemy zniknęły (poza lekkim cięciem na najwyższych ustawieniach graficznych). Dodatkowo problem nadmiaru zagadek został rozwiązany w sposób niezwykle inteligentny;) Polecam:)

Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2019
The game is still a bit janky with bugs that pretty much require you reload the game. As someone who briefly played the original, this version is a massive improvement. I plan to have a more substantial review if I finish this game. But so far I am enjoying the strategy in the combat on a harder difficulty, the puzzles, and the metroidvanian like progression. Keep in mind that there is some jank that isn't game breaking. The music in this game is great, the Voice Acting is mostly hit with a few misses, the audio mixxing however isn't that great.

A note on most of the current negative reviews as of August 28: Is the only thing you care about Graphics? Not everyone is born with a silver spoon or has a machine in the top 5% for gaming.

Wormwood
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
74.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 février 2021
I recall playing the original Bard's Tale games on the Apple IIe and getting yelled at by my mother while killing 396 berserkers to go take the garbage out...again (but MOM!!!!!!) This game is NOT like those original Bard's Tale games which were 40% surviving round by round scrolling combat text, 50% dungeon exploration, and 10% solving puzzles and riddles. This was back before the days of the internet and all solutions, maps, and everyone's opinion was just a few seconds away on any device, so it actually made the games a bit more challenging. Loading up Bard's Tale 4 shows an extreme departure from the dungeon crawler format, but not necessarily a bad one, IMO. Like others, I was disappointed at first from the departure of the dungeon crawling experience similar to the original Bard's Tales, Might and Magic, or Legends of Grimrock 1 and 2 (all excellent options BTW!) However, I decided to stick with it, settling back and letting the game lead me where it may.

In the end, Bard's Tale 4 is quite an enjoyable experience! Inxile has made BT4 approximately equal parts Strategy Combat, Puzzle/Riddle solving, Exploration, and Storyline. I think they did an extremely good job of developing these four areas well enough to keep me engaged throughout the entire game. Overall I really enjoyed BT4, despite it not being the traditional dungeon crawler as the original games. I would love to see them continue with this type of Exploration/Puzzle/Strategy Combat approach. If they ever make a BT5 similar to this, I would definitely buy it!

Strategy Combat:

The game introduces it's combat mechanics in a stepwise fashion by adding new members with new abilities to your party and introducing new monsters with abilities you need to counter or mitigate, making combat much more strategic than any of the previous 3 games (let's face it, casting MIBL or RIME over and over isn't really that much of a strategy!) After accepting that I wasn't going to spell blast all my enemies to death, I found this new strategy combat to be very enjoyable. Experimenting with combinations of abilities to maximize damage output and mitigate damage input by moving and blocking abilities makes combat kind of a fun puzzle itself to figure out. Yes, at times, I died and had to start over, changing my equipment or abilities to succeed where I had failed previously, but I find this to be a fun part of solving the puzzle and extremely satisfying when you finally succeed! And really dying has no real consequences besides having to restart at your last save point. (Save often!)

Puzzles/Riddles:

The puzzles and riddles themselves aren't extremely difficult to solve, in my opinion. Most are logic based and clues are ample or follow a logical pattern from puzzle to puzzle. There were only a few moments during the game that I felt myself scratching my head unsure what to do next. I would love to see more puzzles that utilize the environment as clues, similar to Riven or Myst in terms of hiding clues in the story or environment itself and where the solutions aren't spelled out for you. But I can understand finding a balance between making the puzzles fun and enjoyable and impossible to solve. Unfortunately in this day and age, solutions are easy to come by on the internet and with these kind of static non-changing puzzles per play through, you can really ruin the experience or negate it altogether with a quick Google search. It would be nice to put some kind of random changing solution so that you couldn't just look up the answer. However, for those who hate puzzles and would just lookup the solutions, you can disable puzzles, though doing so means you are losing out on 25% of the game's challenge, and really none of the puzzles are hard to solve.

Exploration:

The original games had exploration as the main enjoyment of the game. Pencil to paper mapping and keeping detailed notes is one of the greatest points of nostalgia for me from the 80s and 90s dungeon crawlers. Luckily, this is not needed for BT4, as an in-game map with marker points showing where you need to go next is provided and all clues and notes are stored in your inventory. What replaces the need to push pencil to graph paper is an addition of exploration in all three dimensions. There are a lot of hidden items and goods placed everywhere in the game, as long as you are looking and pay attention to the details, including looking vertically as well as horizontally. I played the game in free-movement mode rather than the old school grid based, and I don't think this changed the experience in any way. Certain areas can only be accessed using exploration tools (mainly grappling hooks), but I never ran into a moment where I didn't have one or the mats needed to craft one available the entire game. And speaking of details, the game is beautifully drawn with fantastic nods and nostalgia to the original 3 games (for example, underground Skara Brae actually matches the original BT1 city layout, when I finally noticed Harkynn's castle buried in the rubble I laughed out loud.)

Story:

YES! one of the things that BT4 does, compared to the previous games, is add a story that ties together and unfolds as you play the game. I felt that the story was kind of lost for the original three dungeon crawlers being introduced at the beginning (Kill Mangar! Get the Wand of Destiny! Kill Tarjan!), and was kind of brought up again only sparsely or as an afterthought (though maybe BT3 is the exception...but barely!) BT4 adds dialogue, cut-scenes, and a plot that updates as you progress through the game. Your party members have added personalities that sometimes mix and sometimes do not (though this has no impact on combat or plot.) And the plot really brings in characters and concepts from the original games, weaving a tale from all three. There are a LOT of nods and references to the original games, just enough for the right amount of nostalgia to kick in for me. Overall, the story is a nice addition, though not overly complicated or suspenseful. Just enough to keep me interested and moving along.


Crafting, Gold and Equipment:

BT4 adds in a crafting system, which overall is nice way to use up all the "stuff" you collect while exploring. Overall, however, you find so much stuff that crafting becomes kind of an extra step and never was I fishing for a rare crafting mat to progress or power up my party. Same thing with gold. At the beginning of the game, gold is rare and hard to come by, and the equipment you can buy is really expensive. However, as you progress through the game, gold becomes plentiful and the items you would normally buy are not as good as the items you find. By the end of the game I had mounds and mounds of gold and nothing to do with it. At the same time, equipment and item drops were frequent enough to force me to juggle items in my inventory to make room for more. Both points were true of the original games as well, so I'm not that upset, but my advice for people starting out, don't be afraid to spend your gold, use your consumables, or sell your excess equipment. There is no need to horde items or equipment as you will find plenty more as you progress.

Bugs:

This is something worth mentioning as the original release was reported to be riddled with game-stopping bugs that ruined the experience for others. I've only played the Director's Cut version of the game and it works fine for me. I've experienced one crash to desktop, which set me back one encounter. (Save often!) And a few times when I exited combat, I would auto walk in a certain direction, however pressing that direction's key and releasing it usually fixes the problem. Neither ruined the experience for me by any means.
 
Noob Golberg Machine
267 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2020
Up front: I've barely played the game and I don't have a reason to continue. Here's why:

1. The control design is half-baked. It allows you to use a gamepad, but the tutorial doesn't account for the gamepad controls. Additionally, there was no way to utilize various in-game menus using the controller, including the inventory and skill overviews. This is a major oversight. It would be better served to disallow the gamepad entirely and focus on serving one control scheme well.

2. The initial scenario is clunky. I have to play as Melody through the opening area, but there's no reason for this. There are no introductions to any of her skills, or character. It isn't for ease of tutorial. There's not even any combat with her. Then randomly, I get to "customize" a character after a cutscene without reason or explanation. It's jarring. It makes no sense. Either use Melody as a tutorial character effectively, or let me customize my character immediately. This breaks immersion.

3. The customization is sub-par. Why is it even there? The pre-made designs are deeply unpleasant to look at, and the portraits that accompany them have odd choices — why does this one man have a helmet when nobody else does? Why do I have to be bald if I'm playing as a dark-skinned woman? Why can't I be a skinny guy, or large worman? I don't even know where to start with the non-humans... If customization is allowable, then it should have some ability to be flexible. If it's not flexible, then just ... why waste the money developing it?

Maybe I'll go back at some point and rethink this. Currently, given the poor design choices already in play at the earliest point in the game — a section that should be the most polished — I can't say it would be worth an investment.
 
Gacha Pawn
2,346 produits enregistrés
0

0
Non recommandé
12.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
Lo he intentando durante horas y a ratos incluso me gustaba, pero al final, no puedo recomendarlo. Lo mejor que tiene el juego es la idea del sistema de combate, pero pronto se rompe cuando te obligan a llevar a gente que haga daño psíquico para no morir, cuándo hay tantos que atacan a distancia que el poner a los más resistentes delante sirve de bien poco, o cuando no te permiten farmear pero luego los combates a veces se pasan de dificultad o resultan simplemente un coñazo.

Al principio pensé que la historia tardaba en despegar. Tras 12 h simplemente comprendí que era así y ya. Me hubiese encantado que me gustase, pero no puedo ♥♥♥ el, por mucho que me haya forzado, me ha aburrido de sobremanera.

Recommandé
34.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2020
Got this game from the humble bundle and expected it to be junk like pretty much everything else from there, but I've been pleasantly surprised about this one! It has some glitches but nothing game breaking for me, just save often. The world and atmosphere is well-done and quite engaging and the combat is difficult enough to be fun but also not frustrating. There are lots of hidden areas and secrets which I love! But it also doesn't make you feel like you're missing out if you don't bother with them or the offerings or anything. This game feels like a fairly low-budget labor of love so its easy to look past any of the little flaws <3

Surprisingly all-around decent RPG!

Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2020
I enjoyed the game but it is a very specific enjoyment, the chains and whips kind.
The game is frankly buggy as hell, in the time i played it crashed every few hours (2-3) and almost every dam time was after a particularly long or annoying battle.
Frequently it would detect single clicks as double clicks and other such nonsense.
Many many major features of the game are just terribly explained like almost painfully so.
Musics good if a little repetitive
Story is standard fantasy fair, nothing special, nothing offensive
Combat is basic and aside from the glitchy controls easy
So yeah if you enjoy fighting the game as much as the enemies would recommend, if you have a brain though i would say avoid for your health.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2020
Der Sound! Was für ein erster Eindruck. Die Musik ist wirklich das Sahnestückchen dieses Spiels. Nicht, weil ich auf diese art Musik stehe, sondern weil es einen sofort mitnimmt. Mitten hinein ins Geschehen.

Trotz des auf den ersten Blick einfachen Kampfsystems kann hier taktisch eine Menge mitgenommen werden. Und trotzdem gibt es Gründe warum so wenige der Käufer es länger spielen. Bereits nach 4 und 8 Stunden hatte ich keinen Bock mehr und habe mich nur noch durchgekämpft. Diese alten Spiele sind ohne ein vernünftiges Walk Through (auf Deutsch) für mich unspielbar. Selbst mit dem sehr hilfreichen Direktorscut (die meisten Rätsel können so umgangen werden) gibt es immernoch zuviele Stellen, die nervig bzw. nicht zu lösen sind.

Auf Dauer ist das Spiel zudem ziemlich eintönig.

Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2020
Обалденная игра, давно меня так не затягивало, отличная игра сказка-приключение-загадка с элементами старой школы, и превосходным визуалом, звуком ,и о да суперской музыкой и песнями.
И да у игры был очень херовый старт и проблемы с багами и оптимизацией её выпустили сырой и не допиленной. И из за этого вдвойне обидно за этот недооценённый шедевр, которые многие проигнорировали из за низких оценок и отрицательных отзывов даунитос-гомосапиенс, а ведь тут явно душу вложили люди создавшие эту игру. Любителям этого жанра и не только очень рекомендую, вот сейчас самое время в неё поиграть когда по сути и играть то не во что один шлак и мракобесие, а тут душа есть.

Non recommandé
12.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2019
EDIT: To add insult to injury, the developers have now retroactively and without warning changed the system requirements from Windows 7 to Windows 10, something unheard of on Steam. Don't forget to use the Report button on the store page to inform Steam of this if you are affected - inXile are most likely in breach of contract with Steam by doing this.

---

Trying to use the controller in grid movement mode is an utter joke, you can't reliably go in the direction you want to. (And judging from other reviews, even with regular movement controller support is bad.) It's infuriating enough just to navigate after the intro cutscene, imagine trying to move in an area where you have to be precise in order to avoid enemies.

Too bad, if this had controlled and been designed to work like one of the great modern gridders like the Shin Megami Tensei ones, it would've been perfect to play from the couch.

(There's also the issue of promising grid movement to Kickstarter backers and then completely dropping the idea and eventually doing a half-assed and doomed to fail implementation post-release in a game that was absolutely not designed for it. Think twice before backing this company, you might not get what you were sold on.)
 
UncleYar
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
64.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2019
Great game. Very fun game play and nice retro combat style with a twist.

Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2019
The music in Bard's Tale IV is something you don't want to miss. I don't usually notice music in a game. I upgraded to the deluxe version so I could listen to the music outside the game. :D

The director's cut fixed a lot of bugs in the original game, so it is worth buying.

If you've played older Bard's Tale, Might and Magic or Wizardry games, you'll find this familiar but also refreshingly new. There are a lot of puzzles in this game as well; some are challenging.
