9.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2019
I see a lot of down voting because the visuals were downgraded. Before the director cut this game was barely playable at 4k on my GTX 1080. TBH it wasn't even that great at 1080p. Sure they reduced the some of the textures and the max resolution is currently 2k but the game is buttery smooth and playable now. I look forward to playing through it now as I had to stop due to the poor performance of the original release. If you are really a fan of Bard's Tale the graphics shouldn't even matter as the first three games were text based with a small picture in the top left of your screen. In short if you liked the original Bard's Tale games I think you will enjoy this game.
 
Ralithorn

6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
68.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2022
The worst performing game I've ever played (worse than Cyberpunk, even worse than Cryostasis). Nothing I did stopped this terrible performance with its awful stuttering, I couldn't even seem to minimise the stutter. Judging by the forums I was not alone. It's also a fairly crash-happy game. Crashing for me on almost double-figure occasions.

However, it's still a very good and interesting RPG 'dungeon crawler'. Tonnes of puzzles to think your way though (maybe a few too many really, but you can always use the inbuilt 'cheat spell' to bypass them, something I only had to do about 3 times).

Fights are interesting too, turn-based and with quite a bit of variety.

Graphics, when not stuttering, are beautiful. Sounds are amazing and this game features one of the most stunning soundtracks, complete with dozens of actual songs, that I've ever heard.

Recommended.
 
[FOAD]Iron
2,521 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
67.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2021
I bought the Director's Cut because the game supports so many Scottish Gaelic musicians, and because the Gaelic features so prominently. For example, in The Forest of Inshriach, the deity is a bear named Mathran..."mathran" is the Gaelic for bear.

All of the support to the gaming company aside, it's just really good to see Gaelic musicians being included in games with Gaelic music and themes. They even include a bit of Gaelic psalm-singing from the Isle of Lewis!

Actual game play has really improved since release. The puzzles are fun but not overly difficult (they have an easy mode where you can bypass a lot of them, if necessary), the story arcs are interesting (and some parallels can be drawn to what was happening in Scotland at the time -- it's set in 18th-century Scotland) and it's not especially taxing for my laptop. I don't know that it would be worth it, to me, personally, without the heavy Gaelic influence but with that influence there I would absolutely buy the game again!
 
teh dwarf

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
22.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2020
OK, I tried to play the remastered version of the first 3 parts in the series but those were not visual enough for me to enjoy.. I rather prefer pixel graphics.

Then I tried this one and it seemed really interesting at first.. but after a few hours I realized that I can stuck in this game really easy.

The fight seemed really unfair even on normal difficulty so I changed it to easy.. and I don't like games where I need to set easy difficulty. The fight system could use some more action... I feel like I can barely move, while all of the enemies can attack together and from nearly any distance. I couldn't find any way to train my characters and faced always RED colored packs everywhere.. where is the balance in this? It toke me a lot of time to find my way for quests because everywhere my way was blocked by these hard enemy packs and nothing else.. I had no problem with the puzzles I found, but the fight system.

-1 for the normal difficulty of fighting, way too hard
-1 for the amount of skills a character can equip, 4 is not enough.. most of the attacks are useless compared to the ranged skills.
-1 for not working skills I found... no mather how I tried to use them, they just didn't work..
-1 In most of the situations half of my chracters can't attack because of the range limits, but the enemy can. I don't like to be limited like that.
-1 for singing all the time.. it was fun at first, but not after the 20th choir song I have to listen..
+1 for visuals and story. (These are the only reason why I play it.)
-1 / +1 for a lot of puzzles / for the option to skipp most of them. I don't like puzzles basically cause I have enough brain work at my work.. don't need more.
-1 I could stuck in the game 3 times in the first 3 hours because of the hard enemies.. I was running around for hours until I figured out that I have no choice but to attack harder enemies.
(I hate it when my time is waisted..)

My rating is 5/10

Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2023
I was looking forward getting into an old school dungeon crawler type game but I cant seem to get through the beginning of the game without being completely annoyed with the combat system.

There are something like 8 "position" squares the characters can shuffle around and early in the game there is a fight where the characters have to shuffle around those squares to avoid a one hit kill. I won the battle but the constant messages when trying to attack saying "you can attack from here" were thoroughly annoying considering there wasn't much distance from one space to another.

The combat mechanics, owing to this, just seem to be too annoying for me. Especially when someone cannot even use magic from a certain distance or angle.

Argybargy
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
110.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2020
As my most anticipated game from 2018, not surprisingly, I knew it was worth waiting another almost 16 months before finally returning to Skara Brae and it did not disappoint, to an extent. The Bards Tale IV is a solid adventure game checking all the right boxes but stumbling with some new ideas, balance and basic quality of life tools.

Positives

Good story that keeps you always moving forward. The voice acting is really well done and its always fun to talk to the NPCs. Quests are also pretty good taking you to locations that will take hrs to complete.

A solid musical soundtrack full of celtic ballads, dance and folk hymns, it’s pretty amazing

HUUUUGGE world to explore but maybe too big. There is a good variety to the world and each location looks amazing.

The new innovations of the grid, turned based, 100% hit chance make combat so much more tactical. There is a good roster of enemies and the RNG of where they are placed on the grid at the start keeps each combat scenario interesting.

You are able to see enemies in the world as you explore and their level of difficulty. This offers a choice to avoid or engage.

You have the ability to buy or respect and build characters to your liking at any time with these special coins that are not rare which is nice.

While a grid based movement system is available, I loved the ability to free roam and look around making it feel more open world.

Good balance of combat and puzzles keeps the flow smooth until the last ⅓ of the game where it is almost 90/10 puzzles. Puzzle difficulty can range from simple to very hard with no hint system in game available.

As RTX is the new graphics buzzword, this game does one heck of a job ♥♥♥♥♥♥ it. It has the best reflections i have ever seen in a game and really adds to the lighting and fantastic art direction. I would like to have seen a day/ night cycle and some weather effects but its still impressive. The performance is also pretty good though enemy animations during combat will freeze on occasion but this never caused any crashes or failures to a combat scenario.

A ton of graphical and how to play options available.


Negatives

No budget was available for the team who did the character models. They are really bad.

Instead of a traditional RPG point distribution, each class picks an active or passive skill. It is really odd as there is not a whole lot of skills and you can almost max out every ability needed with each character and a lot of them I never found useful. I think each weapon needed its own tree and I think adding multiple tiers to some of the passives would have been better.

Depending on your roster most spells for your mage were never needed and I could not figure out how to fit the Bard in my party.

Combat can become monotonous. I think once i reached level 18 i was basically just doing the same thing to the end(lvl 34).

The game is pretty padded especially near the end with puzzles and respawning enemy types. I reached level 34 but there is not enough variety to loot, enemies or puzzles to justify its 60hr campaign

Most of the loot from either solving a puzzle or finding something off the beaten path never seemed to give anything that was better than I already owned.

No world map. You can only view what location you currently are present. This makes navigating some puzzles and quests confusing. Where is this?

The inventory system is horrible, maybe one of the worst i have seen in any recent RPG. Late in the game you will probably hit max capacity and vendors only have so much $ to buy so you will need to destroy items for space.

Code wheel is not in game

There is a lot of stuff in the game that is never explained

I found something near the end to solve a puzzle from about 15 hrs earlier, really?

Difficulty is all over the place. I highly recommend normal for a first play through but it seems no matter what difficulty, once you reach mid game any combat scenario will not be difficult.

Weapon puzzles are just bad

No DLC


Final thoughts

The Bards Tale IV is definitely not for every dungeon crawler out there. The inventory and poor map design made for unnecessary time consumption and some of the quests and puzzles are not simple to decipher. If you do accept this crawl expect some what the ?, where do I go, and sometimes Ah ha moments. The game really does disappoint as an RPG but is still a really good adventure that has me excited for the future of the series.



Played 2560x1080 Ultrawide high settings 50-110 frames

System: AMD Ryzen 5, MSI Vega 56, 16GB ram

My party consisted of a Bard, 1 Shield, 2 -two handed weapon, a practitioner and rouge. I finished my play through on normal difficulty at 64 hrs completing almost every quest available. I do not use guides or watch preview builds.
 
CitizenX3639
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
117.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2021
Пройдя игру, ( согласно статистики steam, нас всего 6% ), мне игра не понравилась, хотелось бросить множество раз, в игре всего два плюса, это музыка и боевка, на всю игру один запоминающийся квест (найти спиртное для пьяницы), все остальное минусы. Напихали в игру просто немеренное количество головоломок, были бы они еще интересные, но нет, они не сложные, они скучные, нудные, на которые тратишь уйму времени, не на решение, а на беготню. И да беготни в игре много, очень много, не по делу. Игра больше напоминает жанр, "поиск предметов", чем рпг. Игра про барда, а сам бард в пати практически не нужен, он просто бесполезен, он не интересен. Его просто держишь, из за очка возможностей и щита. Исследовать мир, а за чем, там нет ничего стоящего, с ящиков мусор, с бочек мусор, с сундуков мусор, с алтарей мусор, с решения головоломок мусор. Эльфийское оружие практически все бесполезное,( чего только стоит фишка, если вы ничего не будите делать то мы вам дадим плюшку, я про накапливания заряда), кроме единственного посоха для хила. За всю игру попались всего два нужных предмета, это кинжал вампирик и кнут против нежити. В игре рулят маги и роги, ну и очки возможностей. Можно еще много чего написать, но я устал!!!

Asatas - Cookiemonster
1,581 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 septembre 2019
I updatd my review to reflect on changes brought by the October patch. First of all, this is a fun game that has been let down somewhat by the intense lack of care on behalf of its developers, who never managed to patch the original version in due time and then took more than a year to turn said patch into a "director's cut", which is what you have here. After all this time of directors supposedly cutting the game (?), it still has a very beta feel to it, especially in the optimisation department and the hardly director-cut (sorry, I mean improved), ill-conceived game systems like inventory management and game saving, that have just been castrated (director-cut?) here to tone down their inherently frustrating design.
Now, after some more intense cutting by very able directors, the game pad support works and it works rather well. According to the community, there was a graphics downgrade when this version was released that has been somewhat rolled back. I wouldn't know about that: this game was blurry mess back then and it's a slightly less blurry mess now. Sometimes it looks nice. More often, it does not. The music is fantastic. The game is very puzzly and fun, and nobody understands why this is a Bard's Tale game.
I recommend this game, but very much not whole heartedly.


Original Review:
It's actually worse now. Straight out of the box, the long awaited controller support on menus and tutorial boxes is broken. I had a lot of patience with the original release, and it was a lot of fun to play once you came to grips with its issues, but to re-release a game in such a broken messy state one year down the line is just bloody incompetent. What the hell were you thinking?
 
FuneralMile

Non recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2020
Produit remboursé

В целом я люблю игрули вдохновленные чемнить бородатым, и с песком из задницы сыпящимся. Брал оригинал на старте, и он у меня тогда тупо не запустился. Так что оценить Бардовскую Замуть 4: Режиссерское Обрезание могу тока сейчас. И знаете, чета как то уныло по началу. Судя по отзывам других людей игра тут вполне на 50-60 часов. Но глядя на текущее древо прокачки, арт-дизайн, персонажей, озвучку и боевку... мне так кажеться что не захочу я слить полтинник часов, так как скучно получается уже сейчас. А еще тут боевка затянута, как стринги на жиробасе. Смотреть тошно.

Отдельно по Графену Графеновичу Сидорову. Тут такой унылый дженерик-нейтральный фентезийный арт дизайн, что мне охота начать бухать метил, чтобы не видеть его более. Игре именно что не хватает стиля. Стиля и вкуса в широком смысле.

Может конечно Директорское Обрезание и найдет пару-тройку козырей в заднем кармане, часу на x y й-знает-каком, но пока что рекомендовать не могу. Если мой дeрьmо-метр не захотел вникать в эту игру, то и советовать никому не буду. Наxyй оценки, просто глядите на свой страх и риск.

llarry32

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
59.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2020
I didn't play this game at release, so I don't know exactly why this got so many poor reviews at launch, but I thought this version of the game was great.

This is a puzzle-heavy dungeon crawler, and my past experience with this kind of game is that the puzzles are usually annoying roadblocks to more interesting content. However, the puzzles in this game were very well designed, and only a small handful of them were either annoying, or bad, and I only had to give up and consult a walkthrough twice. I would highly recommend just using a site that solves the codex 'puzzles' for you though, because looking up numbers in a table is just not fun.

The combat system was actually quite nice, with interesting variation across classes, and a deep skill tree with choices that really matter. The party-wide action point system allowed for a ton of flexibilty in party composition and a lot of room for optimization and synergy.

Oh, and the world in this game is really beautiful at times, there were many moments where I was like 'wow, that was pretty cool'.

And for the people complaining this game is too difficult, there's an easy mode which is actually very easy, and an option to make puzzles skippable if you find the puzzles to hard and don't want to use a walkthrough.

For those who like a challenge, I played on the hardest difficulty, and found it to be a good challenge, with a few fights that I had to retry a couple of times, and I never ran into any roadblocks - if enemies in an area are simply too strong to be defeated, you're probably in the wrong area, or you need to optimize your party composition more.



A word of caution for linux users: This game is horribly broken on linux. I had to switch to Windows for it.

The graphics glitch out so badly that I have to quit to main menu and resume every few minutes or the floor disappears, random objects are fluorescent yellow, enemies body parts are all disconnected and all over the screen, etc.

I played around with all of the settings to try to fix it, including disabling GPU acceleration and doing CPU-only rendering, but nothing helped.
 
banana

0

Game keeps crashing. I've sunk 20+ hours into this and dealing with it because it scratches an itch from my old dungeon crawling days, but honestly, since the game doesn't FREQUENTLY autosave, it's really not worth my time to keep. going. back. and doing. stuff. over.

After what I've played, I'm apt to agree with them. Don't buy this unless you want a buggy mess, poor level design/layout, and puzzles that are more frustrating than interesting.

Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2019
I was looking for game similar to Wizardry 8 in terms of combat and world. I saw fighting grid, skills, artifact puzzles (wow... that is great idea). I though that can be it. I was wrong. I'm really disappointed. Game is linear one and story driven. Few character and even less attributes, equipment is blunt, no weapon damage etc. Spells are skills and are very limited. Basically everything is skill driven. But not many interesting ones, just different grid attack. If You are looking for open world and interesting combat mechanics then It is not for You. Better choose Divinity Original Sin 2 or Pillars Of Eternity that are better in that area.

Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2020
Edit: I have over almost 100hours into this+ offline. (But I explore every nook cranny)

Honestly I loathed and disliked the very thought of this being made turn based and almost cried starting it when I realized how amazing it coulda' been real-time.

That aside, the immersive atmosphere, dialog, artistry an sense of "love/work" put into this for players, evens it out; which if I was to say I loved turn-based combat, would be to say this is an absolutely astounding game.

If you like turn based combat, you can't actually get any better...imo (Even if u don't, I think it's worth a shot)

Edit: This has by far one of the best soundtracks of any game I have played(Actually feels like it's not from a game, if u kno watt I mean) too bad it is a little short but worth it if you like the sort of music it is 100%.

Devilbones
0
21 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
No lessons learned here, folks. Turn around and go find a different game to give your hard earned money to.

InXile doesn't respect you, your time, or their backers. There's already a long list of day one bugs that could have been sorted out if they'd given us the game to beta test and, you know, listened. You still can't just play the game. With every other BT game, you can build your party and just get right into the adventure. Instead you're stuck in a hours long, boring, and anti-climatic tutorial. And then there's the graphics. Yup. Still messed up. Clipping issues everywhere. Settings that don't do anything. And no shadows.

Game plays nothing like any other Bard Tale, which would be fine if that meant anything. There's free movement but no jump, crouch, or sneak. That last one really hurts as your guide literally tells you during the tutorial to sneak past some guards. The only way to get to other platforms is to get a grappling hook and rope that lets you use designated points to ascend/descend. Much like a Zelda game, but much, much less fun. I am playing a contemporary game using a contemporary engine or something from 1989? Oh, wait this is built out on the Unreal engine. Surely InXile didn't need to specifically program in that kind of knee-capping movement, did they?

It's just plain dumb.

Then there's combat. You move about on a 2 x 4 grid and lob attacks. You start with three actions per side. Hope you enjoy the tedium because combat is going to get tedious real fast. Move, hit, move, hit. Back and forth, back and forth. It's not an interesting or entertaining minigame. It's just plain boring. Boring to the point that I think I'm done.

This game doesn't even rise to the level of wasted potential. It's irritating to think about what was promised as part of the Kickstarter and what we've received. For those of us who wanted a return to the classic, grid-based, simple and straightforward RPG, this is almost the exact opposite of that. It's a clunky, complicated, stupidly restricted that you can't even begin to call it "free-movement" but there's no other term that comes close walking puzzle simulator. Whatever elements of RPGs that exist within the game, either contemporary or past, are so shallow to not be considered such.

It bears repeating: InXile doesn't respect you, your time, or their backers.
 
h3lldr0p

3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2022
One can cook on and with an open fire. These are some of the ways to cook with fire outside. Cooking meat using a spit is a great way to evenly cook meat. In order to keep meat from burning, it's best to slowly rotate it. Hot stones can be used to toast bread. Coals are hot and can bring things to a boil quickly. If one is very adventurous, one can make a hole in the ground, fill it with coals and place foil-covered meat, veggies, and potatoes into the coals, and cover all of it with dirt. In a short period of time, the food will be baked. Campfire cooking can be done in many ways

This is not a Bard's tale game. I hate it with every atom of my body.

169.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2021
the game got beautiful world and lore but sadly the story is so boring and predictable. its such a waste.
music is great! i think music is honestly the only part of the game which perfect. it's not the best but its great without a fault.
gameplay is cool yet also not so cool. classes and skills is so well synergitic which is great but limited action slot is ruining the combat especially when this game don't have regular attack.
some skills is downright useless like summon.
npcs... how many npc in the game actually? i only remember like 5... i forgot
graphic skills effect and environments looks nice.
characters more like races is downright ugly. its not pleasing in the eye. i dont like all beautiful people in final fantasy because it doesnt makes sense but still i prefer that rather than ugly characters everywhere. elves is green ugly its like tall goblin! why!???
monster design is so boring. it's either humanoid, goblin-like creature and what..? actually all i can remember is humanoid enemies. it's either human knight, human cultists and skeletons. thats how forgettable the game monsters is. elite or mid-bosses is just named regular monsters while bosses is just wraith, wraith and wraith...yeah all bosses is just wraiths and mages...
character creation... there is character creation but you literally can't make anything you want out of it. the customization option is so bad and too limited might as well make predefined with good quality instead>
also massive amount of puzzles. you will spent more time on puzzles than fighting or dungeon crawling.

i really wish to rate the game as neutral but if someone ask me now to buy this game or not then my answer is no.
it's a mediocre game at best

its fun for people who starving for turn based dungeon crawler who willing to compromise lots of faults in this game

Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2021
THIS IS IN CERTAIN AREAS A WORK OF GENIUS.
THE MUSIC IS ASTOUNDINGLY GOOD
THE VOICE ACTING IS ABSOLUTE PERFECTION
THE ENVIRONMENT IS BEAUTIFUL AND INTERESTING
If the whole game was this good it would probably be the best game ever made.
For you this might be the case but for me it was not what do i mean by that and why do i say it?
Well as an RPG the game fails for me due to lack of player freedom and variety of character build options
Also for me the game fails because they have decided to pad gameplay time by putting endless puzzels everywhere.You may love this especially if you love soduko for me its just horrible but you may love it

Non recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2020
Bard's Tale - Where most of your player starter options you aren't even a bard... wait, what? Well, it still has its famous Bard-Bawdy humor... . None? The characters you meet are funny, and very clever 3rd wall... no?

Okay, is this Bard's Tale or not? Its more of a generic "Thief" game where you have to sneak around, because most of the mobs are too high and will kill you (intentional game design), except there is no sneak or crouch (or even jump) feature.

Avoid this game all Bard's Tale fans... or... if you've ever played Bards Tale in the past, and asked yourself, this game would be so cool if it was just a bit more dry- and I really wish I didn't have to be a Bard... maybe I could be a wizard or... something else - then this game is for you (maybe).

((MORE REVIEWS)) TO SEE OTHER INSIGHTFUL REVIEWS, HEAD TO https://steamcommunity.com/groups/lordvongames ((THUMBS UP, JOIN the Group, Discuss Reviews))

Évaluation publiée le 23 juin 2020
Very sad. I live in a rural area, so this was a BIG download for me. My computer *should* be able to handle the game...but it can't. Even with the graphics at the lowest setting, FPS is terrible. Lots of stutters and hangs, making it downright painful to move around. I tried, I really did, but it looks like you need a computer that's much, much beefier than the recommended setup. So, if your computer isn't a lot better than you think you should need to run this game...you might be wasting your time.

Editing to add: If you do have the kind of lag I was experiencing, you might be able to muddle through if you turn all the sounds off in addition to the low quality graphics. The resulting game looks like it came out in the 1990s and is still slow, but marginally playable.
 
QoAad

0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
71.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2021
This game wins and fails at various things, and overall I love this game and I find it fascinating as it opens a window in what could have been and will be again. I think it is a unique and sincere take on the old 80s RPG games with the text window next to the arrow-bordered box where you transition through one cubed room at a time in classic dungeon-crawler fashion.

I think it demonstrates a direction 80s dungeon games could have gone had Diablo not hit the scene in the 90s. Diablo pushed an isometric 3rd person view and coupled that with the procedural dungeon generation of Rogue.
Bard's Tale 4 pretends that game never happened. With passion the game tries to recapture the old success of the story-based lore-loving adventures of old without any irony and a lot of heart. While I found the story to be fairly standard, I think it is (surprisingly) the combat where the game shines most. There is a satisfaction and an interplay to all of the moves and spells, with many acting fine alone, but altogether on another level when combined with certain spells and moves from other characters or even gear or trinkets. I found the battles to be very challenging and fun, with interesting effects and concepts.
With these battles, I want to also point out that they grew in complexity the longer I played, which helped to make the mid to late-game play deeper and even more engaging. I found it fun to buff three characters, switch two to get an armor buff thanks to boots, and then switch back as a free move that also bolsters defense. All for one action point! So satisfying. The game is full of clever combos and fight styles like that, macros that make any difficulty a distinct possibility and also still a challenge.

Mainly this is worth playing for the cool lore, complex fights, and touch of history and nostalgia for Bard's Tale 1-3 and other similar dungeon crawlers from the late 80s.
 
Count Jackula
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé

188.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2019
I had the original version, but the Directors Cut is the one to have. Perfect update to the game with exceptional controller support added on for the game. I am using my Xbox One controller on a PC and it works flawlessly now. This game takes patience and attention to detail which is lacking in a lot of games these days. Liked the story before so game wise no issues there. The graphics looked stepped up somehow. Not sure what they did but everything looks sharper and more detailed. Kudos to InXhile for sticking with this perfecting the game play and mechanics. Highly recommend this cut was well worth the wait.
 
kcwilsonii
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
97.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2019
cdkeys = $10, great price. I tried the original which didn't run well. This runs much better at the cost of graphic detail but still looks good. Have to say it's a great game so far. While it doesn't remind me much of the original Bard's Tale games I played back in the day, it's a refreshing role-playing, dungeon exploring game which makes you think and that's a good thing.

Can't compare much more to the 1st revision other than the graphics but for $10 this was a steal. Wish they could patch the inventory so you could sort items better but that's my only gripe with this game outside the looping song in the adventurer's guild which sounds like fingers scraping on a chalkboard.

Recommended if you're not bitter about the 1st revision and migrating to the director's cut. This game made 2019 a good year after all.

Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
Beware, I supported this since kickstarter and have played the original games back in the 90's.

Like a lot of other games that have supposedly been freshly created for current generation, this has failed like others.

Buggy and not created in the same form as the original games, this should not be named as Bard's Tale 4.

No random combat to level your characters and earn money, no mapping system that I could find, no farming locations. This is not a decent RPG at all.

2023 - Still a terrible game, with some completely unbalanced combat mechanics.

Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 janvier 2021
One Grumpy Russian finds it hard to like an RPG game where you cannot jump, or where you rope-hook is a single use item that you can tie to a ledge, but not untie it, or where you fight in a 2 row v 2 row structure allowing for a simple strategy to make all your battles a tedious repetition… On the positive side, the music is good.

I was curious about this game, I played the original Bards Tale ages ago, and quite honestly had no nostalgia when trying out Badts Tale 4. I was not disappointed or anything, but game simply failed to engage me, to interest me, to make me want to come back. I mean a campaign starting with Xenophobia and introduction to simplified gameplay did not help.
I did not complete the game, it felt meh, and subjectively I can’t recommend it because there are better RPG games to dedicate your time to, more engaging, more interesting and more challenging ones. This game is for the series fans, however if you are new to Bard’s Tale spend your money elsewhere.

Dungeon crawler RPG with a turn-based grid on grid battles that fails to keep you engaged.

One Grumpy Russian score 5/10 - A modern RPG where you can’t jump cannot stand out, good music won't help. It also reminds me of Lenin lying in the mausoleum, he can't jump either.

for more review follow me as a curator at One Grumpy Russian

Foes from below, blood on the snow,
Bright crimson on white.

A mad man's story of ancient glory brought death from far away,
For eldritch power did Mangar scour
The depths of Skara Brae.

Snow in summer, ice in my heart
Death's cold fingers tear us apart
Snow in summer, ice in my heart
Death's cold fingers tear us apart

'Gainst Mangar's horde we took up sword, and fought from dawn to dawn
Though we did win too many kin
Gave life to see them gone.

To Mangar's lair we took the snare, its hooks did end his reign.
Now there it lies if e'er he rise
To bring him low again.

Snow in summer, ice in my heart
Death's cold fingers tear us apart
Snow in summer, ice in my heart
Death's cold fingers tear us apart"

Denisptasha
254 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2021
Игра интересная и красивая, с хорошим музыкальным сопровождением, но для современности ей не хватает более логичных механик, квестов и прокачки, иначе это выглядит внутри как Morrowind к примеру.
Может разрабы в олдовщину хотели, но нафига? Эволюционировать то надо хоть немного.
Мне квесты не понравились. Куда-то пришел по квесту на набережную, ничего не узнал - везде тупик или сильные враги, которые ваншотят. А рядом есть квест прям как в реальной жизни - чтобы с бухим алкашом поговорить, надо самому выпить, а выпить не можешь ( в реале бросил, а тут навыка не хватает). А где этот навык, и даже еслиб нашел, то нет очка на прокачку. Не люблю такие квесты, которые не можешь начать выполнять.
Другие квесты тоже застопорились.
Ладно... Если игра перестает приносить удовольствие, я её делаю интересной с помощью читов. Думаю хоть пойду того здоровяка у фонтана замочу, который по кругу ходит.
Начинаю искать читы и скачивать и что вы думаете - не один не работает. Ну ёлы палы...
Кстати загрузки побыстрее игре тоже бы не помешали, поэтому ставьте ее сразу на ssd диск.
Скажу честно очень хотел бы поиграть, потому что такое приключение мне по нраву, хоть и сюжет слабоват очень, как мне кажется, но за неимением времени разбираться во всем этом нет желания, а читы подвели.
За музыку - 10 баллов конечно.
За графон - 8
За дизайн, гамму, окружение - 6
За Геймплей - 6
За сюжет и квесты - 3
за диалоги - 4
За головоломки - 6
За боевую систему - 6
За лут, шмотки и магию - 5
За прокачку - 2

6 не работающих чит трейнеров из 6
 
The True Mayhem

Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2019
I was hoping the director's cut would make the game feel more like the trilogy. It did not.

It's really a puzzle fighter rather than a party creation RPG like one would expect.

This is two Kickstarter disappointments in a row. Between this and Torment, in a stark contrast to Wasteland 2 I might add, I'm starting to think inXile is not really trustworthy when it comes to Kickstarters.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
93.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 février 2020
Temporary thumb up before finishing a first play, quite good long fun, but three warnings:
- It's not a puzzle game but it's a RPG with a lot of puzzles and some sort of riddles.
- Performances aren't that great, at least on my computer, but for the gamplay it's totally fine.
- There's still glitches but I haven't seen any game breaking bug.

Otherwise no review yet, but plenty aspects that are good if not better: Exploration, combats, party building, equipment, tricks, secrets, hidden caches. And one special quote for the world filling density exceptionally high for a RPG with that much content.

Last focus, the blue print, first person view and party front to front turn based combats is no way used in modern RPG but by very few. It's the first of this sub genre that seriously modernised this blue print, this is impressive, even if some aspects would benefit of some improvement.
 
Dorok

⣿⣿⣿⣭⣿⣿⣿⣧⢸⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠈⢸⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿
⣿⣿⣿⣼⣿⣿⣿⣽⠘⡄⠄⠄⠄⠄⢀⠸⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿

Recommandé
71.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2021
I enjoyed this game a lot, but I ended up feeling disappointed at what a terrible lost opportunity it was. It does so many things so well -- great story, world building, characters, voice acting, music, locations, interesting party building mechanics, etc. -- and it's certainly a good game I'm glad I played and I recommend. But it sucks that it seems to have had all the ingredients to have maybe ranked among the all-time RPG classics along with the likes of Baldur's Gate 2 or Planescape Torment or Wizardry 8 but absolutely terrible design decisions reduce it to just being a good game.

Worst misfires by far are the many puzzles. I strongly dislike puzzle games. I don't want to play a puzzle game. But Bard's Tale IV unfortunately is in part a puzzle game smashed uncomfortably into an RPG. There are repeated episodes of just the worst kind of annoying puzzles I hate. Many sliding block puzzles. Many absolutely ridiculous things where you've got to set up basically an electricity circuit to open a door by turning dozens of connectors across large areas. Repeated annoying thing they call "fairie golf" where you have to set up just right a series of blocks to give directions to a spot of light to guide it to a door opener. Thankfully the director's cut at least lets you skip some just totally pointless puzzles that prevent you from even opening many doors without doing a gears puzzle thing. For the rest, I usually tried them out for maybe five, then minutes max and if it wasn't clicking for me then just went to the guidebook that comes with the director's cut or youtube, where it wasn't hard to find solutions mostly. Some of the electricity connector things (it's actually blood I guess, but functionally it was basically just an electric circuit you were trying to complete) were so ridiculously convoluted and spread out, though, and hard to get a sense of as a whole from within one area of view that I struggled for a while to complete them even consulting walkthroughs and the guide book included with the director's cut extras. Some of them I looked at the completed diagram in the guidebook zoomed all the way out from a topdown view and couldn'teven begin to make sense of it from the first person perspective of my party. It was so frustrating and annoying at times, and I really wish the game didn't have those parts.

Second thing I wish the game didn't do was restrict the combat abilities so much. By the end character levels, you could have maybe as many as ten or so solid attack options unlocked and potentially available for your character plus various potions and other boosts you can equip. But the game restricts you to choosing a load out of only 4 at a time. So after the first few levels, every time I leveled up, I was like "well this new ability I unlocked looks pretty cool, but there's no way I can replace the essential ones I've already got in my loadout, so I will never, ever use it." I mean maybe I'm just a badly deficient tactician, but, say, for a fighter, I felt all three of them that I used absolutely had to have taunt, which lets you move enemies into your attack column so you can actually attack them, and rend armor, since every battle after the early levels has enemies with high armor that has to be stripped off before they can be damaged effectively. So that's 2/4 slots permanently locked up, leaving only 2 other options, which then pretty much have to be variations of basic attacks. Same for my bow wielding rogue. I can't see any possible reasonable alternative to having razor strop (which boosts damage), hide in shadows (essential outside combat for letting your party attack first in fights), loose arrow, and rain of arrows. That's it, all I used the whole game, and I got those abilities quite early on and then ignored every other unlock and tried to only go for passive boosts when available in level up. My mage had one slot always locked up by an ability that allows you to generate spell points, so I had only 3 other options or I don't know how many spells were potentially available. It just feels like the combat could have been so much richer than it was without the 4 ability at a time restriction.
 
Mr. Lambert
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
59.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2023
I’m of two minds when it comes to this game. On the one hand, it gets a lot right. The story is intriguing the characters are fun to hang around with, for the most part. And depending on who you have in your party, they will talk to each other with conversations that do last for a while. There’s even this great bit before the loading screen where you see a bard telling your tale to a group of listeners and if you’ve played the original games you will recognize the image from the manual. It’s a wonderful touch.

On the other hand, the economy is terrible. You will spend the first third of the game with not enough money to buy the gear that’s on sale. It’s so bad that I thought I was doing something wrong. Then, you will spend the middle third with more money than you can deal with, because you got enough good gear that there’s not really you need to buy. Then you will spend the final third throwing away all of the gear you do find, because you are the only one who buys or sells goods, so all of the vendors have run out of money. It terrible. The gear available should be based on what part of the main quest you are on, so that there’s always something to buy, and every time the gear changes, the vendors should have their money refreshed and increased so they can buy what you are selling.

Also, back up your save files before heading out for the final mission. There are achievements for beating the game with a full party and with just three characters. I thought you would get both achievements if you saves the game with just three characters, but I was wrong.

This could be a fantastic RPG, but the economy is super frustrating early on. Just remember it’s the game and not you and you should be okay.
 
Brother Alpha
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
121.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2023
The concept is good but there are some brutal bugs or poorly thought out ideas that _really_ ruin the experience. Fog of war constantly getting reset on maps is the biggest one, making navigation needlessly frustrating. A specific item is required to upgrade the majority of weapons, yet it's one of the rarest to find. But you don't know that ahead of time so if you blow them all in early weapons you can't upgrade later ones. The maps and legends are half-baked, so unless you're taking copious notes when you find things, you'll struggle to find them again.
 
ilsa
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2023
Jezu Chryste, jestem masochistą, ale chyba nie aż takim, by chcieć skończyć The Bard's Tale IV. Brian Fargo to człowiek legenda. Odpowiada za tyle wspaniałych serii gier (Fallout, Wasteland, Castles i oczywiście The Bard's Tale), że jak tylko pojawiła się informacja o tym, iż planuje wskrzesić serię The Bard's Tale, to Internet zawrzał, a wielu fanów (w tym ja) zacierało ręce, by udało mu się dostarczyć produkt na miarę poprzednich części. Czas mijał, a zewsząd dochodziły głosy o problemach z działaniem gry. Obawy graczy potwierdziły się, gdy gra wyszła w stanie gorzej, niż tragicznym - pełna bugów, problemów z działaniem, crashami i wyciekiem danych, co zmuszało graczy do resetowania gry, by ta w ogóle chciała działać w znośnej ilości klatek. Jednakże co cierpliwsi gracze zgodnie przyznali, że gra może jest pełna problemów technicznych, ale fabularnie jest na wysokim poziomie. Chciałbym spotykać tych ludzi i zapytać się ich czy nie doznali udaru te kilka lat temu resetując grę po kilkanaście razy na każde posiedzenie, bo ta gra jest absolutnie tragiczna pod względem opowieści, walki i tempa.

"Gra jest na około 50 godzin, ty przegrałeś raptem 6 godzin, więc co możesz wiedzieć o fabule?" - ironicznie zadaję to pytanie, zanim ktoś się pokusi o ten krok. Przegrałem tylko 6 godzin, bo fizycznie bym chyba w kaftanie skończył jakbym miał spędzić przy niej jeszcze 45 godzin. Jeśli gra nie potrafi mnie, fana serii, zachęcić do siebie przez pierwsze kilka godzin, to problemem nie są moje oczekiwania i brak chęci, a sama gra. Nie wiem co Brian odje*ał tworząc czwartą część The Bard's Tale, ale ten początek to jest na miarę latynoskiej telenoweli. Dochodzi do zdrady Gildii, ataku na jej siedzibę i gracz wraz z kilkoma członkami Gildii ucieka z zasadzki, by dowiedzieć się całej prawdy o ataku. Problem polega na tym, że o tym kto zaatakował, po co, jak to zrobił i czemu akurat w tym momencie gracz dowiaduje się w pierwszej godzinie rozgrywki. I to nie jest żart. Serio ta gra dosłownie całą intrygę wyjaśnia w godzinę, a potem to już tylko bieganie z punktu A do B, parę idiotycznie wykonanych walk i kilka rozmów ze źle napisanymi bohaterami. Poprzednie części były pełne sarkastycznego humoru, wspaniale napisanych dialogów i towarzyszy, których szło polubić. Nie zostało z tego nic. Dosłownie nic. Trzeba się oszukiwać, że Brianowi udało się stworzyć godną poprzedniczek kontynuację albo być zwyczajnie głupim fanatykiem dungeon crawlerów. Szczerze? Nie chce mi się nawet pisać o tej grze. A osoba, która wpadła na to, że walka będzie realizowana w oparciu o te nieczytelne pola i umiejętności, które nie wiadomo jaki mają zasięg, póki się ich nie użyje, powinna przeprosić, a potem odbyć karę w postaci przejścia tego odpadu growego, by zrozumieć jak bardzo istotne w dungeon crawlerze jest zrobienie dobrego systemu walki.
 
Podkowa

Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2023
Good game for amateurs of old school grid-based, turn based games. Not great however. It provides some amusement but story felt like I should just discard it completely and play. My major point of complaint is the lack of diversity in abilities, weapons/armors and enemies. I tried diversifying and using different abilities but I found some are just totally useless. I ended up using the same skills in all battles, whether its a boss or not. Quite redundant. However, options are thin for updated games of this genre and this is greatly appreciated. I had fun nonetheless.

0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
90.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2023
I really enjoyed this game. I'll admit to being a bit leery of all of the puzzles, but only a couple were obnoxious, and the rest of the gameplay was highly entertaining. The music was great and often haunting, with its Celtic themes, the combat was pretty well balanced, the voice acting fun (especially the Bards - "Stand back, I'm drinkin'!" - never got old for me), and the artwork was gorgeous. I liked the ability to change the difficulty on the fly if you got stuck in an area or in a boss fight; I've been playing PC games for decades (as a matter of fact, I played the original "Bard's Tale" on my Amiga 500), and life is too short to waste time re-loading fights after multiple party wipes. If that's your thing, have at it, but I have to say, the ability to set the difficulty to "easy" after a couple of attempts decreases the frustration and increases the enjoyment for me, at least. I also appreciated the ability to re-spec your characters at any time, and try different skills. Crafting was well-integrated, also. On the downside, the Elven weapons were pretty underwhelming, the loot drops frequently not worth the effort, and some of the missions a bit grindy. But overall, fun times!
 
Tymmicus
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
117.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2023
Finally beat The Bard's Tale IV, and it was a worthwhile experience. The music is excellent and a joy to listen to. The game has numerous puzzles; things ranging from pressure plates, gears, and riddles. Combat has plenty of variety to build your favorite team of 6, with a plethora of skills to choose from between the 4 classes. The story is typical RPG fare: nothing outstanding here. Story is just enough to explain why you have to go to the various locations. Finally even though its an older game, the locations were often awe inspiring. The level design was great and really captured the imagination.

If you have fond memories of the old DOS Bard's Tale games, this modern interpretation really scratched the itch. If you are looking for a casual RPG with a different style of combat (kind of a mashup of JRPG and Western RPG mechanics), then this may be a good fit for you.

Recommandé
75.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2023
4/5, but only for those, who remember old-fashion RPG games.

Fights
Imagine wall-on-wall combat, like in Disciples, but with much higher variability. Combinations of damage-dealing and supporting abilities aren't mind-blowing, but good enough to build more interesting tactics, than straightforward face-kicking.

Puzzles
Here, they are a native part of storytelling. Prepare to spend a third of playtime solving riddles and pushing cogs. Yet, if you aren't in the mood to do some brainwork, no one forbids you to look for solution in the internet or even use a legal in-game cheat to bypass puzzles.

Optimization
It could be better. Video quality does not impress, yet it squeezes maximum from my 3070ti (yes, 3440x1440, but it's not an excuse). Bad thing, that noise from fans prevents to enjoy music without headphones :(

Bugs
Some of them are still here, but not such, that may prevent from doing quests or defeat a boss.
 
Python
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
56.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 février 2023
I can't review this game objectively because the soundtrack is incredible. InXile *really* took this soundtrack seriously. It sounds hauntingly alien, from a pre-Christian world lost in time, and creates a better sense of place than anything in the game.

So as I said, I can't judge the game objectively because the entire game sits on the mighty shoulders of this soundtrack. Even if the game were crap, it would still be amazing. (I don't actually think the game's crap, fortunately)

Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2023
I absolutely love this game....yes it has some bugs still (Director's cut fixed a lot but not all)....but the story...the adventure..the beauty of the environment...and THE SOUNDTRACK!!! Absolutely love it...sure you can nit pick it to death if you want like ANY game but the sum is so much greater than it's flaws. Please more games like this.

Over 100 hours in game between beating the main campaign and just messing around in game and I still haven't had any game crashes... I have had some glitches and bugs that have made me reload...yes the game has flaws but nothing I have run in to has been even close to being bad enough to make me want to quit. The fun far outweighs the bugs in my opinion.

If in doubt grab it on sale. It's definitely worth it, I would recommend getting the version with the soundtrack or check out the soundtrack online...it's very good.

Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2022
I played the original Bards Tale on Commodore 64. In the 1980s. So I jumped at the opportunity to crowd fund this game. Brutal combat and puzzles. Thank god for Lord Fenton to get me through some of them. Namely Mad god and Destiny wand Puzzles. Would have been impossible to me without his help. Graphics and game play are awesome! Finished this game 100 percent. So much nostalgia walking around Skara Brae in Unreal 4 game engine. Technology has come a long way since 1985. Beware Heron Hold end is brutal! I love the remake of Bards Tale. I highly recommend this game old school!! Lord Fenton needs to slow down his puzzle videos on Youtube. I restarted puzzles a lot. Because I lost track of where I was lol. Game released a little buggy. Since it was patched game runs like a dream! Get this game!

Recommandé
117.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 décembre 2022
Na wstępie zaznaczę, że nie jest to recenzja. Prędzej zbiór myśli na świeżo bezpośrednio po ukończeniu gry. Z tą produkcją miałem trudny wstęp. Początkowe lokacje bardziej mnie zniechęciły, niż zachęciły do dalszej podróży/eksploracji, ażeby wgryźć się dalej w fabułę. Miałem sporo przerw i powrotów, przy czym ostatecznie dałem grze szanse...i całe szczęście, że tak się stało. Bo im dalej w las tym jest tylko lepiej. Piękne lokacje pomimo specyficznej grafiki mnie absolutnie w tego typu grach nie przeszkadzała, mnóstwo przeplatających się łatwych i mocno złożonych zagadek, które w mojej ocenie są świetnie zbilansowane, sporo potyczek, gdzie możemy sobie pozwolić na różny rozwój naszych postaci do tego mnogość przedmiotów. Domyślam się, że spora część odbije się od tego tytułu, jak od ściany, ale jeśli tak samo jak ja dadzą jej szanse lubiąc zagadki przeplatające się z walką turową jednocześnie grające wcześniej w dungeon crawlery to będą zadowolone. Ja na pewno z czystym sumieniem mogę polecić tę grę. Kapitalna muzyka, która ciągle nam towarzyszy i świetnie wpisuje się w całokształt. Gra na tyle mnie pochłonęła, że zrobiłem platyne. Z pewnością jest to specyficzny tytuł, ale naprawdę szczerze polecam, gdyż warto dać mu szansę. Brian Fargo po raz kolejny udowodnił, że warto było mu zaufać i wywiązał się kapitalnie z założonych celów na Kickstarterze.

Recommandé
84.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2022
After playing the Bard's Tale Trilohgy in one go, this game is a great successor and a true gem. Everything is lovely arranged with lots of details. The world feels alive, the combat system is fun, the riddles... well, not as bad as the first 3 games where you had to write down every note and every dialogue - it's way different than that with a modern take on how to solve them - it's just.. too many for my taste. Nonetheless, they all make sense and are challenging at times.

This game is badly underrated and deserves so much more attention. After spending 70 hours to go through, I feel sad, now that it ended. I could play this for ages if only there were DLC storys or mods.

Fun: 10/10

Recommandé
100.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 septembre 2022
This is an awesome game. It combines both worlds - the good old Bard's Tale story (you will meet Sinister Street again, and 396 Berserkers :-) etc.) with today's graphics and sound. I enjoyed the atmosphere with the many Gaelic songs (and of course the original tunes are also present).
The combat system is interesting. It is round-based, and you have action points for the whole party. So it is possible that someone in the party acts twice while others do nothing.
Overall I played 70 hours to complete the game (with all side quests and most of the hidden treasures). I recommend it very much.
 
gophel
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
42.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2022
Finally found time to play this game, absolutely fantastic addition to the franchise! It's a must play for old school dungeon crawler fans. Music, combat and story are simply nostalgic and well-executed.

I would however just pinpoint some issues:
1. Graphics could in general use some work to be better.
2. Game suffers a weak prologue partly due to the ugly models and optimization issues (really low frame rates in the city as well as many areas), it really takes time for some players to get used to such graphics in 2022, I guess it was already an issue back in 2019 as I could not even bear it upon its release.
3. Difficulty does not exist. I finished the game with hard difficulty and since the mid-game I basically have not encountered any challenging battle, my team could simply grind through the game, the final boss Yadis took me only 5 minutes without causing any damage to the team. Puzzles are nice and well-balanced but some are quite annoying.
4. Similarly, character development stops at around 80% of the story (if you occasionally do side quests) as you are close to lv25 (I finsihed the game at lv27), you can possibly struggle at economy but it swiftly goes away after the mid-game, there isn't really not much to explore or "grind" around the last quarter of the game, which is okayish.
5. The mini-map quest-tracking system is very confusing and does not work well.

I will give it a solid 7.5/10.

Yannimal
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
104.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2022
This is the game that Might & Magic IX was trying to be.

It's got lots of references to the original trilogy, but it feels like a cross between the 2000s reboot and MM9: the look, the size of the towns, skill trees... Only unlike MM9, it feels like the world has been filled in more thoroughly. And the Director's Cut fixes a lot of bugs and polishes a lot of the rough edges.

The world-building is detailed, drawing from history along with classic fantasy tropes. Each area feels distinct, but part of the same world. Characters who join your party will sometimes have conversations with each other, and some get along better than others – for personal reasons and for cultural reasons. On the downside, the NPCs are oddly static, sticking around in one spot with very limited conversations.

The game mostly takes itself seriously as a story of corruption creeping across the world. Your band of adventurers are trying to reverse it where they can and stave it off where they can't. But there are comedic bits scattered around that feel a bit like the reboot.

The early part of the game does feel like you're being railroaded, but the Skara Brae underground isn't as linear as it appears at first, and by the time you get out of the city, you have a lot more freedom of movement and a lot more side quests. (I like to explore everything and do all the side quests anyway, but at least I could choose what order to do things in!)

Combat is turn-based, and the enemies tend to level up just a bit faster than your characters, so it's very much about strategy rather than reflexes or just getting more powerful equipment. And the leveling system has a lot more skills and branches than can possibly be learned in a single play-through, so you really need to think about how you level up each character and put together skills that complement each other.

It's not just combat and exploration, of course: there are puzzles too. Most of them boil down to a few basic templates, though: moving gears around to activate/deactivate a mechanism, pushing large stones to clear a path or activate switches, bells that need to be rung in the right order, magic conduits that you have to arrange like circuits...and “fairy golf,” where you change direction signs so that fairies will fly around obstacles and end up where you need them to be. They get more complicated over the course of the game, with stones whose movements are linked, or have specific runes that need to match, etc.

One of the odd things is that shops aren't sources and sinks. They have a specific inventory and money just like you do. That means you can't just sell all your extra items to the same shopkeeper, because they'll run out of space or money! More importantly, there's a finite amount of items in the game. Including crafting ingredients. As you approach the end of the game, you have to start rationing items like you did at the beginning, not because you haven't found enough yet, but because they're running out!

I still listen to the soundtrack from time to time. They went for a Celtic/Scottish sound, trying to fit with the various human cultures in the game. Sometimes it's just background, but other times NPCs will sing in taverns, and you can choose how long to listen. And they aren't just atmosphere. They actually figure into the story and game play. There are lyrics that give you clues, melodies you need to remember and play (they do have sheet music for these that you can find, so if you can't hear it yourself, you can still match it visibly). Some of the songs are about the events of the earlier games as remembered a century or so later.
 
Insidious Root Beer
62 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
63.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2022
I'm so glad I grabbed this during the sales.

I've been playing it for a week solid and I've enjoyed it immensely. There's a good mix of combat, puzzle solving, questing, talking to people and exploring all rolled into one. The comments and songs are funny, haunting and entertaining.

Great RPG components and the urge to unlock everything in the tree for each class is overwhelming. But at the end of the day you don't have to tick all the boxes with this one, you can totally just run through and enjoy it for what it is. A good yarn, some slashy slashy and some lulz comments and possible jumps when you come face to face with things you weren't expecting!
 
Sevalisa
399 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
131.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2022
After 100 hours here are my thoughts:

The Good
-Creating/customizing/outfitting/leveling your party is pretty fun. If you liked the old Might and Magic games or games like Legend of Grimrock you will really enjoy it.
-Combat on 'hard' can be difficult. But this is balanced by a wide range of synergistic weapons and skills, the power of which is not always immediately obvious. You will encounter fights where your initial thought will be "How the hell will I ever beat this." The game allows you to take on fights you are vastly underleveled for, but usually rewards you well for finding a way to win.
-The environment is full of details and secret areas. Exploration and backtracking pays off.
-Most of the puzzles are pretty satisfying to solve. But be ready for a LOT of them. Like literally almost every room you enter.

The Bad
-Poorly optimized and demanding on graphics card. I am playing this on a GeForce GTX 1060 and the game runs ok on Ultra but is extremely demanding. There is minimal performance gained for me by turning the settings all the way down to "Low", which seems ridiculous.
-Incomplete content. Most notably the Dwarven Ruins under the Elven village, where there are indications of cut quest lines. Some of the Elven weapons seem half-baked. Many are obsolete by the time you fully unlock them unless you are running very particular builds. There are shrines that do not seem to be associated with any Elven weapon at all, which is annoying.
-Occasional crashes and bugs. Game duped a couple of my weapons and did wacky things with my skills at points, but nothing game breaking.

Verdict
Recommended if you like turn-based tactical RPGs and can tolerate the poor optimization.
 
Chubby ol' groundhog

the character & monster design and overall mythology, and the story is pretty good

Definitely recommend, specially if you like a puzzle heavy dungeon crawler. or turn based

Fantastic reimagining of a classic series. I'm a huge fan of the originals especially the Bard's Tale Construction Kit. This really brings me back to those older games, with lots of modern improvements. Definitely not the same old game. The combat is a lot of fun and feels like your solving puzzles, while somehow still feeling like combat. The party banter is entertaining and the story has lots of throw backs to the original stories. Overall loving this game!

HitL3monChan
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
174.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2022
zacznijmy od tego że jeżeli to jest directors cut, to znaczy że director był pijany. Nie grałem w wersje podstawową, ale ta gra jest jedną z gorzej zbalansowanych w jakie w życiu grałem, no chyba że zbalansowanie tu polega na tym, że łazi się po mapie żeby znaleźć przeciwników do bitki, bo to jedyny sposób na to żeby levelować, poza robieniem misji. Są jeszcze totemy które dają doświadczenie, ale jest ich tak mało, i dają tak mało, że jest to pomijalne. Należy dodać też że przeciwnicy się nie respawnują (choć są wyjątki), więc nie jest tak że jak nie możecie przejść jakiegoś etapu, to pobiegacie sobie po mapie i nabijecie doświadczenie.

Gra sprawia wrażenie że była pretekstem do zebrania piosenek, żeby ludzie sobie mogli posłuchać jakie te celtyckie dzwięki są śliczne, no i czasem są, czasem nie są. Są niektóre naprawdę piękne, nie mam pojęcia czy to są autorskie kompozycje, czy też jakieś oryginalne pieśni sprzed setek lat, ale sprawiają wrażenie jakby były stare, szczególnie te które nie są zbytnio przearanżowane. Najgorsza (moim zdaniem) jest... piosenka tytułowa, za każdym razem gdy wchodziłem do menu uciekałem z niego jak najszybciej, bo zbyt blisko to leży szant żeby mi uszy nie więdły. Niemniej, muzyka i dzwięki to jest coś co w grze błyszczy, nie tylko dlatego że reszta jest tak dziwna jakościowo. Czemu dziwna? Bo gdy się rozbiera na części pierwsze i ocenia jakieś rzeczy jako osobne byty, to nie jest to w większości źle wykonana robota. Przykładowo, gdy wreszcie wychodzimy z podziemi pod miastem i możemy przejść po lesie, to widać że ktoś tam miał zamysł kolorystyczny, to się wszystko naprwadę ładnie komponuje gdy bardzo rozmyjemy obraz. Ale jak już wejdziemy na poziom wyżej z detalem wychodzą meshe o bardzo wątpliwej jakości, masa niedoróbek, generalnie, sprawia to wszystko wrażenie plastikowe, mimo że z tego wszystkiego można wyłuskać dużo dobrze zrobionych elementów, to te źle zrobione psują kompletnie wrażenie.
Tak samo gdy przyjrzymy się jak są zrobione ściany, to naprawdę robi się przykro, parę wyciągniętych vertexów robi za wypukłość kamieni, niestety to widać. Takich rzeczy jest mnóstwo, gdzie rzeczy do których się ktoś przyłożył stoją obok tych naprawdę byle jakich. Wygląda to trochę tak, jakby ktoś narobił concept artów, a potem to wszystko zostało rozesłane do ousource houseów o pełnym spektrum jakości, od totalnych amatorów, do solidnych rzemieślników, nikt tego nie zatwierdzał, bo nie było czasu. To że tego nikt nie zatwierdzał może dowodzić fakt, że gra ma koszmarne problemy wydajnościowe. Żeby gra sprzed kilku lat rozpędzała wentylatory na RTX jak nie rozpędzały gry które używają raytracingu, to już trzeba fachowca. Najzabawniejsze jest to, że najbardziej dusi w menu. To jest jakiś ewidentny błąd w kodzie.
Z dobrych rzeczy, system walki mimo wszystko jest ciekawy i dość elastyczny, choć często gdy wam się nie uda odpowiednio szybko kliknąć na początku żeby zaczynać walkę, to możecie już od razu do odczytania wcześniejszego zapisu. Co przypomina mi też o koszmarnym systemie zapisu, takiego pokraka to świat nie widział. Nie ma możliwości zapisu w dowolnym momencie(jest na to hack, ale nie zawsze działa), trzeba to robić w totemach, ale te totemy w 9/10 przypadków działają raz, żeby zapisać w tym miejscu znowu, musicie iść do innego totemu, zapisać tam, potem wrócić do poprzedniego. Napisałem że działa w 9/10 przypadków, bo są totemy które pozwalają zapisać dowolną ilość razy, bez "restartu". Można to obejść wychodząc z gry, wtedy gra zapisze tam gdzie stoicie, aaaale czasem to nie działa.
To naprawdę zaskakujące że studio z tak wielkim doświadczeniem, zrobiło grę tak brzydką i tak... dziwną, która jednak, gdy dacie jej szansę, wciąga. Pisząc "dacie jej szansę mówię o początku gry", który też jest fatalny, z jednej strony nie wiecie o co chodzi, z drugiej jakieś gadanie o rzeczach o których nie macie pojęcia, przekładane ścianą tutoriali z których nic nie zapamiętacie, potem jest kawałek walki, i milion osób z którymi trzeba porozmawiać, bo dają misję, jak przez to przebrniecie, potem będzie tylko lepiej. Poza rzeczami które wymieniłem, a nie wymieniłem wszystkiego :)

+muzyka
-kod i wydajność
-bardzo nierówna grafika
-balans rozgrywki
-fatalny, nielogiczny system zapisu
-równie fatalne inventory bez jakiegokolwiek "schowka" w bazie (jeżeli za bazę uznać knajpę gilidii

Ale mimo wszystko, warto, gra ma swój charakter, wbrew pozorom jakie daje na początku.
 
Rorque
3,165 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
124.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2021
I've been playing the Bards Tale games since I was a kid in the 80s, and they are some of the greatest games ever, in my opinion. Even 30 years later, these games are still fun. That being said, there was a terrible reboot in the early 00s, and I have really been looking forward to playing Barrows Deep, which was billed as a true successor to the original series. At first glance, I was somewhat disappointed by the fact that you no longer start the game with a full roster, or have much freedom in character creation. Also, the heavy use of the Scottish accents for every character is somewhat annoying. However, as I have played on further, it is actually quite a good game and does bring back a lot of the elements that made the originals so great. The music and combat are very well done, and the quests and character dialog are entertaining. I am enjoying it very much. I would like to see more character customization options from the start, and actual graphic representation of the characters such as in Dark Souls. The graphics and atmosphere are great for the story, although I did run into some glitches in gameplay- stutter, mainly. That being said, it is a good addition to the series. I hope they will develop another one in the future, with some further refinement. This game deserves applause for bringing a true classic RpG into the 21st century, and preserving much of the original spirit. However, they did make the combat and leveling considerably easier(too easy!), and the fact that characters automatically resurrect after each battle is kind of weak. The original games weren't pulling any punches, and made you work for every step. Again, o do like this game, just giving some constructive criticism. Thanks, Inexile, I hope you keep the franchise going. Bard for life!
 
jacobschmid
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Been a while since I played it but the game is great! The graphics are not that good but the gameplay is fun and the tactic part can be very challenging later on. The music is just awesome and the story is cool. Also quite some nice puzzles (some very frustrating though, had to google!)

Anyway, a cool game with a massive environment and a chance to kill a lot of time, worth every coin.

Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2021
The Bard's Tale IV Directors Cut is ~Absolutely BreathTaking~ !

The atmosphere is Gothic, Rich in Spooky Surprises (I'm not even joking XD), Suspenseful (Wut' Rabbie said 'doh! k3) and Full to the Brim with swirling Mystery!

The worldspace is ***MASSIVE***!
A twisting maze of bombed out neighborhoods, Necropolis', Ancient-Royal Palaces and Mall-Sized Marketplaces!

Secret Treasures (*~Masterfully Devious ^.~ ~ *), and enough Easter Eggs to sooth ones tattered soul *Swoons*

The comedy (especially the item descriptions .. BwaHahahahahaha! xD)

The voice acting is sweet, adorable, and endearing ILY k3

The Musical Soundtrack is Amazing!

And .. The Choir / acapella-Toung-Twisting-Chanters / and The everyday Citizens merely humming an inspiring tune are ~Oh my gawd .. I think Im'ma Die! .. Magnificent!~ .. The one with the Whispers? .. *Officially Dies* .. HAUNTING! ,,,(Oo),,,*

I played the Original The Bard's Tale (Nintendo Entertainment System, That my Uncle still has ~^.^~).

I am so grateful to have been invited to partake in this Thrilling Universe and Breathlessly Await Our next Adventure!

Long Live The Bard's Tale!

~Chrystia
oxoxo

The First Two Thugs RE-SPAWN! *Detailed Instructions: Save Game at Luck Stone - Transmute the 2 wanna-be's into Monster Kibble - (((IMPORTANT PART ---> ))) .. Forget to grab the 'Cutthroat Dragon's Bile Bomb' .. Run back to Save .. Save (oO) .. RE-LOAD GAME (This is the happy accident part), And the Thugs will res-pawn!!!!!!!

*You MIGHT have to re-load a few times*

They have dropped Sugar, Grain, Lock-pics, Trow-Squeezin's, Wood, Water, Misc. Armor and Weapons, And Gold!!!!!!!!!!!!! k3 k3 k3

I am with Melody so it is Pure Gravy! ~*.*~

P.S. Sorry for Typos / Bad Grammar.

I PHREAKIN' LOVE YOU ALL!

~kluvyabuhbye~

Kernspalter
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
73.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2021
Es un juego de puzzle ♥♥♥ combates que me recuerda mucho al sistema de D&D.
Aspectos positivos:
- Los puzzles eran entretenidos, tenían su dificultad pero no llegaran a ser frustrantes.
- El sistema de combate. Simple pero basado mucho en estrategia.
- Los diálogos de los personajes. Los miembros de tu equipo interactuaban entre ellos.
- Las escenarios y ambientación. El equipo de arte se lució.

Aspectos negativos:
- La historia es genérica y olvidable.
- Hubiese deseado mas variedad de puzzles.
- Es muy lineal, por lo que no sentí que tuviese finales alternativos.
- No hay muchas formas de construir tus personajes.
- Sumado a lo anterior, no había incentivo a experimentar combos, una vez que armabas un equipo podías pasarte todo el juego ♥♥♥ él.
 
kegdelpo2
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
63.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 septembre 2021
The Bard's Tale IV riprende il tipo di gameplay direttamente da la trilogia classica aggiungendoci un comparto grafico avanzato e concentrandosi molto sull'aspetto musicale del gioco, ma andiamo ♥♥♥ ordine. Questo titolo è un dungeon crawler classico come i suoi predecessori. Durante tutta la campagna avremo riferimenti ai capitoli classici della saga come ad esempio le armi e i nemici. I puzzle non sono il massimo ma vanno bene per l'atmosfera tranquilla ♥♥♥ cui assaporare il titolo. Il punto forte del gioco è la colonna sonora. Estremamente curata e in linea ♥♥♥ i vari ambienti che visiteremo. In molti luoghi troveremo npc che lavorano mentre cantano e sarà un piacere rimanere a guardarli. Come i suoi predecessori è possibile crearsi il proprio personaggio e avere la propria squadra in giro per la campagna anche se in alcuni punti saremo costretti a usare determinati componenti nella nostra squadra. Il combat system è classico da dungeon crawler ♥♥♥ due righe in cui disporre i tuoi uomini (o donne) per far fronte ai nemici anche loro disposti su 2 righe. Ho amato questo gioco per l'atmosfera che riusciva a creare oltre a tutti i riferimenti e battute sparse per la campagna. Non è di certo il miglior gioco del suo genere ma saprà regalare ottime soddisfazioni.
 
OnyOscuro

CyberStingray
18 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
142.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2021
Оценка: 8.5/10

Замечательно.
Одна из немногих игр, в которые надо играть, а не смотреть и-или собирать электронный мусор. Путешествие, приключения, загадки, и сражения, выстроенные с одной лишь целью, дойти до конца и победить, как в старые добрые времена, когда игры были играми, а не тупыми ААА побегушками от одной указанной на карте точки до другой с подчас проложенными маршрутами. Нет особо подсказок, нет отмеченных на карте сундуков и “секретов”, никуда не нужно забираться, чтобы нужные предметы, растения, персонажи “вдруг” появились на карте, это вызывает уважение к разрабам и благодарность за то, что тебя не считают идиотом. Ты и только твоё приключение, и твоё путешествие. Эх, этой бы игре шикарную графику, нормальную физику окружающего мира, достойную анимацию персонажей …….., а не то убожество, которое видишь на экране …….
 
UnKidreal
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2021
Classic RPG dungeon crawler immensely improved in a 3D semi-open world! If you are a fan of the "Bard's Tale Trilogy", then you are going to really enjoy the puns and poking at other CRPG games from that era, vivid fond memories of the '80s and '90s games, it'll bring back your childhood, at least the video gaming aspects.
The immersive music and story line are great, well done inXile, kudos to them, you can tell that there is a lot of love crafted into this cult classic game. Thanks.
 
Vegas Doc
1,004 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
41.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2021
Я ленивый игрок, эндорфино-дофаминовый наркоман и прочее-прочее. Помните об этом, читая отзыв.

Первый запуск вызвал у меня какие-то неприятные эмоции. Закрытые локации, устаревшая графика и старый добрый сюжет. Скукота-то какая. Особенно меня огорчили закрытые локации (да, я читала описание игры через строчку). И это, кстати, аукнется мне позднее.

Но я дала игре второй шанс и неожиданно втянулась. Игра немного раскачалась. Симпатичная боевая система, квесты (пусть и ускользающе мало), прокачечка родная, шмотки. Всё, как надо.

Но вот сегодня я ощутила то, чего не чувствовала давно - игра меня выбесила. Вот прям, как в старые-добрые времена.
Что же в этой игре для меня не так:
1. Закрытые локации, невнятные карты, лабиринтовая система, похожие друг на друга коридоры. Я не хочу в игре полчаса искать нужный поворот. При этом, я тот человек, который играл в Морровинд и прошёл его. Без указателей и прочего говна. Но там открытый мир. Не нашёл нужное место, пошёл дальше, а не кружишь полчаса в поиске места, а потом полчаса, чтобы найти дорогу назад (и утрирования тут не то чтобы сильно много).
2. Простые и сложные головоломки. Одни головоломки слишком просты. Другие нерешаемы без помощи из вне. Система подношений, для которой нужна а) книжка с расшифровками и б)программа или кружок этот вырезанный из бумаги, вообще без комментариев. Читала чей-то комментарий, что это отсылка к лору и не обязательно к исполнению. Но я хочу получить весь контент, за который уплачено. Квест "Кости Менгара" сломал последние остатки сопротивления. Я не понимат, как в это играт...
3. Слишком простые бои. Без комментариев.
4. Отсутствие реальной тактики. Одна победная связка, которая нужна, чтобы тащить любой бой.

И при этом я ставлю игре плюс.
Потому что несмотря на все это, игру хочется завершить.
И злит меня, что кактус колется, но он вкусный.

Берите, если вы умный, упорный и у вас хорошо с топографией))
Мне пока требуется передышка
 
Zloe Poleno
0
