chocola2
1,112 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
116.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2021
Surely a tough one to come up with a sequel after such a long time but I think the guys did a more than decent job in doing so. There are obviously tons of differences to our favs from the 80s but unless you are prepared to build something which is straight-out appalling to anyone born after 1985 I think most of them are acceptable. I would have hoped for stronger character improvement when levelling up (esp. automatically gaining HP) and an easier and full/correct implementation of the old BT songs. Also coming from fighting madness where basically every 2nd step was a new encounter to quite few and strategic battles took time to adjust. However I do got back the just-another-room or just-this-one-more-battle feeling. The riddle density is a big plus and also originality-wise remarkable (e.g. stone-pushing on floor and ceiling). Paired up with nice story references to the past I am truly enjoying the ride.
 
rakshasa
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
69.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2021
Dobra gra. Co prawda z początku odstraszała mnie grafika (w tym wygląd niektórych postaci), chociaż przyznać muszę, że pare lokacji wygląda bardzo ładnie i w sumie grafika mi się podobała. Muzyka to jest osobny temat, widać napracowanie nad tym elementem. Jedyną wadą gry jest za dużo zagadek, ale jak ktoś lubi łamigłówki to jest wniebowzięty. Na szczęście twórcy dali możliwość ominięcia większości upierdliwych zagadek, jest to jakby granie na cheatach, ale to nie przeszkadza. Największa zaleta gry to walki i tych jest na prawdę sporo. Podsumowując gra się bardzo przyjemnie. Grę porównuje z Might and Magic X, bo jest dosyć podobna i według mnie jest od niej nawet lepsza.
Wspomnieć trzeba, że jest trochę błędów, ale żaden nie utrudniał gry jakoś za bardzo.
Jak ktoś lubi RPG to powinien spróbować. I nie zniechęcać się początkiem, gra się z czasem rozkręca.

Bl4cKj4cK21
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
46.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2021
A little rough around the edges but a fantastic and immersive turn based RPG. There are only 4 classes to start, but you can spec them differently for a bit more variety. There aren't random encounters, as you can see all the enemies, and their power level, and they do not respawn for the most part so there's no grinding. Some of the encounters can be a pain even on easy, and in some cases you will need to choose your battles carefully. There are lots of little puzzles which are generally pretty simple but fun and there are lots of hidden secrets. I hope they make a sequel to this.
 
Chronic Games
1,905 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
31.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 avril 2021
Gladly I got this one on sale. As a fan of the series, being memorable games for me in the early 90ies, I was rather curious about what it‘s gonna be:

All in all it‘s a nice dungeon crawler with round based tactical combat and lots of looting and crafting options. Graphical presentation is ok, Scara brae and the surrounding landscapes are put beautifully in scene. Character presentation is rather edgy and very „woody“. Apart from that there was put very much love and detail into the sound. The story is a bit weak with slight humoristic aspects. The setting of a Scottish/Gaelic fantasy world fits in very well.

The gameplay itself is a bit of rather longwired in my eyes. Combat can get very tough, even on easy mode. It‘s challenging, but not unfair.

I personally think, the density of puzzles and riddles (some of them very difficult, but soluble) is a bit too high, because you spend much to most of the time with finding ways to open gates for the next small area where again you find your way blocked by the next puzzle; which breaks the gameflow and makes the experience a bit too lengthy.

Verdict: A solid dungeon crawler with beautiful sound, edgy visual character presentation, challenging combat and very high density of puzzles and riddles making the gameplay rather lengthy. If the last aspect doesn’t scare you, I would recommend to give it a try ... especially when the game is on sale.
 
TAD40
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
60.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 avril 2021
Сразу после релиза это был ужас, а не игра - после почти подвешивающих игру разбиваний бочек и застревания в текстурах на лестнице в самом начале, я ее с отвращением стер. Но после уймы патчей и выпуска Director's cut, получилась неплохая RPG/Dungeon crawler, как раз как мне нравится - не только и не столько в подземельях, с многочисленными головоломками, некоторые из которых довольно оригинальные (выстраивание шестеренкок, пугание фей, адский водопровод). Боевая система в игре странная - очки действий даются на партию, а не на каждого сопартийца, но в основном сбалансированная.

51.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mars 2021
Fun game, interesting take on RPGs blending old school with modern mechanics. The puzzles were definitely a highlight but are also completely optional if they aren't your thing.

The main downsides are that there are definitely a handful of bugs mostly related to movement and getting stuck in environments from what I experienced and inventory sorting is still a nightmare.

Overall a pretty enjoyable game!

83.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2021
Way too much puzzles, puzzles at every turn, you might think that this is a puzzle RPG, not an RPG with puzzle elements.

I love the combat system.

Item management can be improved with auto sort, but I don't see the option to sort the items, only to separate them based on types. It's a chore to browse through your inventory if you play this on gamepad. Gamepad accessibility is good.

Some bugs here and there, especially the combat option wheel is still greyed out when a fight begins.

Game is running a lot more smoother with Director's Cut version compared to the old version. However, stutters and frame dips is still visible. It's an eyesore. It's an improvement, but still need to be worked a bit.

NPC is no longer looking terribly dull. They're still dull and ugly, only not as much as the old version. Their lips movement is totally out of sync with the dialogues. But you do get voiced dialogues, which is great.

Recommended for all turn based RPG enthusiast.
 
BiskutMentega
398 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 février 2021
It's actually a great game all things considered. It isn't the best optimised or rather fastest running game out there, but it can be a great looking game too. It does have what is best described 'simplified' level design, but for a dungeon crawler type game this is extremely acceptable. There are also a lot of things to explore and discover and the overall vibe is awesome. Compared to some of the older games in the series, the first two hours in have had a few funny moments, but did feel less like a full on comedy. That's okey though, as gameplay is generally awesome. In terms of controls it is a simple game to play, very context based mouse clicking. But I didn't hate it. In terms of combat, it'll get interesting early on, which is definitely great to see. Voice overs and story are great so far, but I'm only just getting into it with having played 3 hours or so now. I have to say, it's easy to recommend even now. No game breaking bugs or glitches issues so far either.

yeah, sure, char creation could have been better, with more portraits, etc. But this is NOT the main purpose of the game.
Got it for 12€ and this is a blast for the price.

Recommandé
120.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2021
Excellent game with a beautiful soundtrack, and some entertaining voice acting. The game has a nice blend of combat, exploration and puzzles (most of which are reasonably easy, but there are a smattering of head scratchers that need some careful planning and thought). Personally I quite liked the graphic style, though I can understand that some may find it somewhat basic. The combat does occasionally glitch and stutter, but nothing that spoilt the game overly much for me. I liked the mechanics, but the difficulty (especially on some boss fights) can be heavily reliant on party make-up and chosen skills, though it is reasonably easy to switch skills and party members to experiment with different strategies if you encounter a difficult fight.

62.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 décembre 2020
9/10
Musím říct, že tady jsem měl někdy 100 chutí hru zabalit a už se k ní nevrátit. Ale něco mě hnalo dál. Puzzle jsou takové typické na starší dekádu, ale dokáží pobavit i potrápit.
Líbilo se mi stupňování EQ, jak jsem našel stejnou věc, ale byla o něco lepší, než jsem právě měl. Ale jen malinko. Takže postup úrovní bylo celkem škálovatelné. Hezké bylo, že v poslední 1/4 hry jsem dokázal sundat červeně vyhlížející skupinky.
Bosové byly fajn, zajímavý, ale vzhledem k zneužívaní Barda(to je asi jako cíl hry) a Song of Compulsory támhleto to bylo vcelku na pohodu. [2X bard, 1x rogue, 1x archmage, 1xshield fighter, 1x 2h executioner]
Určitě jsem nenašel všechny secrets ani jsem neodemknul všechny Elven weapons....ale dobrý. Rozlehlá hra. Né tak moc backtrackingu. Příběh je takový nějaký/nijaký.
 
mimozakon
616 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
60.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 décembre 2020
I want to like this game, but it fights me all the way. The original release was a buggy, barely functioning mess, and I almost couldn't get through its opening few hours. It never turned the corner for me back in 2018, with some interesting ideas smothered by poor execution.

Even playing through this "Director's Cut" was a fraught experience: two years later, it still feels unfinished, with bugs abound, an uneven aesthetic, blurry assets, caustic sound design that tramples all over a lovely and unique soundtrack, a combat and progression system that completely runs out of steam with 20+ hours to go, and a plot with a pileup of proper noun macguffins that has you trailing in the villains' wake for the entire duration.

I didn't hate it though - the combat has some really neat ideas that I want to see iterated on (the tension of having to generate mana before you can cast spells, the importance of formation and positioning within a tight 4x4 grid, the ability to take action being a shared resource), but outside of perhaps two occasions, I didn't feel pushed to switch around abilities, revise my strategy or re-spec a character.

It's worth playing, I don't think it's worth finishing.
 
Serendipity River
2,325 produits enregistrés

33.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2020
A true companion to the original trilogy. Clever, well thought out puzzles, interesting and thought provoking combat and character development with beautiful music accompanying the quest. If you want an RPG that doesn't lead you around by the nose, this is the game for you!

Previous Bard's tale experience a plus for name recognition only, will not affect game play or enjoyment.
 
Zanth
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
62.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2020
Oyé braves aventuriers,

En cette époque, il est difficile de trouver des quêtes dignes de ce nom, avec de multiples donjons dotés de pièges, de mystère et d'énigmes. Mais ne vous inquiétez pas, je vous présente Skara Brae. C'est tellement le bordel là-bas avec leur espèce de secte religieux, vous aurez de quoi trancher en pièces les ennemis, détourner des pièges mortels, résoudre des énigmes, chanter et boire de pintes jusqu'à l'ébriété la plus extrême.

Bard's Tale 4 est un excellent hommage à ses prédécesseurs. L'ambiance onirique est magnifique, on est constamment envoûté par la musique des bardes, les combats nécessitent de la réflexion et les donjons font appel à notre intelligence et nos capacités d'observation.

CEPENDANT, arrivé aux deux tiers du jeu (environs vers le niveau 20 de nos personnages), la redondance se fait sentir puisqu'on a fait le tour de toutes les énigmes, des ennemis et de nos capacités. Je regrette dès lors que les développeurs aient littéralement bourré le jeu vers la fin, alors que le début était parfait au niveau du level design et du rythme. En effet, lorsqu'on s'approche inexorablement du boss final, chaque mètre carré des donjons se remplissent d'ennemis, toujours les mêmes. Vraiment dommage.

C'est pourquoi je conseil de jouer à ce jeu en mode normal et pas difficile. Sinon vous aurez tellement de sacs à PV à oblitérer que vous allez vous dégouter du jeu.

Pour finir, je conseille grandement ce jeu aux amateurs d'RPG solo et de dungeon crawler. Vous allez vous régaler.
 
SuperBestOfPlus

Pheanomme
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
111.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 octobre 2020
Bordering on casual dungeon crawler, this game delivers exactly what it says. Sleek UI, simple controls, just enough lore to tell a story without trying to be a university class in the worlds history.

Difficulty modes, and play style configuration allow any player, from those scared of bunnies to those demon hunting with a toothpick, to find the exact challenge they want.

At 70+ hours of play I have had a total of 2 crashes running on the default settings. I am sure both of those were in fact caused by 3rd party streaming programs and not the game itself. As always, I suggest turning off all 'overlays' 'gamebars' and other useless and buggy add-ons when playing any game.

This game is sadly much smaller than I had hoped. A straight run through would take 12 hours. But as with all RPG the victory is not killing the last boss, it is finding and doing everything. In that this game is less than stellar. Linear side-quests, closed world, and limited experience (non respawning enemies, no random encounters) all play against character development. Late game perfectionist will be annoyed at the constant returning to completed areas that have no enemies or anything new, just to walk for 15 minutes to upgrade a single weapon a specific place. This artificially lengthens the time needed, but does nothing else. A cheap trick by the developer to add clock time and no actual play.

All in all a fun game if you want an old school 80's rpg with a newer engine.

Recommandé
116.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2020
I recommend the game but only when on sale. I found the game to enjoyable overall despite some frustration with its mechanics. Story line is interesting enough and voice acting was fairly good.

Save game system sucks. While you can enable 'save anywhere' you don't get to chose a save game slot and there are only so many of them. So if you were planning on going back to an earlier save, be warned, it may get overwritten.

Mapping is also a bit of a let down. No way to add your own markers and the map itself is inaccurate and hard to read.
 
jkayca
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
60.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 septembre 2020
Yep I played the original Bard's Tale trilogy back in the years they released.

I am new to this game and never experienced all the technical issues that I heard about, as this is the Director's Cut version and apart from the occasional crash to desktop in all the hours I've played, it's run pretty flawless.

This is an old school style, turn based/tactical combat RPG that had me up to 4am in the morning on a few nights. Addictive, fun, simple like the old days, excellent combat, excellent levels, excellent exploration potential. Puzzles? I seem to hear that people claim there's too many. Yeah there's a tonne, but I loved them, and the Directors Cut lets you insta-skip/solve them if you want, which I only did about 3 times out of the hundred or so I've completed on my own.

I would strongly recommend one of those "Things I wish I knew before played BT4" spoiler free type articles before playing though.

Was definitely worth the $34.99 I paid for it and yes the $34.99 edition entitled "Buy The Bard's Tale IV - Standard Edition" is actually the Director's Cut version.
 
yacks
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
78.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2020
This game is not a visual gem. It has a decent story, but not mindblowing. What sets it apart is its unique combat system, the combination of fighting and puzzle solving, the music, the voice acting, the characters that don't look like super models and the different strategies to win battles. Who knew that singing songs or getting drunk could win a fight?
It has been a long time since a game forced me to think instead of pointing me where to go with a big compass. This, along with the refreshing battle system and the quirky characters has really won my heart. If you play games to be challenged and not for next-gen eye-candy, this one is for you..

Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2020
Die Vorgänger kenne ich nur vom Namen, so dass ich keine spezifischen Erwartungen an das Spiel hatte. Bard's Tale 4 hat mich aber gut unterhalten. Mal von den komischen Völkern und der absolut uninteressanten Lore abgesehen. Das hat es aber mit seiner spaßigen Kampfmechanik, dem Loot und der Charaktererstellung wieder gut gemacht. Ich habe es auf dem höchsten Schwierigkeitsgrad gespielt und gerade zu Beginn hat das zu einigen spannenden Kämpfen geführt. Später facerollt man natürlich trotzdem durch, aber das betrifft eher das letzte Drittel.

Gestört haben mich nur die Rätsel gegen Ende, das Spiel ist etwas zu lang, wenn man endlich fertig werden will, dann hat man einfach keine Lust das altbekannte Schalterrätsel erneut und erneut zu machen.

Bugs hatte ich keine nennenswerten, dafür aber ein paar Abstürze. Die können natürlich auch durch meinen PC verschuldet sein.

Recommandé
47.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2020
Totally recommend this game for anyone who enjoys D&D style RPGs.

This reminds me of some of the best WASD first person dungeons crawlers. Almost 45 hours into it, I have enjoyed the turn based combat, character progression, and puzzle elements of the game. I like how the group grows with the story, battle options, and puzzle difficulty. There are limited options for amour and weapons per role, crafting is ok, and while there are some side quests progression requires the main quest line.

I give this a solid B+
 
Hades
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
122.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2020
Yes, I played it through once. 120 hrs, a remarkable gaming experience for me.

What did I like?

The puzzles. There are many puzzles. Sometimes more than I could or wanted to solve in one evening. I continued the next day, playing on. Some puzzles kept me busy for several evenings, till I found the solution. The solution would have been only a few clicks away, but I wanted to find the solution myself. If you do not like puzzles, don't play this game. I heard there were workarounds for the puzzles, but without them, it is another game.

The combat system: Different skillsets, choices to make, synergies, balance offense vs defense, I absolutely liked it. Another good point in my view: A single battle is reasonably short.

Equipment development: Despite I did not use any elven weapon, I found the constant development nice to see my chars evolve stronger through the entire game. New, better weapons, boni on individual weapons, different weapon classes with differetnt traits.

The songs: In my view, the design team thought a lot about why this game is called Bard's Tale. Nice tunes in different locations, embracing and being embraced by the game world.

References to the old Bard's Tale games of the 1980s. The layout of the town "Skara Brae Below", the review board, NPCs like Roscoe brought back memories from a long time ago.

I did not encounter bugs in the entire game, and the game crashed once.

One of the things I was not particularly impressed of was the character development system, a bit too limited and no real choices / tradeoffs to make. Good point was the balance between the different classes. No char fell off during the entire game, and respeccing and exchanging party members enabled me to correct my setup, when I found I had my skill points not well enough assigned.

The story was a bit indifferent. I did not have the feeling what I did was "important". I walked along the pretty linear story, a problem was proposed, was solved (or not?), then move on to the next.

I found the maps annoying, because they showed open paths, where actually none existed.

Conclusion: This game is not for everyone. I tried to give some direction what I liked more or less in the game, so you can compare your preferences against what I encountered. I hope, this small review will help you to make a good decision.
 
CeterumCenseo
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

It is far from perfect and I did expect a lot more before it came out but expectations apart, it is decent old style Dungeon crawler with Great Music and a graphic style all of it's own. I found the puzzles a bit simplistic and repetitive but not unpleasant. There were still a few minor bugs when last I played but the devs were actively chasing them down. You can get through pretty quickly but exploring every little corner and chasing down all the achievements I got 49 hours out of my second play through.
P.s: If you tend to suffer from motion sickness, increasing the FOV to 75 fixed it for me.

89.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2020
For those that want an old fashioned CRPG with a new twist, buy this, play this. There will be combat and puzzles. There will be party building and skill selection. There will be gear selection and tweaking builds easily to get everything just perfect for your style. And just about any style will work. Yes, you can spam OP skills, or you can forgo them and put more work in. But when you have it right, you will know. Very rewarding game to play, and rewarding party to build. Easily one of my favorites and I wish I had more to play.

Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
Habe die ersten 3 Teile auf dem Amiga gespielt und war sofort dabei als der 4. Teil angekündigt wurde.

Die Rätsel sind für jeden zu lösen. Die Grafik auf meinen Rechner, iMac 5K Late 2015, ist gut. Werde mir das Spiel mal auf dem PC von mein Sohn mal anschauen wie da die Grafik ist. Die Musik ist für mich nicht nervtötend.

Das Kampfsystem war für mich am Anfang doch schwer zu verstehen aber nach ca. 2 Stunden Spielzeit war diese Hürde für mich überwunden. Das Spiel hat aber immer noch ein paar Bugs. Ich hoffe diese werden bald behoben sein.

Ich bin kein großer Zocker mehr wie damals. Habe ca. 2003 mit dem spielen so gut wie aufgehört. Aber dieses Spiel hat mich wieder zurück geholt. Bin am überlegen ob ich das Spiel über Twitch streamen soll.

Also, als Fan der Serie bekommt es 9/10 Punkten. Wäre ich nicht so ein Fan der Serie würde es 7/10 Punkten bekommen wegen die Bugs und das die Grafik hätte besser sein können, da wohl das Spiel eine neue Grafikengine bekommen hat, die die Grafik etwas verschlechtert hat.

Recommandé
100.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2020
This is a good game if you like the genre of new classic dungeon crawlers. The combat system is the best thing and what sets it apart from others in the genre. It has problems though. Lots of minor ones with the design of the gameplay and roleplaying systems that are annoying but you can most likely get over. But also some big performance problems. I have a good computer that well exceeds the requirements but still I have stuttering and frame-pacing issues. Getting a smooth framerate out of this game is not likely to happen, unfortunately. That said, it's still a fun and enjoyable game that made me not want to stop playing until the end. It's not as good as The Legend of Grimrock series, but it scratches that itch pretty well.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
63.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2020
Solid. A little funky at times with some nitpicky stuff, but I'll say MOST of the puzzles were pretty intuitive, though a few did get overused a little (sliding blocks and such.)

All in all, though, it's about what you'd expect - a party-based blobber type game! There aren't a ton of classes but each one has a decent variety of paths and you only get to set a handful of abilities in battle anyway so it kinda comes down more to strategy and synergy, which was actually kinda fun to plan around.

I don't have a lot of specific things to say one way or another - I only had one crash for the whole game and, thankfully, they have a setting that lets you save whenever you want if you enable it, so it wasn't a problem at all. The story and voice acting and all were pretty good and a lot of the music was fairly nice! All in all not bad in my opinion.

If you're coming from Grimrock don't expect the same - Bard's Tale is the *classic* sort of this game, meaning turn based combat and all that jazz. It's pretty similar and yet, at the same time, almost a different genre in that sense. Comparable to Wizardry series, Might and Magic, et al.

119 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
84.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2020
I never played Bards Tale when I saw it on the shelves back in the 80's this is my first experience with Bards Tale games. This game really surprised me. A classic fantasy tale with traditional turn based RPG elements. The mythos feels authentic because much of it is steeped in Scottish lore. If you go in fer that type of thing your in for a treat. The music is enchanting and woven into the story, an actual "Bards Tale" with actual songs where the lore and lyrics matter. Somehow it does this without getting in the way of my combat/quest/buy/sell/craft/level up my party lifestyle either. I really like it. The graphics are one of the best I have ever seen in this type of game. Fully 3d and still perfectly turn based. It plays something like Dragon Age mixed with Wizardry. I like the way the story unfolds but isn't crammed down my throat. I love the interaction between the PC's that comes at exactly the right time, when I'm not expecting it and in a delightfully surprising way. The core mechanics are extremely simple but with 6 pc's to move for with 4 skills each that ends up being about 16 choices per turn not even counting movement and debuff and spell interupt... that's a LOT to do each round. If you want to try things out you can respec at just about any time in the game. There is a perfect mixture of combat, puzzles , quest dialogue and exploration. It's not Deep. It's not complicated. It's genuinely charming though. It's a little repetitive and perhaps not the hardest game out there but it is a lot of fun. I'm looking forward to living long enough to see Bard's Tale V. Hopefully my wife will be around to figure out the "bloomin-fairy" puzzles for me then too.
 
Jay

15.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2020
Beautiful game!
It's different in terms of simply hacking and slashing your foes like other FPS adventure games out there - in this game you fight in a 4x4 grid system set in a FPS style. Very neat fighting system and it's nice to see something new and fresh. I must say if you've played the Bard's tale series before the lore is all here - including from the Bard's tale that was a stand-alone adventure game.

Bard's Tale 4 still has humor, but is more realistic that previous installments. I wanted to sit down to try the game today... and ended up getting lost in the lore and style for 4 hours straight.

If you want a nice change of pace and love adventure/rpg/DnD style games - this is a MUST for your library.

A wonderful side not is EVERYTHING is voiced in the game and the music/soundtrack is BEAUTIFUL.

Give it a try - you will not be disappointed <3

gr3chu
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2020
I went into this game hoping that the unique combat system would be a lot of fun. It is different than pretty much any game in the same genre. It turns out that it isn't all that much fun, in fact, it's about as much fun as cleaning a cat box. The main problem I have with it is the pooling of "opportunity" points, it just means that frequently you end up with party members doing nothing for a turn. I didn't like the meditation or concentration mechanic either. I also didn't like the cutthroat opposition early in the game; that just results in having to reload. Although the combat system is unique, it's also very opaque. Rather than straight up kill enemies, the game wants you to puzzle around, moving members or enemies around to different squares using unintuitive and unrealistic abilities. Rather than being explosive, combat is just another puzzle; in a game loaded with puzzles.

What killed the game for me was when I ran into a spell caster that kept summoning waves of goblins, three waves. I'm not sure what the developers think people should do in that situation, but all of them had way more hit points than my crew, and the balls they carried exploded, killing my front line. I realized at that point that the game was over, I can't stomach reloading again. It's not that you have to do all that much all over again, there are save locations everywhere, but once you play 7 or 8 turns in a round of combat in this game, you really don't want to do it all over again.

The character progression is awful. Find some random armor or weapon that looks good? Too bad, you can't use it until authorized by some board of directors to even get training to use it. I saved up skill points only to find out I could not spend them on what I wanted because you have to spend a certain number of points first, irrespective of what level you make it to. This game goes out of it's way to make progression unrewarding.

The quests and underlying story are hard to follow or make sense of. Party members come and go, and everyone seems to be some kind of Irish Leprechaun voice, which frequently doesn't really go with the face.

The scale of the game is very small, there are no wide areas to explore, it's sort of like the old school Dungeon Master/Eye of the Beholder style of maps, except that you can move in any direction when not in combat mode.

The graphics are a little too cartoonish, which isn't that big of a deal, but for old school graphics, the frame rate is pretty bad at times.

I didn't like the music, and the Irish chanting everywhere drove me crazy.
 
Jacmac
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
87.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2020
This was a lover letter to Bard's tale fans from the 80s; while trying to add some modernization.

The Director's Cut still has some minor bugs and in some cases, a lack of "refinement", but in general I LOVED playing through the game. Also, the original music is the best I've ever heard in any video game.

Kudos inXile. Thanks for making a dream come true (getting a new BT game at some point in my life).

I hope we see BT5 in a few years.

Évaluation publiée le 22 juin 2020
I am having such a great time with this game. I like turn based combat games that make you also think. I like the PoE series and similar. For that reason, this game checks all the right boxes. It also adds in more "thinking" in terms of how to get places and use weapons. Its not just a "equip and kill" game. I also love the graphics and the music. Yes, there are things I would change...(IE When you lose a member of the the party to a story requirement, I would like an ability to be warned so you can take your important weapons or armor back. ) But, overall those are the quirks that make the game interesting and...FUN. I have been playing at the time of this writing for 11 hours and still have so much to do. It is a game worth every penny.
 
michelle.pogo
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
80.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2020
It's safe to say I enjoyed this a lot more than I thought I would! This game is a love letter to 90's-style first-person dungeon crawlers that I didn't personally play growing up, but was able to be engrossed in this nonetheless.

The gameplay reads very "classic" to me, in that a lot of gameplay nuances may seem somewhat contrived or random, but having played a lot of games that came out around the same time as the ones this is based on, that's kind of just how games were back then, so this will certainly make you feel like you're playing a modern antique, so to speak. That being said, this game definitely has a lot of modern conventions that I would expect from a AAA title nowadays, with the exception of a few features that aren't really up to snuff, such as the inventory management (oh god, the inventory) or the saving mechanics (There are manual saves, but you can't choose what slot to choose from, and they do eventually overwrite each other. If you're like me, you won't realize this until near the end of the game and be saving diligently only to then have saves that only go back an hour :/)

Overall, if you ever played an RPG in the 90's and enjoyed it, this is for you. Likewise, if you played any RPG ever and liked it, you might give this a shot. You probably won't be disappointed.
 
The Bryceter

mark091176
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
109.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 juin 2020
Хорошая игра.
Досталась в хамбл бандле по подписке, думал фигня, но черт возьми было интересно. Забавный казус - основа отрицательных отзывов, что разработчик отменил поддержку семерки в последнем патче (и это я считаю конченный поступок). Но так как недавно приобрел Gers Tactics, пришлось скрепя зубами, перейти на 10ку, но Рассказы барда то я прошел, а Гирзов нет=)

Плюсы:
1) Много загадок - заставят основательно подумать и даже иногда смириться и смотреть гайды. Блин, да тут есть загадки, где тебе прямо говорят распечатай из файлов игры 3 листа, вырежи соедини и верти их чтобы решить некоторые моменты=))). Это круто!
2) Разные возможности для создания билдов отряда. Просто и доступно
3) Тут нету ноунеймов. Даже если ты создаешь своего персонажа или нового наемника, они выбираются из готовых уже характеров, и все (что герои, что наемники) имеют свои диалоги на разные темы.
4) Хороший графон.

Минусы:
1) Много загадок - минус тут в том, что под конец их навалиают все больше и больше, и чувствуется прямо, что ими растягивали игру. Они уже просто не нужны, но они будут. Так же некоторые загадки (видатья просто дебич) не мог никак решить, а смотря гайд вместо "А вот оно как!" кричал "Да откуда они это взяли то!" - тоесть до некоторых моментов додуматься могут только единицы=-(.
2) Нету баланса сложности. Высокая сложность в основной игре - она не сложная Серьёзно, ничего не поменялось, относительно средней. Просто больше брони и хп у врагов. В то же время там есть локация Хернхолд, который доступен с самого начала игры и как я понял, это какое то длс, так там сложность такая, что даже партией которая уже идет на финального босса воевать крайне и крайне проблемно. А уж про босса этого длс я вообще молчу, так как там набор улучшений такой, что бой с ним может и на час затянуться.
Есть еще пара несущественных придирок, но это мелочи.
 
dorian-f-k
886 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
77.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2020
English below german text
===========
Ich habe dieses Spiel erfolgreich beendet, bis auf den "DLC Dungeon" oder "Add-On Dungeon". Dieser ist lächerlich schwer mit einem Monster mit 4000 Lebenspunkten und sehr vielen Aktionspunkten. Muss ich dafür XP farmen wie in einem JRPG?
Bis auf diesen für mich unmöglichen Dungeon ist das Spiel super.
Man merk, dass es wohl nicht von einem erfahrenen Team gemacht wurde bzw. irgendwann das Geld von Kickstarter aufgebracuht war und das Spiel auf den Markt musste. Ich hatte ebenfalls einige Crash-To-Desktop's. Dies ist vor allem dann nervig, wenn man nicht mit dem Modus "überall Speichern" spielt und es kurz vor einem neuen Speicherpunkt abstürzt.
Abgesehen davon hat es mich hervorragend unterhalten. Jeder Dialog ist vertont mit, aus meiner Sicht, sehr gutem Voice Acting. Davon können sich sehr viele AAA Spiele sich eine Scheibe abschneiden. Für mich war der Schwierigkeitsgrad "Schwer" genau richtig. Es sind oft einige meiner 6 Helden ausgefallen, aber letztendlich habe ich die Kämpfe bis auf ganz wenige Ausnahmen beim ersten Versuch gewonnen. Bei manchen musste ich auch schön überlegen, wie ich die Fähigkeiten der Abenteuerer gewinnbringend kombiniere. Auch die Rätsel waren in einem sehr angenehmen Schwierigkeitsgrad. Sie waren nicht zu schwer und nicht zu leicht. Ich konnte es gut durchspielen.
Was ich vermisst habe war ein virtueller Notizblock mit Freitexteingabe und eine Funktion auf der Karte persistente Markierungen zu setzen. Wie in anderen Kommentaren gesagt wurde, muss man sehr oft in bereits besuchte Gebiete, weil ein Schlüssel gefunden wurde um weiterzukommen. Viele von diesen "Geheimnissen" oder "Back-Tracking" Aufgaben sind ehr optional um neues Loot zu bekommen (diese sist oft schlechter als man besitzt). Oft findet man wie gesagt im späteren verlauf die Schlüssel für solche optionalen Quests, aber kann nicht mehr zuordnen wofür ich nun diesen "Schlüssel" brauche. Auch habe ich die starken Gegner im unteren Teil von Skara Brae erst sehr spät bekämpft, weil ich einfach vergessen habe, dass dort noch mehr zu finden ist. Eine lange Zeit lang sind ein paar der Gegner im ersten Gebiet unbesiegbar stark. Wenn man dann soweit ist diese bekämpfen zu können, muss man sich nur noch daran erinnern können, dass da was war. Mit eigenen Markierungen und einem Notizblock wäre das um einiges einfacher gewesen sich zu erinnern.
Ich habe das Spiel durch ein Humble Bundle bekommen und war äußerst positiv überrascht. Jetzt in der Corona-zeit habe ich die 77h Spielzeit in ca. 4 Wochen geschafft und es hat Spaß gemacht!
=====================================================================================
I have successfully completed this game, except for the "DLC Dungeon" or "Add-On Dungeon". This one is ridiculously heavy with a monster with 4000 life points and lots of action points. Do I have to farm XP like in a JRPG?
Except for this dungeon, which is impossible for me, the game is great.
You can see that it was probably not made by an experienced team or that Kickstarter had run out of money and had to release the game. I also had some Crash-To-Desktop's. This is especially annoying if you don't play with the mode "save everywhere" and it crashes shortly before a new save point.
Apart from that it entertained me very well. Every dialogue is set to music with, in my opinion, very good voice acting. Many AAA games can take a leaf out of your book. For me the difficulty level "difficult" was exactly right. Often some of my 6 heroes failed, but in the end I won the fights with very few exceptions on the first try. With some of them I had to think about how to combine the abilities of the adventurers in a winning way. Also the puzzles were in a very pleasant degree of difficulty. They were not too difficult and not too easy. I could play through it well.
What I missed was a virtual notepad with free text input and a function to set persistent markers on the map. As was said in other comments, very often you have to go to already visited areas because a key was found to get ahead. Many of these "secrets" or "back-tracking" tasks are optional to get new loot (which is often worse than you have). Often one finds the keys for such optional quests in the later course of the game, but can no longer assign them to what I need this "key" for. I also fought the strong enemies in the lower part of Skara Brae very late, because I simply forgot that there is more to find there. For a long time some of the opponents in the first area are invincibly strong. When you are ready to fight them, you just have to remember that there was something there. With your own markers and a notepad it would have been a lot easier to remember.
I got the game through a Humble Bundle and was very positively surprised. Now in the Corona time I made the 77h game in about 4 weeks and it was fun!

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

Évaluation publiée le 23 mai 2020
So far i am not really digging it. Its got a lot of stuff in it but its not well integrated together.
At least it doesnt feel that way to me. I mean i dont feel like the components of everything work that well together. Feels like more and more stuff was added to the game but not well thought out.
Its on rails so far.

but i only 2 hours or so on it. the learning curve seems low. Most its just obscure.

The combat is specialized as a mini game. That doesnt use these beautiful 3d maps they built. its like tagged on. The whole game feels like bits and pieces tagged on.

I think i am spoiled by wizardry 8. old game i know but its really well thought out not linear to the point of rails.
possible that bards tale doesnt become something special until later. maybe ill find out.
But i am generally not a fan or pompous story. I want to feel like i have earned the right to be called hero.
Sigh... The modern dungeon blobber eludes me.

Has a good combat system with attacks and abilities that are satisfying to use. It does start a bit slow though with a fairly long and linear tutorial-esque you must go here, you must go there thing. Once you get to the first real dungeon a few hours in though it picks up really fast.

grox
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
60.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2020
The first 30 hours were wonderful. The world opened up, there was lots of options to explore and roleplay. The last thirty hours were an exercise in frustration. The world ended up being a railroad, with very specific character builds, party builds and set of combat mechanics to be viable in the final areas.

Also the puzzles were an oddity and very frustrating towards the end. I don't mind environmental and story puzzles but the cog fitting puzzles and sokoban puzzles seemed tedious, frustrating and completely out of place in the world.

My biggest disappointment with the game is just how linear everything is. Very few of the quests can be done out of order because you need to be a specific level to win the fights in the quests. So while the game looks open it's actually very very linear.

Overall a positive but only just.

Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2020
This game has it's charm but a lot of frustrating moments. For me is a game like none other and sometimes it's a good thing but most of the times is so infuriating to play in a system like this. The battle system is simple but engaging, the skill tree is not so good in my opinion and the story elements get crumpled under infuriating exploration in a world devoided of life. The music, as it should be is a stong point for this game and if you get yourself over the "originality" in this game it can be a good game.

Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2020
鉴于魔法门基本上应该是死在育碧手里了,最后一作魔法门X的BUG满天飞几乎玩不了（我都坏挡N次了啊！），这是目前为数不多’有内味‘的游戏了
谜题相对来说已经算很亲民了，提示给的很足，就是剧情实在是有点太...无聊，能做的事也不多
也没有什么探索的乐趣（虽然说世界各地有各种支线，但是没有魔法门那种你迷路到哪个鸟不生蛋的地方突然发现了某个外星神器的惊喜感觉）
战斗系统很有趣，愣是让我玩出了战旗游戏的感觉,就是这个平衡比较迷，虽然名字叫bard’s tale但是bard的强度会不会太高了点？
总而言之如果是喜欢魔法门的玩家，应该可以当小品玩一玩
 
Kurros
511 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
42.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 avril 2020
Interesting RPG. Lots of praise for the low grade feel of the environment models and textures, yet complex and detailed with many details. This game also suffers from a lack of visual optimization. Voice acting and bard singing matched the expectations of previous installments as well.

Structured puzzles were appropiately challenging but the game is terribly obtuse when it comes to more complex puzzles - there was a ton of unexplained puzzles where the game expected you to try combinations out. Perhaps this was an intentional design.

Unfortunately, there were a great many times where it felt like a long walking simulator, getting from one area to another, or worse - going long lengths, back and forth in the same map. The option to sprint felt as slow as walking.

It's a bit of a mix of feelings about the different biomes that you play in. The different biomes was a refreshing change and generally, the visuals were great, if the player was to only pass through the area once. But on multiple walking passes through the same area, the environment visuals just don't hold up, and the game just felt dragged out.

6/10
 
teh_444
1,041 produits enregistrés

0
Non recommandé
8.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 avril 2020
Don't know what this is. It is pretty and has nice music, but it doesn't use anything from the old Bard's Tale games.

Gameplay is boring, very linear due to difficulty routing, and basically impossible. Or at least it didn't teach me enough to get through the tutorial. Assuming this is a tutorial still and I'm not stuck in tutorial mode for the entire game.

At best, it is 'meh' and I recognize I have no interest in the puzzles or figuring out the power gaming necessary to get past the battles once you are in upper Skara Brae (as they are now beyond my level/ability but I have nowhere else to go and don't know what else to do but try over and over again to figure out how to beat enemies with 5x my health).

I think I'll just go and play something that is fun instead.
 
felix_draconis
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
26.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2020
I really wanted to like this game, honestly i did. The game even on modern settings feels like it was made in the 90s. I enjoyed the old titles when they came out but this one feels like they changed virtually nothing. The game uses enemies and invisible walls to herd you in directions with no way to really feel like you are exploring. The ai even on normal can be very difficult to the point of needing to save before every fight so to repeat it till you are able to win and run back to heal. The puzzles are numerous and vary from very easy to hard but there are way to many of them. The music can be enjoyable though it does get repetitive after a hour or so. It even got to a point where i considered turning the music volume to get a break from what feels like the same 3 songs on repeat. The exploration is very limited and unlocks slowly to the point of having to return to the same location to unlock a new small section every few levels.

Overall the game is slow with bad ai and a very repetitive gameplay and a feel like it was made 30 years ago but only released now.

Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2020
If you are looking for an "old-school" dungeon crawling RPG that challenges you not only through intricate puzzles, but also with it's party turn-based combat system, then look no further! Bard's Tale 4 is truly a full ride, with optional content strewn about a (mostly) linear story. Fun world with interesting characters and situations, 8/8.

Monene
725 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
66.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2020
Das wichtigste: Die Musik ist echt genial gut!
Wer Bard´s Tale auf dem C64 (oder Atari ST etc.) gespielt und gemocht hat wird dies hier auch mögen. Da werden einige Erinnerungen wieder wach :-)

Für alle anderen empfehle ich es eher nicht, da es leider meiner Meinung nach zu viele ärgerliche Bugs enthält und es genug andere gute Spiele in der Art wie dieses gibt.

Ein Bug Beispiel. Es gibt eine Tür die, nachdem man Sie mit einem Schlüssel geöffnet hat, wieder "zufällt". Und natürlich ist der Schlüssel verwendet worden und somit auch nicht mehr im Inventar. Je nachdem wann man gespeichert hat ist dies sehr ärgerlich wenn man vieles nochmal durchspielen muss.
Auch funktioniere einige Rücksetzpunkte bei den Schieberätseln mit den Steinblöcken nicht. Ich musste speichern, neu laden und dann den Rücksetzpunkt aktivieren (Melodie spielen). Komisch aber hat immer funktioniert.

Auch ärgerlich ist dass man keine Truhe hat wo man sein Inventar lagern kann. Die Händler haben nur einen bestimmten Geldbetrag und wenn die kein Geld mehr haben kann man nichts mehr verkaufen. Passierte bei mir so ab der Hälfte des Spiels. Man reist dann umher und klappert alle Händler ab bis alle kein Geld mehr haben, Tja, und dann muss man Dinge aus dem Inventar zerstören um wieder Platz zu schaffen. Echt Schade. Insbesondere wegen der Elfen-Waffen mit den Puzzeln.

Ich hatte auch erst am Ende des Spiels mitbekommen dass nur die letzen 20 Speicherpunkte vorhanden sind. Sehr ärgerlich da man am Ende nicht mehr zurück in die Gilde kommt um eventuell seine Chars zu respecen.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad der Rätsel/Puzzle geht von leicht (die meisten) bis bock schwer (zum Glück nur nur wenige). Es sind aber schon einige Rätsel. Wer dies nicht so mag kann diese aber auch "abschalten".

So, zum Abschluß sei noch gesagt:
SNOW IN SUMMER :-)
 
Swamison
0

Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2020
It brings memories from the puzzles of ultima ix to the old bard's tale 1993 etc (not the weird one of 2004, wasn't bad but..ok) .
The music is amazing, the graphics are above average, the design of the areas most of the times is perfect. Imo it has a bit too many puzzles but i always play tired so it could be ok from others.
You can make really good combos of skills and "abuse" the mechanics that are buffed from weapons that you discover (especially elven ones )
Replayability huge! I just finished the game and instantly made a new one with the decision to discover all little things i learnt in the way of the game and i skipped them/couldnt remember where was what)

Gameplay 8/10 (i would like to have less crashes, sometimes the battle will seem to "halt" but it will go on after )
Graphics 8/10 Design of areas 10/10
Story/immersion in the rpg (do you feel you are in it?) 10/10
Music/Sound 10/10

In general all who loved the old rpgs from king's quest to ultima go for it. All you new guys and girls who just play witcher..well this is how all started, from bard's tale a big part, i suggest you respect and play it :P

If do you like the 80's rpg fantasy game concept but updated with a new one motor, this is your game almost you have to give him a change, you will not regret.

Mittlerweile ein schönes, rundes Spiel, das bei mir technisch sauber lief, mit interessanten Kämpfen und vielseitiger Charakterentwicklung. Die deutsche Version ist gut gelungen, ohne ins Auge springende Fehler.

Wer rundenbasierte Spiele im Stile von Might and Magic, Wizardry, oder Operencia mag, sollte unbedingt zugreifen.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
77.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 avril 2020
I enjoyed this game a lot, but make sure you enable the option that allows you to skip puzzles, because this game is choke-full of them, some are enjoyable, but some are so hard you'll just wanna pull your hair out. I didn't choose that option but I only realized what a mistake that was when I was like 10 hours into the game and I didn't wanna start over, thankfully YouTube saved me, and in the end I was able to finish 99% of the puzzles.
Enable the puzzle skipping option at the start, or else you might get frustrated early in the game and abandon it, which would be a shame, because the game is actually really nice and good, the graphics are good when maxed out, stable 60 fps with just a few drops here and there, just a few little bugs, the voice acting and music are excellent, the gameplay is good if you like TBS games. I played on hard (second hardest difficulty) from the start and at first you'll feel weak and you must avoid some enemies, but if you build a good party, you'll mop the floor with everything before too long, only the new Dwarven Dungeon DLC posing a real challenge.
All in all, this is really a good game, I liked the story, music, graphics, gameplay, pretty much everything, excluding the puzzles.
Message for the devs: If you ever make a sequel, consider removing the puzzles altogether(or keep a few of them, but just a few) and focus more on the story and combat.
 
Naitmerr
720 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
34.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2020
Recommended game when discounted, an interesting pick on classic RPGs with emphasis on puzzles, tactics and accurate skills/party picks. Interesting story as well. Nice audio compartment, with several ballads that slowly make their way into your brain.
Unluckily partially ruined by a disappointing technical compartment:
- graphics look pretty outdated for 2019, pretty noticeable in some of the dungeons (rounds items that often look roughly squared up) and in the inventory/character management;
- experienced the odd total crash;
- lack of hardware optimization it seems (game hanging for split seconds around some maps when moving around, and it doesn't seem to be related to graphics quality as lowering it seems to yield no benefit);
- the control system is pretty bad and frustrating - clicking the mouse for selecting characters in the battle cells works very badly, often not producing any effect and forcing you to resort to hotkeys to switch characters. Same when using abilities of course, or sometimes (more rarely thankfully) even when pointing at enemies to check what spell they're about to cast or the amount of concentration points they have;
- pointing at enemies is supposed to make an indicator of their relative strength appear, which is totally needed as especially at the beginning several enemy groups are way above your level and must be avoided, but the indicator sometimes just fails to appear at all;
- the game also allows you to "run", which would be pretty useful given the length of some mazes especially if you want to head back to some save point - but that's a joke, the only effect it seems to really make is to add some heavy breathing sound, as the moving speed remains more or less the same.
Overall nice game, will show you how RPGs really were back in the early days too, the technical compartment though makes it totally not worthy the full asking price - wait until when heavily discounted!

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
34.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 avril 2020
I would recommend this game. It is an odd game. There are some parts of it which are just superb,
+ The musical score is fantastic, as you would expect in a game about a bard.
+ The level design is actually interesting. That is there are like Zelda like puzzles to solve. Riddles even! This is pretty rare and it makes exploration worth while.
+ Unique combat. There is a spell point system, with a need to build them up through meditation and drinking.

That being said it is not a superb game.
- There are only 4 classes, and only about two/three different builds per class. It looks like you get six characters in your party by the end, so in terms of character variance that is limited.
- The skill tree is pretty rudimentary.

Overall: I would say its worth the buy if you enjoy the turn based combat style of the game, and traditional fantasy adventures.

mightymark2008
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 avril 2020
Can’t recommend more. (Time ~ 100 hrs)

This game might be the only first-person POV single-player RPG that has won my praise since ULTIMA, Wizardry, Might & Magic, and Bard’s Tales in the 80s and 90s. It infused new life to the combat and puzzle in this genre of game.

I played on Hard difficulty and then switched to Legendary, with a team of four. Estimated time of a complete play-through is about 100 hours. In my impression, the time was spent mostly on solving the puzzles, as well as on thinking about and experimenting the combinations of skills and gears. The battles themselves are fast-paced.

Just in case if you are curious - the reason for which my record is less than 2 hours was that I didn’t find a way to start the game via Steam client, probably due to the fact that my device is lower than minimum requirement - MacBook Air 11" year 2012.


A few thoughts:

* Puzzle

Puzzle intensive. You would be either overjoyed or overwhelmed by the number and complexity of the endless puzzles in this game.

The mechanism is very well implemented in terms of the first-person perspective. The fact that you couldn't see the entire situation from above make these puzzles come alive. Fantastic for puzzle lovers. In case you are keen to advance the storyline or move on to the next battle, just sing the song that allows you to bypass (but not solve) the puzzle in question.

* Combat

Strategy intensive. You could see the combats as another type of puzzles or chess games. Minimum dice throwing. It adds excitement but not decisive.

The position, order of actions, and choice of skills before each battle are all important. The choice of equipments makes a big difference, and is highly relevant to the skills.


* Class & build

Simplistic.

Compared to the recent games that all come up with a dozen of classes, a dozen of sub-classes, dual-class, multi-class, each with a dozen of correlative attributes and another dozen of entwined social skills, the complexity of this game lies in the way you solve each combat puzzle, not in making the choice among the 12 X 12 X 12 possibilities before the game even starts. For me, adding all kinds of « parameters » , should them be in the form of numbers or names, does not increase the complexity or depth of the game.

* Weapon & gears

Quite a few unique weapons and gears with special effects. Some effects enhance certain skills, some offer the abilities beyond your class. It’s particularly rewarding to sort out the synergy from the gears that interact with certain skills and enhance it again from the skills between classes.

* Skill tree

You may have more than 15 chances to respec, more than enough to do all kinds of experiments without worries. I’ll leave the fun to you all.

A must play game for those who've played the old-time 3D grid-based RPG or those who've never played RPG game other than the isometric perspective.
 
joy.kafka
0

0

So far, I love this game. It brings me back to the classic games of old where using your brain rather than reflexes gets you the win. 110.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 mars 2020
Ein eher klassisches Rollenspiel mit ganz eigenem Scharm. Die Kämpfe sind taktisch und die unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten der Gruppe sind motivierend und laden zum Ausprobieren ein. Ein anderes Highlight sind die viele Rätsel in der Welt, die teilweise einfach aber auch echt knifflig sein können. Die Atmosphäre ist mit ihren Liedern sehr stimmig und abseits der Wege gibt es immer wieder etwas zu entdecken.

Man muss sich aber auch auf das Spiel einlassen. Das Tempo ist für heutige Verhältnisse gemächlich, die Story eher Rahmenwerk und die technische Umsetzung nicht immer die Beste. Auch können die Rätsel manchmal frustrierend sein, wenn man die Hinweise übersieht und dadurch in der Geschichte nicht weiterkommt.

killk Brisetrogne
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
68.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mars 2020
Get ready for an epic tale, engaging turnbased combat, RPG squad progression, and er...managing save points?
The game spins a good story across many hours, with decent characters and dialogue, it's just a shame a lot of those hours are running back to the nearest save point.
It boggles the mind that they put this mechanic in there, instead of a save-anywhere approach. And to make matters worse, the majority of save points are temporarily single use. What this means is that there are a few save-anytime points throughout the game. So once you've used all your nearby single-use saves you have to go back to these save-anytime points or go through a map transition to re-gen all the save points. And as combat takes so long, and each battle can easily turn south fast, there is no way you wouldn't save after every battle. So this means the further you get into an area or dungeon, the longer the run both back and forth from the save points become, and you are forced to start to develop strategies as to how best to manage the save points so you can minimise run back. It's incredibly frustrating, and only gets worse the further you get in a dungeon/area, and so it really kills the pace of the game altogether.
The game also lacks a 'retreat from combat' option which would migitate this somewhat, so if you realised it was going south you could turn tail and run (like in the recent Divinity game) but instead once you're in combat you're either going to be victorious or go all the way back to your last save, whenever that was.
It's hateful to have to go on about this but it really is a constant issue that holds the game backa and certainly would knock a few points off the score for me.
I feel this game lacks a certain direction as a whole, as if it was designed by multiple groups in isolation. There seems to have been no creative director to tie everything together, as some other mechanics are half baked as well. There's a crafting system (because it's a game in the last ten years, so of course there is), where you can collect recipes from the world/on level up. Good idea in theory, but half of what you can craft is food. Food is only used to restore hitpoints. But you can't use it in battle, and every save restores all of your hitpoints, so there's literally no point in food in the game at all!
You also collect a bunch of seeds and the game never explains what they're for either.
The inventory system is also really clunky, it really fights you at every turn to figure out whether a weapon/piece of armour is worth holding onto. Example - when in the merchant screen, you can't compare armour/weapons with what your guys have equipped. You have to extra the merchant screen, extracate yourself from the conversation, go into your inventory and compare the item to your characters one by one, then back back to the merchant, reopen the conversation, and navigate to the buy/sell screen again.
This game is crying out for some quality of life fixes. It also does a fairly poor job of figuring out what battles are appropriate for you. And this is a problem early on when you have access to a large area with both tough and easy fights scattered about. The game gives you a warning as to the projected difficulty as you approach each one, but I have struggled in green 'easy' battles and absolutely cake-walked red 'suicide' battles.
Another gripe, and this is a minor spoiler but early on you send off a character to run an errand, and he literally never returns to your squad again! No warning, no nothing. It meant I struggled through the early mid-section without a single warrior in my party, only squishy bards and wizards!

But enough ranting, I actually did get a lot of enjoyment out of this game. In terms of RPG mechanics it's pretty good.
The characters do not improve naturally on a level up. Rather, on leveling up you can guide your characters through a number of skilltrees, which vary depending on the character's class which is preset when you meet them. There are some overlap between these skilltrees between classes, but there's just enough variety to keep it interestign. And progressing along these trees allow you to gain access to wearing better armour (bulk of your HP will come from), or gain bonuses to your strength, constitution or intelligence, or gain some passive or active abilities, or even extra 'opportunity'.
To explain what opportunity is, the combat system needs explained. It's actually really fun although it isn't for everyone.
Basically both you and your opponent face off on a 2x4 grid, with up to 6 characters in your party and up to 8 enemies, though more can spawn in, either as part of the current battle, or as part of a second or third 'wave' after you beat all current opponents. Positioning is very important as a lot of your abilities have limited range. And instead of each character taking turns, you take a turn and then your opponents does. And during your turn you have a set amount of action points (opportunity) that is shared among your team, allowing you to trigger as many abilities as you have the cost to spend, but that will likely be a lot less than what your team members could do - so picking and choosing which actions to take and in what order is very important. Wizards and bards can also build up spell points on an individual basis that can be used to trigger other abilities without spending opportunity.

I played on second hardest, and to be honest it was pretty spot on in terms of combat difficulty. It started out really difficult and I had to pick my battles, and maximise my use of abilities, and scrimp and save to afford the next weapon that would give me a leg up. And even still I was often destroyed. But by the late-mid to end I smashed through most encounters first time. But even then, a good majority of them are a challenge, and I had to carefully think through my strategy to pull through. It really feeds into that power curve fantasy.
Puzzles are another strong point in the game. They are literally everywhere! This may turn some off but I really enjoyed them. The game does a great job of explaining the rules of the puzzles bit by bit until you're tackling fairly convoluted ones. At least all the main quests puzzles are challenging but never too difficult to hold you back for too long.
And special note needs to be given to the audo, as it is amazing! So many celtic songs sung throughout, very good voice acting, and engaging battle and enemy sounds.
In terms of story progression the game has a habit of telling instead of showing, but that doesn't distract too much from the story beats.

Overall there are some caveats, but this is still a firm recommendation.
 
johntohill
1,962 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
94.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mars 2020
BT 4 DC gets high marks for atmosphere, including sound handling. A bard playing in an upstairs room not only sounds softer, but even a bit muffled from the basement below. The puzzles are challenging but fun: non-puzzle fans have an option to skip them so they won't get stuck anywhere. This game was a real bargain on sale, but I wouldn't be disappointed even at regular price.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
83.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 février 2020
I want to like this game. I really do! I played through the original Bard's Tale trilogy, defeated Mangar in his tower, reforged the Destiny Wand and beat Lagoth Zanta, returned to the burned remains of Skara Brae and shed tears over the fallen heroes of old, then traversed the seven realms to finally take the fight to the Mad God Tarjan himself.

So a fourth Bard's Tale game is right up my alley! The story is excellent and engaging, and the combat is fun and intuitive. All the little details really help to want to love this game, like how the ruins of old Skara Brae more or less use the well-known map of Skara Brae as a reference, and Sinister Street! Being able to go BEYOND Skara Brae! All the little lore touches; it's a love letter to old-skool gamers like myself.

I really WANT to like this game and recommend it, but I can't due to one tremendous game-breaking bug. If anything happens to your system while you're autosaving it will corrupt your save file. Most games get around this by having multiple saves, but somehow this corrupts your ENTIRE save line, forcing you to start from scratch. It's frustrating in the extreme to put in hours of work and see it vanish in a puff,

If they are able to fix this issue, I'll gladly change my reviuew, because the game itself is VERY good, but at this point I can't in good conscience recommend it.
 
Michael Lemmons
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
152.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2020
Normally I don't like RPG games, but this one is really nice.
The environment is fantastic.
A lot of effort was put in voices, music, personalities, sceneries and puzzles.
Especially the puzzles were fun, well most of them. Some were so difficult,
I had to chexk the internet for the solution.
The fighting system is turn based, and easy to use.
You can level up your players using the experience points you earn with winning a fight.
The bard interlude, explaining to its audience was is going on,
after loading a level, was a nice touch,

The end of the game has a flaw, I think. If you do not go in with the correct team, or missing items (like a drinking nap for your bard, so you can stun the enemy by drinking),
you are out of luck, because the enemy is insanely strong, and can regain more health than you can eliminate. I had to watch youtube to see how level barrows deep can be completed.
But all by all a fun game, and certainly worth its money. Can't wait for Bard's Tale 5.
 
stack
0

A fun strategic puzzle RPG with an enormous, convoluted world and gorgeous atmospherics. And must have spent moths generating voice acting, three albums worth of soundtrack and ambient songs. It's really an impressive amount of art with a rich and deep combat system.

Recommandé
60.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2020
no crashes or bugs so far (47 hrs in game) and wow, it's so much fun to play. the riddles are rewarding and optional. the fighting system is clever. The look is oldschool but with many different locations, enemies and towns. BTDC is the first person turn based classic rpg that I was looking for so long. not so much like operencia or simular gridbased games but more like wizardry 8 without the complexity. After reading all those *meh*- comments about the game I am very happy that I gave it a chance. give it a try.

69.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2020
Absolutely loving this game. The exploration, combat, and puzzles are very fun and the perfect difficulty (though I am playing on Hard or Legendary difficulty for most combats). The world and characters are all very interesting.

My only gripes are inventory management and a few bugs that I've encountered, such as an event not being triggered making me unable to progress (loaded a previous save to fix this) and completed puzzles resetting upon leaving and re-entering areas sometimes.

1,390.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 février 2020
There are times when you get a bit stuck and the game seems too hard, but that's often because you need to change your party or characters' abilities. There's little room for farming, which I feel as a welcoming change to most games that simply allow you to advance in the game after grinding out rather than figuring your way through things.
The humor is pretty good, the story line pays enough homage to the original series with just enough originality.

Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2020
After playing the original Bard's Tales 1-3 on A C-64 long ago , I kind of knew what I was in for. Some people give a low rating of Bard's Tale 4 due to the puzzles , etc. The Bard's Tales were always about puzzles , traps , tricks more so than the actual combat , mixed with a whole lot of fun and bad puns.
Bard's Tale 4 carries on precisely the concepts behind the first 3 .
Excellent game , InXile.

0
Non recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2019
Did they improve the things I hated in the first iteration of The Bard's Tale 4? Not really. A huge plus is being able to limit the repetitive puzzles in the game, which after you have seen 3 you have seen them all. Your choices for what your character looks like have not improved which is very limited and a lame.

Combat remains a neat system and the character building is quite good. You are not going to have much loot or equipment but everything you do have will be important.

If you are approaching this for the first time and like repetitive puzzles with a more celtic feel, maybe you'll like this game.

I played through a fair amount of the first iteration and unfortunately you cannot port your game over to the director's cut. I do not like the game so much that I want to repeat 20+ hours of game play. I cannot recommend this game.
 
Darkurthe
454 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
284.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2019
Ich spiele erst 26 Stunden, aber ich möchte doch schon mal ein Zwischenfazit ziehen:

Erstmal kurz: Das Game macht irre Spass! (Suchtgefahr ;-)

Die positiven Punkte:
  • Das Gameplay (RTS):
    Das Kampfsystem macht Laune (Wenn man mit Maus+Tastatur spielt).
    Wenn Gegner oder meine Gruppe ihre Kommentare im Fight abgeben, kann ich mir manchmal ein breites Grinsen nicht verkneifen.
    Auch verführt die Kampfmusik mich immer zu einem Schunkeln auf meinem Stuhl sowie zum mitsummen, Klasse!
    Daher freue ich mich jedes Mal, wenn Gegner auftauchen.

  • Leveldesign:
    Die Level sind interessant gestaltet, mit vertikalen Ebenen.
    (War allerding nur in der Stadt mit unterer Ebene sowie den Turm von ... weiss den Namen nicht mehr)

  • Sound bzw. Musik:
    Teilweise sehr gute Ambientsounds im Levelgebiet oder Dungeon.
    Die Musik, die für mich ein bisschen an irische/schottische Folklore erinnert, ist stimmig.
    Kann aber für den einen oder anderen auch gewöhnungsbedürftig bzw. nervig sein:
    Z.B. im Abenteurer-Unterschlupf in der Stadt, wenn der Barde Rabbit zu seiner Klampfe greift. Dieses Lied nerft mich nur noch, da es sich immer wiederholt und auch nicht meinen Musikgeschmack trifft.

  • Steuerung bzw. GUI:
    Wie es sich für mich zu einem RTS-Game gehört, sind die Menus bzw. Inventar mit Maus und Tastatur gut zu bedienen.
    Wer hier mit Controller spielt, muss ein Masochist am PC sein ;-)

  • Charakterentwicklung (Skillen):
    Ich freue mich jedesmal auf den Stufenaufstieg, damit ich meine Gruppe und mich stärker machen kann. Das Skillsystem ist in Ordnung und ist gut bedienbar.
    Man kann alle Gruppenmitglieder mitskillen, denn sie leveln mit.

  • Gruppenmitglieder (Banter):
    Manchmal geben die Gruppenmitglieder während der Erkundung köstliche Kommentare ab. Erinnert mich bisschen an Dragon-Age origins.

c
Die "neutralen" Punkte:
  • Die Story:
    Dazu kann ich noch nicht viel sagen, da ich noch am Anfang des Spiels bin.

  • Die Grafik:
    Ist nicht auf den neuesten Level, ist aber für mich nicht wichtig.
    Das interressante Leveldesign macht es meiner Meinung wieder wett.


Die negativen Punkte:
  • Leider keine deutsche Vertonung. Wenigsten sind die Untertitel gut übersetzt.

  • Die Dialoge:
    Normalerweise höre ich mir in einem RPG/RTS jeden Dialogsatz gerne an, weil ich dadurch in der Welt tief eintauchen kann.
    Jedoch geben die NPC's teilweise in "einem Antwortsatz" komplette Geschichten von sich (Im Untertitel erschlägt mich dann eine Textwüste).
    Will sagen, die Dialoge verführen mich manchmal dazu, alles schnell weg zu klicken.
    Es kann vielleicht auch daran liegen, dass die deutsche Syncro fehlt und ich die Untertitel schneller lese, als gesprochen wird. Mein English ist eben nicht so gut.
  • Balancing:
    Ich bin jetzt mittlerweile im Endgame und leider habe ich Probleme mit den Resourcen für
    das Crafting von Heiltränken/Alkohol/Bomben.
    Es gibt anscheinend kein Respawn der Pflanzen bzw. kein Auffüllen der Händlerinvetare.
    Das macht natürlich die Kämpfe u8ngleich schwieriger.



Also, wer auf rundenbasierte RPG's steht, sollte hier zugreifen.
Ist für mich eine kleine Perle.
 
p.ohrem

Évaluation publiée le 22 octobre 2019
If you are a fan of role playing games than you should really enjoy this game. There is the occasional bug here and there but at the end of the day I say to myself..am i having fun playing. The answer is yes even after 30+ hours in. Great combat system. Good voice acting. Diverse character abilities. The puzzles are well executed although there are quite a few of them. I do wish the mix of combat to puzzles was more weighted towards combat. Other than that, i think its an overall great and fun game.

Mikos
374 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
43.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2019
When this game first came out I gave it a negative review because it had a lot of bugs, questionable mechanics decisions, and seemed to be missing content. I stopped playing the game a few hours in. They got a lot of bad reviews, which I guess is why the Directors Cut is sold as a separate game, I can't even find my negative review.

BUT after the recent launch of the Directors Cut I gave it another chance and have enjoyed it a lot. It now feels like the game it was supposed to be. Keep in mind that puzzles are a big part of this game, not just combat, though they've added some features to skip the puzzles if you want (you are missing a big part of what you are paying for if you do though). The combat is fun, difficulty is well balanced, and character customization is deep enough to keep you hooked on getting to the next level.
 
pbdunton

69.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 septembre 2019
It's a solid old-school dungeon crawler. Enjoying the combat and puzzles quite a bit. Only negative so far, (just cleared the first dungeon), is that I've run into a bug where I can't collect some of the pre-purchase digital bonus weapons. That *is* a bummer, but not game-breaking by any means.

--------------------
Updated review, having finished the game:

Overall this is not a bad game, but it does have some flaws that mar the experience.
Progression is kind of unbalanced, and by the middle of the game it's pretty easy to walk over all the encounters once you've got good gear and figured out the most effective combos. Combat gets a tad repetitive from about the middle of the game on. The economy also kind of goes out the window at this point in the game. You'll get to a point where you stop picking up gear because you don't need the gold and there's nothing for you to spend it on.

I enjoyed the puzzles quite a bit, and there were a couple that stumped me, requiring some googling; most of them are pretty fair though.

I really liked the soundtrack; if you like Celtic folk music you'll probably enjoy it.

So overall, I'd give it a B minus.
 
beeofdoom
