Recommandé
20.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2019
REVISED REVIEW

Ok, so the last time I attempted to play this was just after developers released the big DC update and was majorly disappointed by how bad the graphics looked.

With the lastest patch, this appears to have been rectified and the characters and environments look less washed out, with appropriate shadowing present as originally presented. Some of the NPC character models still look a tad cartoony, but for me, it's not earth shattering and can be easily overlooked.

While I am still yet to progress a bit more until I get outside of Skara Brae to see what else on offer with the new DC, I can safely say that I would recommend this game.


ORIGINAL REVIEW

I will never understand for the life of me,why the developers thought it would be a great idea to downgrade the graphics for the PC version and release it saying that is an "improvement". I played through the first five minutes and the DC version is a downgraded, washed out piece lacking in colour and detail that the original version had.

Yeah, ok, the graphics in the original was not going to set the world on fire. But this - it's like someone stuck a fire under it and melted all the colour and detail out of it. While playing for only 5 minutes may not be enough to give it a chance, this is NOT the product that I supported when it made it's first appearance on kickstarter.

Like many others who were looking forward to this, this is a huge slap in the face and an absolute let down. :( I simply cannot bring myself to play this version. inXile - if you read and can even be remotely bothered to listen to the fans, please fix the problem that you have created. I will be more than happy to provide a positive review should this be recified.
 
Bignutt
324 produits enregistrés
0

Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2019
I've been playing this and find it great fun. It isn't perfect but it is certainly worth playing.

The game is more puzzle orientated than most people would expect and that is something to consider. The combat is fun and engaging. Since the DC the performance is much better as well.

A very solid 8/10 from me.

54.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
I just beat the Bard's Tale 4 and what an excellent game it was! It is rough in areas but once you get past the roughness you find a real gem! The world, aesthetic, gameplay, and characters are all fantastic. I love the Scottish setting and all the weird and quirky characters. I recommend this game to most dungeon crawler fans, rpg fans, and especially puzzle fans. If you are not into puzzles this game is not for you. But anyways, I loved this game and I'm glad I bought it! I plan to replay it once I've processed everything.

Recommandé
13.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
To their credit - inXile Entertainment has implemented EVERY single quality of life improvement that I (and many others) asked for in the forums and reviews. To have a developer actually LISTEN to the players puts them at the top of my trust list. I know there are some inXile haters out there who won't give them a positive rating no matter how good a game is - but I am not one of them. I was burned and disappointed by the first clumsy, unforgiving iteration of Bard's Tale IV. My review of that first offering was scathing and negative. This review is to applaud inXile for listening to their audience and actually making the changes we wanted to see. The original Bard's Tale IV was a 3 out of 10. This new Director's Cut is a 8.5 out of 10 for me. The only thing I cannot fathom is the Dwarven characters. In the opening sequence, we see at least one traditional looking bearded Dwarf sitting before the hearth listening to the bard.. but in the game, Dwarves look like tall, beardless pale-skinned ogre-like abominations with deep, monstrous voices. These aren't Dwarves. I like traditional Dwarves. These things more akin to Trolls or Ogres. That just bothers me... and also - just because the town is called Skara Brae - you don't have to make everyone act like their Scottish with Scottish brogues and kilts and bagpipes singing Gaelic songs and the like. These are EARTH stereotypes - not fantasy world stereotypes. That just throws me off - I feel like I'm in an episode of OUTLANDER. Other than those meaningless triflings - I LOVE the new version. Thank you for listening to us inXile!
 
mythmaker
0

Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2019
When you can get a mix of old school and modern gaming mechanics together for an adventure I'm always happy. It may not be in a polished state at the moment, but from what I have played so far I like it. Let's hope the bugs get fixed in a timely manner and a wee more polish and tweaks are performed, if I could rate this game at what it tries to be it's a 9 but atm a 6 due to it's current state.
